description:
This is by far and away my favorite sushi restaurant in San Francisco. I drive all the way from across the city to eat here at least once a month. Personally I love all of their Maki rolls, especially the specialty ones that would fetch a 50% mark up back on the other side of town! Most of the specialty rolls are under $10. Personally favorite is the Volcano roll- A California roll with salmon on top, and a spicy sauce and a sweet aioli. The gyoza is also excellent and comes with a spicy soy sauce. 

Best of all, the service is quick, efficient, and friendly, with complimentary tea and edamame.
author: Tim Y.

description:
I won't blame you if you don't believe this review. But everything I'm about to say is true.

Tazaki is a well-known neighborhood institution, which usually hits the mark with fresh fish and flavorful food.

They have very reasonable prices for all of their items. 

Last night I decided to try something new, and I got the tazaki house clams. This was about $15 and had probably 18 to 20 clams in it. It was a tasty thick soy-based sauce, chock full of onions and some pieces of garlic.

I had already eaten a huge lunch so I didn't eat very much of my food. I sat there talking to my friend for a long time and then I asked the waiter for a to-go container.

Instead of him bringing me out of to-go container he brought my bowl of clams to the back. Then he brought me back a half pint plastic container filled with my leftovers. Or so I thought...

I just opened up the leftovers container and what did I find within it? THREE CLAMS. Literally THREE CLAMS. 

The rest was just the sauce and onions. I double checked with my friend to make sure I wasn't going crazy and she said she remembered as clear as day that I had approximately half of my clams left.

I love clams, and I'm positive since I was looking directly at my dish between my friend and I the entire dinner, that I know how many clams were left. That means that the waiter kept almost three quarters of my remaining clams! 

Well, that's my story. I'm irritated, but also kind of in disbelief.
author: Grizzle J.

description:
So sad to have to leave this review. We have been bi-weekly patrons for the past two years and have noticed that the food and service quality have taken a dramatic tumble in the past three months. I suspect that the restaurant is under new management - my last meal here left me with a lurching stomach and I have no intentions of being back.

It was good while it lasted, Tazaki, and for that I am grateful.
author: Michael C.

description:
Did ownership change? The food quality is not as good, menu prices have gone up significantly, and they now charge a fee for paying with a credit card called a "standard price adjustment." Let's be clear, it's a 4% surcharge for paying with a credit card. Using ambiguous language does not hide what they are doing. BTW, the average merchant transaction fee charged by credit card companies is 2% not 4%.
Also, do not use the suggested tip guide printed on the bill, unless you don't mind paying tip on sales tax! Greed has replaced customer service.  My last meal here.
author: E F.

description: This hidden gem in the sunset is one of the best bang for your buck sushi spots on the west side of SF. Delicious, fresh sashimi and nigiri at a very affordable price with outstanding service and a welcoming atmosphere. The sushi chefs behind the bar are very knowledgeable in satisfying your palate and can make recommendations on the daily catch and the highest quality cuts of fish. The hamachi is outstanding, as well as some of the rolls. Our server Shirley was exceptionally helpful and was able split our large group of 6 into separate checks and always had a bright smile. I will be returning to Tazaki to curb my sushi cravings in the future.
author: Charles W.

description:
I love my high-end omakase sushi spots in the city, but honestly, don't you just crave some good ol sushi rolls once in a while? Welp, look no further. This will be your neighborhood sushi spot. Tbh, best bang for your buck sushi spot in the avenues!It's honestly my go-to whenever I'm craving some regular wknight sushi, but don't want to pay an arm and a leg for it. And this is def not the most authentic sushi spot by any means (Chinese-run). But the food quality is good for what it is. 

Be warned. The restaurant runs small, they take a ton of to-go orders, and seating can take a little longer if you come at peak hrs. I've waited 20+mins before. But, they're also pretty efficient as soon as you're seated. Edamame and hot teas/water come out within mins. 

My go-to dishes here typically vary btw a fish special (love the sea bass), clam ramen (TONS of clams), 49er roll (salmon, lemon, scallops...none of that fake crab crap), sunset roll (uni!!), various nigiris (toro, amaebi, uni, etc), and sashimi salad (this is MASSIVE). I've never had anything here that's disappointed me. I personally don't like my rolls or salads overdressed so I do ask for either no sauce or sauce on the side. My last visit, I forgot to ask and my salad was def overdressed. Other than that, everything was great. 

Expect to spend $35-$40pp. Will continue to return! 4 stars.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Solid, reasonably priced Japanese food for any night of the week. The sushi is good for when you have a hankering for Japanese food, but do not want to pay $$$$ (or even $$$) for it. The Tazaki combination meal gives you the best variety and bang for your buck and you will be full!
author: Hedan Z.

description:
Yelp, you let me down on this one. :(

We were in the mood for sushi and needed a place that was a.) close by my friend's neighborhood and b.) open on a Sunday afternoon. Found Tazaki Sushi on Yelp and it seemed promising. 

I opted for the chirashi since the presentation looked pretty impressive. They put a lot of thought into the execution, but unfortunately the chirashi itself was average/mediocre. They were very generous with the fish, I will give them that. 

Fish quality is what you would expect from an average casual sushi restaurant. There are a ton of other affordable spots in the city that serve better quality fish. The biggest disappointment was the uni, which I had to spit out upon first taste. It did NOT taste right and I'm positive I would have gotten sick from it. The sushi rice was so mushy, I could have picked up a huge chunk of it with my chopsticks. 

To add salt to the wound, the menu displays prices if you pay with cash. There's an extra charge of you pay with credit card, FYI.
author: Laverne N.

description:
Not to many Japanese restaurants open Sunday for lunch especially in the avenues.  Yelped and found Tazaki rated 4 stars and over 100 reviews.  Decided to take the Wife and Mother-in-Law here for lunch.

Walked in and saw the place was half full at noon and filling up.  Good sign.

Restaurant has a nice Sumo mural on the wall and covers two store fronts.  Service was good and polite.  We received Edamame to start and ordered Agedashi Tofu, Dragon Maki, Lion King Roll, Tobitama Nigiri Sushi, and a Curry Pork Katsu with Rice.

The Tofu was hot right out of the fryer with a lot of bonito flakes.  The sauce was a little saltier than we like but still good.  Liked the Dragon Maki which had a good crunchy and not soggy shrimp tempura in the roll with unagi on top.  Lion King Roll was topped with a mayo sauce that could have been a little sweeter.  Katsu was tasty and plentiful and Tobitama was perfect.

Will be back to try dinner.
author: Scott L.

description:
My new favorite local sushi restaurant! I'm so thrilled that we can walk to Tazaki from our house.

It has a sweet, local, familial vibe. Everyone was very friendly and warm (Thursday night 8pm).

We had the corner spot at the bar and happened to be just underneath the speaker, and giggled a bit at the blaring advertisements. Music was an amusing mix of today's radio hits with some '80s mixed in. It was cute.

I absolutely loved everything I tried. In this order:

Oyako Sushi (salmon, salmon roe)

Eclipse Sushi (tuna, black caviar, quail egg, tobiko). Gorgeous and melting-in-the-mouth.

The Spoon -- a spoonful of oyster, uni, quail egg and tobiko. (I first tried this exact combination at Live Sushi in Potrero. It's very different at Tazaki, with the oyster being much more flavorful. I liked it a lot, but felt the oyster slightly overpowered the other ingredients.)

49er Maki (scallop, salmon, lemon). Exquisite.

P.S.
The menu on Google isn't complete. They have a lot more. See the menu photos on Yelp.
author: Camille L.

description:
Heard their rolls were legit, and we were not disappointed! 

Ordered the Crazy Maki (yellowtail and eel) for $9.95,  the Pink Lady Maki (blue fin tuna and salmon) for $12.95, Snow Fuji Maki (spicy tuna and walu) for $12.95, and the Sweet Heart Maki (unagi and blue fin tuna) for $14.95.

I liked the Sweet Heart best - I love tuna and unagi so this was an easy favorite for me. The Pink Lady was my second favorite but I didn't like the sauce they put on top- it wasn't necessary. Finally I liked the Snow Fuji then the Crazy Maki. Felt the Crazy Maki was a bit bland for me and not complex enough. 

What I liked best about this place is that they put a very thin layer of rice and alot of fish. A lot of places have way too much rice so I was happy with the ratio. Felt I was getting my money's worth.

Staff were very nice and attentive and my tea never got empty or cold!
author: Mandi W.

description:
I'd like to preface this review by saying that before I started writing reviews on Yelp, I've had great experiences here. Yesterday was not one of them.

My fiance and I came at 5:30 P.M. on a Thursday evening and had dinner sitting in the tatami mat area, which was neat. We've been wanting to come here for weeks for the sake steamed clams that we were craving, and were disappointed to find out that they had been sold out. We ordered the sizzling walu, creamy roll, and Romeo and Juliet roll. I've only ever had walu as sashimi and not cooked, so we asked the waitress how the sizzling walu is. She gave us this weird look and said it was good, and threw up her hands as if saying "I mean, what do you want me to say?". I wanted to know how the taste, texture, maybe even portion compare with the other sizzling fish options. And it's okay if all she said was that the fish was good, but I could have skipped on the attitude.

The creamy roll was described on the menu as being "deep fried scallop and spicy tuna". We thought that it meant that only the scallop was deep fried, not the entire roll. Since I don't like cooked and warm sushi rolls, I wasn't a fan of this or the mayo that was on top of it. 
The Romeo and Juliet roll was amazing, however. The blue fin tuna and salmon were slightly seared, and the tuna deliciously melted in my mouth. The scallop was very fresh as well. We would definitely order this again.

When the sizzling fish came out, it was incredibly dry and the fish was a rough texture. It was actually pretty terrible. I was so surprised because walu is a really buttery fish when raw, but since I had never had cooked walu, I didn't know what to expect. Taste was good though, and because of this, my fiance and I were eating the bean sprouts more than we were eating the fish itself. When another waitress stopped by our table to ask us if everything was okay, I told her this and she just apologized and left. And that was okay, since I wasn't asking to have the dish switched or replaced - I was just being honest when she asked me how my food was. When the bill came, I saw on the receipt that the fish order that was put in was actually HALIBUT. That explained a lot, and we brought it up to the attention of a waitress. She apologized and seemed to want to leave it at that, so I asked her what she was going to do about this. She came back with the menu and showed me that the prices were the same, as if to say that since we weren't being charged more than the original item that we had ordered, it was no big deal. But the point is that we were not given what we had ordered, and what we were given was bad - if the halibut had been great, we would have definitely let it slide. She then tried to push making another sizzling walu dish for us, but we were full at this point and didn't want to wait for the kitchen to make a to-go order for us. Finally, she said she'd just take the item off the bill.

The waiter at the restaurant was great about refilling our teas and giving us two ice creams. Our dinner overall wasn't terrible and we still had an enjoyable time, but besides the Romeo and Juliet roll, the food was very subpar, we were given the wrong entree, and I didn't feel like it was a priority of the staff to address customer concerns or questions. There was a loud constant chopping sound from the kitchen that was a little bothersome. On top of all this, there was a sign on our table saying that all menu prices were "cash discount prices", and that meals not paid with cash would be subject to an extra fee - I've never been to a place that does this, and it was off-putting.
author: Nicole M.

description:
Quality of food is ok. This is NOT an authentic Japanese restaurant. Service is lacking. You have to ask in order for things to happen. Wait staff are not very friendly neither. 

They have a sign of price adjustment for "non-cash purchase". They only changed their menu about 8 months ago. I didn't see any posted pricing schedule as they claimed. I thought the prices look the same. They added adjustment fee if you don't pay with cash. Is it legal? Is it a way to under-report their revenue when filing taxes?
author: Elm E.

description:
It's been four years since my last review and I have nothing but good things to say about Tazaki. It's a neighborhood gem where locals can still get a table on weekends. 

We frequently order exclusively off of the nigiri and special roll list, which is the sheet of paper they hand you when you sit down. For three people, a bunch of nigiri, a few special rolls, a couple cups a tea and a couple orders of matcha ice cream, the total comes to around $85 after tax and tip. I consider this good considering just how expensive the high-end sushi places are. Ever go to Kirala in Berkeley? Amazing sushi, top-notch service, but also VERY expensive. Tazaki gets you all the deliciousness for a lot less money.

Staff are always so friendly when we visit and they are always there when we need something. 

I'll continue to eat plentifully at Tazaki every time I'm in town, which is at least 6-8 times a year.
author: Andrew L.

description:
I typically come here for the chirashi bowl and nothing else so this rating is purely based on that.  The quality of the sashimi is fresh and delicious.  Marveling at the variety of fish, I couldn't be more satisfied with the abundant display layered on top of the bed of rice.  

The chirashi comes with three slices of salmon, shrimp, yellow tail, tuna, butterfish and halibut.  To top it off, there are also slices of lemon, avocado, salmon roe, tamago, and uni.  Did you catch that?  YES, it comes with uni.  You definitely get what you pay for and more.  

I'm surprised to see so many reviews complaining about the service because the waiters were nice and prompt on each occasion I've been here.
author: Derek L.

description:
Very disappointed and sad to give 2 stars as this use to be my 5 Star go-to/ quick sushi restaurant --especially since it's so convenient in terms of parking compared to all the sunset sushi spots. 

Idk if they're under new management or what but someone please justify how a subpar bento is $20?? I ordered over the phone so I take ownership for not checking prices but that's because no bento should be over $20 unless you're getting thick ass sashimi slices & a specialty roll or something. Mind you all I have is 4 SKIMPY slices of salmon, chicken teriyaki, & tempura. 

Plenty of great sushi spots in the sunset & even San Mateo if you want to spend over 20 for a basic box. 

Very sad to say I am hesitant to come back. I would face taravel & 9th Avenue parking struggles before justifying paying the new ridiculous prices. 

IGNORE THE PICS OF THE WHITE MENU-- the better but sadly outdated menu. Current one is the whack black & red menu with prices that don't match the quality of food
author: Kristen J.

description:
I love my local sushi joint SO much. Tazaki is the nicest sushi chef in town. His fish is meltingly fresh. People are surprised to find such complex dishes in the Outer Sunset (our secret!) Hands down - they have the best 49ers Roll in the City. I think they use scallops for it! 

Sit at the bar and make friends with the chefs. They'll treat you to heavenly samples.
author: Dyanna Q.

description:
Wasn't bad but was too expensive for the value imo. Pricing is standard for sf but quality is on the lower end. I also felt service was lacking, slow, and the waiters weren't that friendly to us. I don't think the fish was fresh so I absolutely wouldn't order raw fish here. 

Roll: I had one piece and I knew I would get sick if I ate more of the fish so I didn't eat anymore. It was super fishy and the texture was mushy. 1/5
Bento: we chose teriyaki chicken and tempura. These were okay but I didn't think they were anything special. 3/5
Crispy salmon skin: this is skin only (which I expected but my friend expected it to be salmon with crispy skin). It was nice and crispy but the large pieces just aren't really interesting by themselves and wasn't particularly satisfying in anyway. 3/5
author: Anna N.

description:
Great sushi, fresh and delicious. Free edamame for appetizer. Sometimes the rolls are a bit crammed on tin one plate but who cares. Photos can speak for themselves.

However, when it is busy, it is hectic and it requires waving down wait staff for taking the order, refills, and the check. 

I would give it 4 stars but had to subtract a star because prices listed are CASH prices. I guess it's their way around saying they charge a credit card fee but of course they can't say that by law. The fee % is not posted anywhere either.

Also, it is extremely rude for the waitress to grab the bill before you leave. Extra rude when she looks at it on the way back to the register. Staff needs a bit of training but the food is good so I will keep coming back.
author: Zee B.

description:
CREDIT CARD USER BEWARE! 

I cannot believe what had happen to me.. I been coming here for at least 3 years, 4-5 times a year. This is the first time they charge for a credit card fee. Hear me out. 

I placed a $72 sushi order to go. When I got there, the lady confirmed my order and showed me the receipts for $72 and some change. I gave her my card. I got an alert that I was charged $75 and some changed (yes, I get alert on my phone). When I got the receipt to signed, I asked her why I got charged more than what she told me. She said we charge a fee if you don't pay in cash. I told her What?!? That's illegal! She said well you can pay in cash. I told her you need to inform people when you charge more than what was told. Unbelievable. Really?!?? 

Again!!!! Credit card reward. I hate dishonest people!!! Don't worry. I'm reporting this transaction. It's freakin ILLEGAL!!!
author: Jasmin T.

description: They use real crab in their rolls and the fish is great quality every time. I don't need to go anywhere else for affordable and delicious sushi.
author: Harrison K.

description: Food: mediocre at best. The up charge for using a card: Stupid. They calculate tip and up charge based on total including tax. It's bullshit. I'd rather get sushi delivered to home with these prices. Sakesan on ubereats it is!
author: Ana-Marie U.

description: The food here is A-OK. I wish it was open for lunch so I can get my sushi on in the afternoon. I've been here a few times and they have all been enjoyable, except for that one time where this lady kept on asking if I wanted to date one of her friends at the bar. The interaction between us was quite funny and I actually enjoyed that as well, except I couldn't eat the last piece of my sushi in peace.
author: Sam Y.

description:
CA roll: Emma says "only 4 stars because not too yummy but good still"

Unagi roll: Cameron says "it should be a little bigger but still very good"

Chicken karage: Emma and Cameron say "it was very good but needs more flavor and sauce". 

Ikura and hamachi: pretty good and fresh 

Ramen: a little too salty but not bad. Needed more authentic ingredients.
author: Paul t.

description:
I really enjoy sushi and my granddaughter takes me to my favorite place.  
I like lion king at this place.  Food is great and people are nice.
author: Bella N.

description: the terryaki is in large quantity but chicken is a little dry. Im too full to have ice cream though I do wonder what it be like.
author: Clare G.

description: Sushi not that good. Rice was pretty hard. Took 40+ minutes to get rice bowl with raw fish on top. You didn't even have to cook it so how could it take so long??
author: Scott F.

description:
TL;DR - Tazaki reminds me of a less glamorous, slightly cheaper (in price) version of Sakesan. The pieces of nigiri are HUGE, but there's nothing special about it other than that. Prices were an average $4/piece of nigiri, which is a steal! I admit I'm a bit of a sushi snob, but for those who aren't Tazaki is great bang for your buck for fresh sushi. 

The boyfriend and I stopped by Tazaki on a Sunday afternoon and was seated at the bar. Overall, the service was good and the server checked in on us 1 or 2 times while we were there.

For nigiri we had maguro, hamachi, kanpachi, tai, medai, hirame, walu, albacore and shima aji. I'm okay at identifying types of fish when I'm just handed a plate of nigiri, but I really couldn't tell between the hirame, tai, shima aji, and kanpachi....Which made me feel like they may have given me 2 types of nigiri vs 4, who knows! The slices of fish on each nigiri were gigantic! You could've easily made double (maybe even triple...) the nigiri had the fish been sliced thinner. The fish tasted fresh but was too warm XP... The rice was also warm, overcooked and didn't have enough vinegar. Because the cuts of fish were so thick and because there were no special garnishes or sauces used, I could taste the fishiness for a few nigiri -- chewing on that was borderline gross. 

We also ordered the Sky Roll, which I believe had tuna, albacore and walu and was topped with wasabi tobiko. Not a bad roll. Rolls were reasonable priced, with most under $10 before tax. 

We also got the Eclipse nigiri ($8 or so), which is rice wrapped with tuna and then topped with a quail egg and 2 types of tobiko. Meh, nothing special here. I expected more flavor, but it was very one-dimensional (texture-wise too).

I ordered The Spoon (oyster, quail egg, uni, tobiko + sauce, $7 or so) to try and uggggggggh. It was way too fishy tasting, like I licked a fish I just fished out of the ocean x__X!! I haven't had too many of these spoon/shooter-type things, but the ones I have tried use ponzu. This one...I don't even know what it was...Ponzu gone bad? Ponzu mixed with soy sauce? Whatever it was, it did nothing to help with the fishiness or enhance the flavors. AVOIDAVOIDAVOID if you don't like fishiness. 

For the mini feast we got, it was about $70 after tax and tip! And this is because we (meaning me) over-ordered. It easily could've been $20 cheaper had I practiced some self-control (NONEXISTENT when I'm hungry and holding a menu ho ho ho). 

The bottom line? I won't be back because I enjoy my nigiri made with more care and skill. However, I'd definitely recommend to those who enjoy sushi and aren't as picky as I am.
author: Doris K.

description:
Wish I had read these reviews before going back. This was my fifth or sixth, and last, time to dine here. As others have mentioned, there is a fee adjustment for non-cash payments but the "posted pricing structure" is nowhere to be found. On top of that, my table did NOT have the placard about this that others have mentioned, so I had no warning before or during ordering, or while dining, that the menu prices were for cash only. The menu itself does not mention this either. I was charged an "adjustment fee" of over 5% to use my debit card. If the placard had been on my table, or the menu had mentioned this, or the "posted pricing structure" had been posted, then I would likely not be posting this now and would quite likely return again.

Also noted that the restaurant's receipt listed the amount BEFORE the "adjument fee" was added as the amount paid by "C Card." In other words:
Amount Due: X
Receive (sic): X
C Card: X
Change: 0.00

My debit card receipt lists the adjustment. Why doesn't the restaurant's register receipt list it, too? Seems kind of odd.
author: I Like T.

description: Not great. I only liked one roll. Everything else was mediocre. The edemame was very old looking and very wet. The raddish was sweet. I guess the fish was great but it still wasn't great
author: Be L.

description: I'll start with food: We ordered 7 different rolls that were all presented and tasted the same. I was pretty sad because the reviews for this spot were awesome and I felt like I was just eating California rolls for days. They also let you know (by leaving a sign on the table) that they will charge you differently for using credit card instead of cash which was offsetting since we arrived and had no idea. They started cleaning before their customers had left so halfway through our dinner all we smelled were cleaning products. I really wanted to like this place and am sad that our experience wasn't good :(
author: Angella G.

description:
I live really close to this sushi restaurant, but just tried it out for the first time very recently. I wish I tried it out sooner!

The service here is fantastic, I've never had to wait for a table or wait for a long time for my food to come out. Also, if you place an order to-go it only takes 5-10 minutes. Further, the pricing is really reasonable and the food tastes great!

If you like Japanese food/sushi, I would recommend trying this place out!
author: James D.

description: Hip spot and fresh sushi! I'm docking a star because our dishes came out 20+ minutes apart, making us wait after every dish. Otherwise I love this place, I wish I lived closer.
author: Ana M.

description:
Sunset's best sushi
hands down; and traditional
Japanese hot plates
author: Brian J.

description:
The quality of the sashimi here is phenomenal. As a frequent customer here, I've gotten to know the owner of this restaurant and he is such a friendly gentleman!

I would highly recommend the chirashi bowl if you're a sashimi enthusiast.
author: Cheri C.

description:
I was expecting more out of this place, especially since it had such high ratings. We requested to dine on the floor. We took off our shoes and were sitting comfortable on the ground - or at least I was. My boyfriend hated sitting on the floor because he has super long legs.. 

Service was absolutely terrible. Took forever to give us menus.. took forever to even serve us water or tea. And we were so confused when we received the menu because there were no sushi rolls listed on it. Took forever again to get a waitress to bring us the additional menu. I wish we could have had our order ready because it took another eternity for them to come by and take our order.. If we knew we were going to receive little to no attention, we would've sat on the tables or at the sushi bar instead. 

We ordered the beef teriyaki and chicken teriyaki rice plate. We shared their dynamite roll which was spicy hamachi. Their rice places were decent and included salad, miso soup, and even free ice cream.

2 stars for the service we received here. But 3 1/2 for food.
author: Sydney C.

description:
The food was decent but everything else about this place threw me off.

When you walk in the restaurant looks like a Chinese casual cafe with a bunch of kids running around, then the other half is semi Japanese looking with the sushi bar and floor seating. Really weird. Anyways, what I really didn't like was the service...

I was excited to try this place because of the reviews. Took forever to get a table, they forgot to even give us a menu (I had to ask them and the waitress said "OH! sorry"), wish the menu had at least a few pictures for the rolls. Some of the descriptions weren't very accurate. I ordered something that had scallops and spicy tuna. It didn't mention anything else that would be in it or that it was deep fried. It was still good but would be nice to know what I ordered before it got to my table. The guy taking our order didn't really seem to understand English or anything we were saying. They also just kept refilling my tea but didn't ask if I wanted the check. Definitely need more attentive and competent people there...
author: Allison S.

description:
I can't believe I use to like this place. This is super disappointing. I will not be returning. DOWNHILL.

1. There was a long gap between every dish that came. 
2. I first received the Caterpillar roll, which was soggy.

*ANNOYING* 3. A roll we added 10 minutes after we ordered came BEFORE our sashimi combo. Don't forget a sashimi combo only consists of 12 pieces of sashimi. Overall, it was like a 25 minute wait for sashimi. 

*EXTREMELY ANNOYING* 4. The sashimi turns out to be the size of my FINGER. I am a 6 ring size (if that helps). Picture is posted. I waited for that...?

5. The roll we added (don't remember the name, but bottom of the list with tempura, eel and soft shell crab) was also not good. The imitation crab on top was dry. The roll is a cooked roll so I expected it to be a little warm at least. All cold.
6. The wait for food was HELLLLA long!!
7. THERE WERE THREE SUSHI CHEFS!!
8. IT WAS NOT EVEN BUSY!! About 5 tables only. 

The food was honestly not good. Not even slightly decent. This is not my first nor second time coming too. The sashimi I had today was definitely not like the other times I went. I definitely wasted my money today. 

The waitresses were nice and attentive. The preparation of the sashimi and sushi were horrendous. 

****This is THE WORST sushi experience I ever had in San Francisco.****

Tip- Go somewhere else. Save yourself the disappointment.
author: Darlene T.

description:
OVERALL: 3.5 stars! Tazaki Sushi offers decent tasting food for a reasonable price. The restaurant is a cute and casual spot with a nice local family feel.  

Service is excellent - the waiters are extremely friendly. There is a wide selection of sushi rolls (6 pieces each). They also offer nigiri sushi, soup, bento boxes, entrees. Entrees come with miso soup, salad, rice, and ice cream. Bento Box also includes miso soup, salad, rice, ice cream + 3 items of your choice from a list -- A GOOD DEAL. 

I'VE TRIED: Bento Box (my 3 items: Salmon Teriyaki, California Roll, 4 pieces of Salmon Sashimi), Salmon Teriyaki Entree, Deep Fried Scallops Entree, Spicy Tuna Roll, Lion King Roll, and Cherry Blossom Roll. Everything taste good and fills me up. The food isn't mind-blowing nor do I have anything bad to say. It is simply, "A-OKAY". 

I go to Tazaki Sushi if I'm in the area and need a quick sushi fix. It satisfies my sushi cravings and I feel content afterward, especially if I don't want to go to a high end sushi restaurant.
author: Kristal D.

description:
Amazing service!! Came here with kids and my 5yo daughter wanted to try clams, and the owner came over, asked what she wanted, and brought her 2 steamed clams in delicious teriyaki sauce. Needless to say, she loved the clams, what a great way to introduce children to new amazing foods!
The selection is nice and the restaurant is open until 11pm.
author: Katherine G.

description: Best deal for the best nigiri in town! We're almost always able to walk in with minimal wait, which I love for an excellent sushi place. My favorite is their salmon nigiri--they're always so generous with their salmon! We usually order a bunch of nigiri and then a few rolls. Their fish is incredibly fresh tasting, the prices are more than reasonable, and the sashimi they put on top of the rice is always huge and thick! I also like the lion king roll and Romeo and Juliet roll.
author: Ruth Y.

description:
Went here for the first time tonight. Place is small, but it doesn't matter to me. We got seated at the sushi bar. Prices are reasonable/typical for sushi rolls (6 pcs).

-Parking: easy to find since in far outer sunset/residential area.

-Food: I ordered the spicy hamachi (6pc) and alaskan roll (6pc). 
The hamachi roll was excellent! It was fresh and really quite good. Will definitely come back for the roll.
The alaskan roll was good too! The avocado was green and not turning brown, like some sushi restaurants. 
They give you a small, complimentary bowl of edamame to eat while you wait!

-Customer service: Waiters were nice, however food took 15-20 mins to come out.

Will come here again!
author: Hanna M.

description: Well priced sushi. Cozy, friendly environment. I come here so much that the chefs and the boss recognize me. Yasss. They went through a menu change with some price adjustments, nonetheless food is always good here. I love their hand rolls and their nigiris, especially the ones with the quail eggs. Overall, service has improved and is a solid sushi establishment that I will continue to return to.
author: Amy T.

description:
This is usually the typical place my boyfriend and I go for sushi. The price is decent and there is street parking most of the time. The most recent time I paid a visit, I wasn't very satisfied. It was an early Sunday afternoon when my boyfriend and I came here to eat. We waited around half an hour for any of our food to come out, probably because there was only one sushi chef working. Definitely inefficient. 

I tried the chasu (pork) ramen for the first time and I have to say that it was nothing more than average. The ramen special at all and it had way too many bean sprouts. I felt like every spoonful I ate had bean sprouts in it. The soup was decent and had enough flavor. 

We also ordered a lot of sushi lol. My favorite was the hamachi nigiri. The fish was thinly cut but it just melted in your mouth. The tuna maki was also good. What I really didn't like was the lion king roll. They changed the way they served it from the first time I tried it here. It's usually supposed to be baked on an aluminum foil but this time it was just served in a row on a plate. Also there's typically sauce over it but their lion king roll was just not up to par and did not have enough flavor.
author: Annie H.

description: The food was good. The person collecting the check was pretty rude! I didn't tip because I was left waiting to get my table for 10 min while plenty of tables were available. When the guy checked the bill he came back and said I didn't leave and tip. I said I payed the full balance what is the problem. He said yeah but you didn't tip. I said I wasn't aware that a tip was mandatory. He say what , you don't like the food or the service? I said everything was good but I'm not leaving a tip. What is the problem? He says ok you don't want to tip why no tip? I Say no! Your not entitled to a tip! The whole time everyone around me was looking at us and it was hard to ignore due to  him making a big deal about it and making it seem like I wasn't paying my bill. I will not be returning here since far superior options with better  service exist.
author: Joey M.

description: Omakase by Master Sashimi chef Tazaki keeps us coming back at least once every 2 weeks. The fish is fresh, service is friendly, and the prices very reasonable!
author: Daniel W.

description:
SASHIMIIIII. The slices are big and makes me feel slightly better about my wallet. It's more affordable here compared to other sushi places since the rolls are cheaper (priced at under $10) but they do offer only 6 pieces instead of 8. 

THE SPOON! I was always curious about uni and frankly, I still am today since I couldn't really tell what uni tasted like since I slurped the whole spoon up. Can someone please invent the LADLE instead? A spoon just is too small. The Spoon comes with uni, oyster, quail egg, and tobiko. After eating it in one slurp, I tasted mostly oyster in the beginning with the egg at the end. It was delicious and I wish I had ten more spoons OR LADLES of those. 

#23 Sashimi combo stated that it had 16 pieces but we counted 20! There were five different kinds of sashimi and each had four pieces. Big slices with a thicker cut. 

Chirashi bowl is beautiful. On a bed of rice, from the center clockwise, you have tamago (egg), ebi (shrimp), hamachi (yellowtail), lemon slices, sake (salmon), ikura (salmon roe), uni (sea urchin) on top of a shiso leaf, walu (Hawaiian butterfish), avocado, maguro (tuna), with hirame (halibut) shaped like a rose in the center. 

This place can get busy really quickly at dinner hour. We were lucky and came here right when it opened so we were able to get the cool seats in the back by the window. You have to take off your shoes but you can sit on the floor on the mats. The chair is quite comfortable but could be hard to figure out where to put your legs for the most comfortable position. 

Service-wise, they are nice and friendly but could be hard to flag them down since there is only maybe 1 or 2 servers and they're busy trying to serve everyone.
author: Diana C.

description:
Hands down one of my favorite places for fresh and delicious sushi.

Was here on a date and we ended up sitting in the area where tatami flats are seating reflective of traditional Japanese rooms.  The interior is small yet cozy and dinner time is consistently packed, mostly with locals who know where to go for good fresh sushi.

We ended up ordering several items from their nigiri (maguro, shrimp, toro) menu on top of their sashimi combo plate, which came arranged with vibrant colors and interesting textures in mind.  My favorite slice of fish are maguro (tuna), Hamachi, toro, and salmon.  The nigiri presentation is good in that the rice is not too thick (something I'm not a big fan of) so the flavor of the fresh fish is apparent and not washed out by the inordinate amount of starch.  In addition to sashimi/sushi offerings, the menu lists an extensive array of udon/ramen, bento boxes, as well as appetizer items for those that are unable to consume too much rice.

Prices are competitive and typical of Japanese food pricing with nigiri ranging from $4 - $20, depending on the portions and plating preferences.  Service has always been courteous and efficient and I always enjoy my visits.  For the adventurous, sit at the bar and request chef omakase....they did wonders for us and the meal was incredible.
author: Miika M.

description:
There are two four tops ( 2 tables for party of 4) where you must remove your shoes to eat. It's pretty cool but make sure you stretch before sitting there. My legs were tight from sitting in a butterfly seated position for some time. 

The food was terrific! I had delicious oyster shots, eel rolls (dragon and caterpillar), among other things. Service was great too. I recommend this place for night of seafood.
author: Jray M.

description: I've been coming to Tazaki for quite some time .  Fish is fresh and generously portioned . I always order the Yakuza Maki (tempura shrimp , soft shell crab , eel , fresh crab , tobiko , and unagi sauce ). It was freakin sooooo good . They also had Santa Barbara Uni . Another home run !!!!!!! The chefs and staff are very nice . If you haven't been , what you waiting for ????  Tip: order the above and come by 5:30pm
author: Joe L.

description: Was bummed... I ordered Fatty Tuna, "Toro" and unfortunately there were tendons in both pieces of nigiri.  And even though Toro is pretty tender... I couldn't even eat it and paid $13.00 for an unsatisfying nigiri.  So I'm leaving just kind of bleh.
author: S. B.

description:
Dont be fooled as you enter Tazaki. It might seem like a small place but it welcomes you with its cozy interior. Very friendly staff made for quick and polite service. They were very helpful in helping select items from the menu.

I am a Tempura lover and their Tempura rolls definitely did not dissapoint! The Yakuza Roll was especially delicious. I will definitely be returning soon.
author: Abel C.

description:
I've lived in the outer sunset for 10 yrs and cannot believe I've never tried this place. Came here with my friend on a Wednesday night and there was no wait for the two of us, but for a party of 4+ there were couple parties waiting. 

FOOD: 
Very affordable Japanese food compared to many places. What caught my eye the most were the customize-able dinner bentos (you can choose 3 meats if you want!), dinner combos and the grilled fishes. All of these meals come with rice, miso, tea and ice cream. Price ranged from $10-$16. 

In addition to, meal combos they also serve tapas and sushi rolls, donburi and everything else a typical Japanese restaurant would serve.

AMBIANCE: 
We actually got seated at the sushi island in front of the sushi chief, so that was kind of cool. There are also regular tables and 2 tables for on japanese style seating near the windows. I'm planning to take my family here next time and hopefully get one of those tables! :) 

SERVICE: 
Quick, friendly and knowledgeable.

Will be back soon to try their other items and take my family here! :)

UPDATE:
Came back a second time and realized, the food quality isn't actually that great. I ordered the Hawaiian Butterfly Fish and my mom ordered the salmon plate and they both it tasted old and not very fresh.
author: Samantha F.

description: For over a decade, this restaurant has been a local place where my family visited for quality Japanese food. For a small-looking restaurant in the outer Sunset, most friends I take here enter without high expectations and leave knowing that this is one of the best Japanese restaurants in the city. They always use fresh ingredients, there sushi portions are reasonable, and they make great salmon and chicken teriyaki. The chicken and fish are always lean and  delicious, and their food presentation is fantastic. The waitresses I've met are always very friendly and helpful. My only complaint is that the chef doesn't know how to make beef, as whenever I have tried beef-containing dishes, the food contained more cow veins, skin, and fat than edible meat.
author: Jenifer J.

description:
We live by close to this restaurant and each time we pass by it, we always see a small line out the door. Honestly, I'm not too sure. I've ate at this restaurant a few times and it's just ok. 

Today, my bf and I decided to eat here again to give it another chance and ehh.....I'm still a little iffy about this. 

We were able to get a table right when we walked in (luckily). However, we were seated on a corner table where we weren't getting much attention. To order, you have to check off what you want on a little piece of paper, somewhat like some hotpot places. Because we weren't getting much attention by the waitresses, I was getting so frustrated that I literally had to wave my order sheer to one of the waitress's face.

We ordered the chef's special, a pork ramen, a roll and some appetizer (I don't remember the name of the roll and the appetizer). It didn't take too long for our food. The ramen was alright. It was a bit salty but I can't really complain because all the ramen places I have tried are usually salty. The roll and the appetizer were just ok also. I've tasted better sushi...this kind of taste like a cheap sushi place to me...except that it's not really cheap.

They gave us a complimentary ice cream for our dessert but overall, I wasn't satisfied with our food. I could have paid a little bit more for a way better quality of sushi. It's a little disappointing. I don't think I'll be coming here again unless I am too lazy to drive to somewhere far.
author: Elaine C.

description:
Sad that another neighborhood quick dinner spot we like has roaches!

We moved to a back table away from the breeze from the door. I saw spilled sauce under the table so when they came back to our table I pointed to it and just as I did there was a big roach! The waiter quickly said "oh" and stepped on it like it was nothing. She ignored the whole situation and gave us our full total bill. 

Now that I have seen it I can't eat there and not think about it so we won't be coming back.
author: Linda L.

description:
NO JAPANESE SERVICE HERE! Why? Well, because it is Chinese owned and I guess they do not understand the authentic nuances of a REAL Japanese sushi restaurant.

First, if you sit at the counter, the chef should at least acknowledge you there. He is there to serve you. That is why you choose the counter over a table. Here at Tazaki, they are too busy to even look up. Next, I should have known from the start when sitting at the bar, you are given an order sheet to make your sushi selections. WTH?!?? Isn't the whole point of sitting at the sushi bar so that you get personalized service from the sushi chef that is right in front of you? The chef is there to cater to your needs and to see how you react with each piece of sushi that you eat. He is there to adjust the next selection upon how you reacted to your current taste. Instead, we had to wait 45 minutes before we received any sushi. Yes, at the Tazaki sushi bar, you are treated like any other table whether it be a table for 10 and your party at the counter is only 3.

Third, the chefs do not know how to make nigiri properly. It may look ok, but if the fish falls off the rice when you try to pick it up, what is the use? Plus, their rice doesn't taste like sushi rice, but just plain rice. Also, the cuts are a mish-mash of shapes. Heck, you have pictures right on the counter (to show the customers), so why not at least cut the fish like it? Instead of the long rectangular cuts that cover the fish length wise, we got all sorts of weird rectangle-ish cuts, meaning that they don't cut the fish blocks properly to begin with. This is to save $$ and maximize profit. Japanese first "eat with your eyes" and well, if you need to cut the fish and there is some leftover in order to make it look presentable, then that is how REAL Japanese restaurants do it!

Forth, who runs out of beer on a Sunday? If you are out of your "special" that is on the board, why not delete it? I feel that if you are not Chinese, then you don't get proper service. My beer selection suddenly "ran out" even after the waitress told me they had it. The Caucasian customer next to me had an item on his order also "sold out" but it looked like another Chinese customer at the bar (that seemed to know the owner really well) got the order filled. Hmmmm...

The fish quality is not bad. But don't order the maguro which is previously frozen!

Its too bad, this place could be a great find, as the location is outside of the packed Irving Street area. However, we won't be coming back. If you expect real Japanese service, go elsewhere.
author: Mark M.

description: The sushi was good, except too many takeout orders and the cashier was on the phone forever not to give me my check.   Then i was waiting and waiting... sigh!
author: D F.

description: Food was good, but damn they really have that credit card fee, so be careful. Apparently an ex-friend came here 3 month ago and their group didn't get that 5% fee on their credit card because they know the owner.
author: Katherine D.

description:
Came here with the boyfriend around 5:30 on a Friday night. Place was not packed yet and there were a group of 5 people waiting in front of us. The staff didn't notice us because I assume that they though we were part of the group in front of us. One waitress finally walked over and asked us how many were in our party. We were then promptly directed to the bar for our seats. 

I like sitting at the bar because I get to watch all of the action in how the chef prepares the sushi. Also it kills time when waiting for the food to come! It got super busy and the waitresses were constantly telling the chef that numerous tables were complaining that the sushi was taking too long. Not once did the chef complain! He kept on cranking out those rolls like a sushi making machine! 

As it got busier, I'm glad I chose to sit at the bar because it was like free entertainment as I got to watch the waitresses go back and forth, talking about their own drama and communicating with the chef on which rolls go to which table. There was one instance where one waitress brought back a roll that the sushi chef made wrong and the sushi chef said told the waitress to let the table keep the sushi as he prepared the correct roll for them. How nice! 

The boyfriend and I both ended up ordering the 16 piece sashimi combo which was priced at 18.95. It also came miso soup, rice, and ice cream at the end! Now you would think at that price that the quality of the fish would be questionable... It was actually pretty fresh! 

The sashimi were 4 slices each of salmon, red tuna, white tuna, hamachi. The chef threw in an extra four slices of halibut free of charge! Presentation was very pretty! In addition to that, he also gave us a small plate of tuna poke while we waited for our sashimi combo to arrive. The sashimi itself weren't very big pieces but with 20 slices to eat, I was definitely not complaining and was full for sure at the end of my meal. Will definitely be back to try this place again!
author: Cynthia T.

description:
TL;DR Not AMAZING sushi, but just good sushi. Great place for casual dining and quick sushi. Look elsewhere for "refined" sushi.

Shima Aji is a bit tougher than expected. After trying that, ended up going with a roll instead of getting more nigiri...

Nonetheless, good value and good service. Nothing is excellent here, just good...

When seated, you get an over-diluted tea and cold soggy edamame.

Would come here again for a quick casual sushi session with friends. Will go elsewhere for fresh sushi.
author: Andrew S.

description:
The Shashimi Combo was very good--a combination of five different fish, and all werr fresh. Others in the party enjoyed the Hamachi Kama, Dragon Roll, Spider Roll, and the Bento combos.
Service was good. Staff was friendly.
One thing to be aware of--there is a surcharge for paying by credit cards.
author: David W.

description:
The food is great! Amazing service. Good size restaurant. Shoutout to the best server Karbo Tam. Location is sort of in a residential area so it might be hard to look for parking. But it's free parking so why not! They're not open for lunch anymore but it's a great place to eat dinner. Place is closed on Mondays. Overall, great Japanese place to go in the sunset! 

Ordered: 2 salmon and 2 tuna nigiri, katsu odon, and snake roll
author: Marisa F.

description:
Sunset district has a lot of Japanese themed restaurants.   Tazaki was strongly recommended by a local food buddy due to some of their unique menu offerings that I have not seen at other restaurants as well as some favorites. 

The restaurant has a full sushi bar and is somewhat spacious with a good amount of seating available.  We were greeted right away as we walked in and it was rather busy (which was to be expected in the evenings). There was room at the sushi bar and we chose seats near the side. 

The sushi ordering is done similar to modern dim sum restaurants where you check off what you want on a paper and give it to the waitress. 

The presentation was very nice for the dish that we ordered. And there was a special Spoon order (the type of spoon normally reserved for ramen or eating dumplings) that had a few different flavors combinations on it. 

The servers were very polite and attentive. I would recommend this restaurant to friends and I would definitely go back try some other dishes.
author: Gregory C.

description:
Tazaki Sushi can be really good If you order the right things! The first time I came here with my sister, I ordered some really boring standard stuff and was not impressed. I refused to give up because of the great ratings. I looked at the table next to us and they ordered some really cool items; so I made it a mission to come back again to try the cool adventurous stuff! 

2nd time did not disappoint! The N-Judah Roll listed on the white board has spicy salmon on the inside with ripe avocado, Hamachi on the outside, wrapped in a thin soy wrapper, and topped with black tobiko. So delicious! 

The Swamp Roll was also really good with spicy tuna and avocado on the outside and seaweed salad on top. Really yummy!!!

My boyfriend and I were very adventurous and tried the Eclipse Sushi with tuna, raw quail egg, orange and black tobiko, and The Spoon with raw oyster, uni, raw quail egg, and spring onions. I don't know what to make of it, I like each individual raw ingredient, especially oysters, but so many raw things together was a little to much! Definitely tasted the fishiness. 

Note that they give you a huge chunk of wasabi and ginger with the first plate you order and the rest does not come with any. So set your chunk of wasabi aside for the rest of your orders, otherwise you'd have to ask for more. Ask for more ginger and use it as a palate cleanser between each type of sushi or sashimi! Everything tasted really fresh, the sashimi was of good quality. For a little more money, they have fish imported from Japan (Medai, Kamapchi, Shima Aji, Hinmedai, and Tai). Always check the white board for specials! I wish their menu had pictures.
author: Janny S.

description: AMAZING FOOD! And fantastic service! My absolutely favorite was the Toro--so perfect. Definitely will be back again for more!
author: Amanda L.

description:
First time here w/ my family and we ordered the following:

-Hamachi Nigiri (Good)
-Hotatega Nigiri (OK)
-Sake (Good)
-Unagi (Just OK)
-Caterpillar Roll (OK)
-Dragon Maki (OK)
-Volcano Roll (OK)

*Friendly Servers
author: Wendy L.

description: The donburi had like 100 pieces of ginger that I had to individually toss out-- its just too much ginger. Also had to toss pieces of beef that were unchewable. Also, why throw in frozen peas and carrots? Besides those things, its wasnt bad. But I felt like I was in am earthquake as everyone running past made the ground pop up and down (not joking). The food was already slow but having to sit through the shaking made it worse.
author: Antonio F.

description:
The quality of the food is good.  However, the quality is irrelevant if you don't actually receive it right?  That's exactly what happened on Sunday, 10/15/17.  Our party of 4 arrived at 6:30 pm, and put our name down on the wait list.  After 40 minutes, we were seated in the tatami.

There are 5 different servers, and they randomly serve the various tables.  None take ownership for any one table, so the service is awful.  Took us 20 minutes after being seated for someone to take our order - and that someone was actually one of the kitchen staff!  After taking our order, nothing.... no food.... no extra tea/water... no attention for 50 minutes!  Did I mention we ordered two appetizers?

People who were seated after us had already finished half their meal!  After 50 minutes, I talked to the head waitress, and her excuses were:  (1) there was a large party, which was seated after us by the way, and (2) there were a lot of to go orders.  She went to the back to check, came back out, and then told me they just started cooking my order!  Well gee whiz!  I wonder how long they would have taken if I hadn't said anything.

In the end, one hour after getting seated, we finally get... our appetizer (grilled squid).  Yes, we had to wait even longer after that for... ramen.  Are you kidding me?  Total wait time for the order to be completed was 1 hour and 10 minutes.

I see some key problems with their operation, consistent with all the bad reviews you see on yelp.

1)  There are 5 serving staff, but none are assigned sole responsibility for a "section" or "table".  You'll be served by at least 3-4 different people to seat you, take the order, serve the food (when it finally arrives), give you the check, etc.  If you think that each person is assigned a specific task, you'd be wrong.  They all do it all, and they do it so randomly that their service is grossly inconsistent.  Plus, when you ask them about your order, they don't follow up because they don't know who took the order in the first place, or what the order was.

2)  They don't prioritize eat-in orders over to go orders.  You've waited 40 minutes, show up at the restaurant, ready to give a tip, and they don't prioritize you in person over someone who phones in an order, and isn't even guaranteed to show up to pick it up?  That's just BAD.
author: Bryant W.

description: Ordered the Sushi 5pc fish lunch special $13.95 and they gave 3pc fish with two tobiko rolls. If you request 5pc fish as written on the menu board be prepared to pay extra charges. Don't order the hamachi maki roll unless you want minced   Hamachi, sparingly placed with a strong fishy smell. It was not fresh and we won't be back!
author: Rodo A.

description:
After waiting for 20 minutes. The place cleared out with 4 empty tables, but the other and my party were still not seated. I just they were too busy and forgot the customers standing outside. 

Place is half empty on a Sunday night. Still waited 45 for a sashimi platter. Fish is not really fresh. The guys behind the counter, when they weren't watching TV, they were making the to go order before the guest at the restaurant. The rolls they made were sloppy. Would not recommend unless you want some subpar Japanese food to go. 

PS, just got the platter. The guy barely knew what he sliced up when he was explaining it at the table. Technically got 40 pieces instead of 35. But slices like this I rather go to a supermarket and try it myself. All the 5 and 4 stars must have been the people that doesn't really know better and just keep coming back. The owner seem to know every other person in the restaurant.
author: Alan K.

description: Bad food, bad taste, cook it in a wrong way. We ordered ramen and udon. IT WAS SUCH A WASTE!!! Waste of money and time! So disappointing. We have never had reman that has broccoli and onion. All that totally down my feeling and also PAYING WITH A CARD(DEBIT/CREDIT) will CHARGE 4% more for NO DAMN reasons. So, I'm suggesting not coming to this place. It definitely makes you feel disappointed.
author: Nandie J.

description:
Standard cheap eats Japanese joint.  Uni was not fresh as it had a funny after taste.  The chicken karaage tasted like Chinese food.  The salmon nigiri was below average as well.  

Another one of typical Chinese owned joints that cuts corners
author: A L.

description: Amazing customer service. Ordered the extinguisher and the flame burnt out before I could take a photo and without asking the waiter asked if I wanted it to be lit again. She also kept refilling my water the moment I was done (keep in mind it was super busy too)
author: Justin M.

description: Great food at good prices in quiet atmosphere for our lunch. Teriyaki chicken in lunch combo was excellent.
author: Tim M.

description:
I've been going here for years with my family because it's close to my house. Some visits are better than others, but this last one (7/24/16) was the best by far so I can only hope it stays this good.

The sushi combo that's like 30 or 40 dollars is so worth, 5 pieces salmon, tuna, yellowtail nigiri as well as 3 cooked rolls. It's perfect for my family because a few of us only eat cooked food. I of course LOVE my raw fish. 

Salmon and yellowtail were EXTREMELY fresh and the pieces were big (good fish/rice ratio). We replaced the tuna with more salmon for this combo because we heard tuna isn't safe right now.
author: Gwendelyn W.

description:
Decided to check out this place bc it's nearby and has good reviews. I didnt get a good vibe upon entering and I could tell my boyfriend didn't either. While there weren't any issues with our service at the bar, i couldn't help but overhear the service, or lack there of, towards the other customers. 

Their menu was not descriptive at all, which made it really hard for us to decide what to order. I dont think I enjoyed the rolls much, other than the yakuza, but the size of the pieces made it a little hard to eat. For those who are wondering, they have complimentary edamame and free tea.
author: Betty T.

description:
Meh, in all fairness, had the ramen and udon. Both lacked a truly good broth. No depth of flavor. 
The sushi might be good, but doubt I'll be back to try it.
author: Susan O.

description: Had the California roll, spider roll and cucumber roll. Takeout. The California rolls were made with real crab, and were super reasonably priced. Really great sushi. Wish I could have tried more. Highly recommend
author: Ian L.

description: I saw a friend's review and got excited. We must have gone on the wrong day. We went on a Sun two weeks ago. It was hot that day and my family of 6 were seated right by the front door. It was warm inside and flies were about. We came about 1:30 and place only had 3 other tables. Our waitress was impatient and didn't understand us. She brought the wrong dish to my wife and never brought me my asahi even after asking what they had. One of my sons ordered chicken karagi but he said it was chicken with tempura batter. My other son had a noodle dish and he said it was one of the worst. Yes I had sushi and it was fishy and brought out 20 min before the rest of my family ate. Our first waitress never came back, never filled our waters until we were about to leave. Our second waitress didn't care much for our satisfaction either. We will NOT be going back..
author: Jordan K.

description: This was one of those experiences that made me suddenly realize that many other places don't serve really, really fresh fish.  It's not that I've been having completely terrible sushi everywhere else, but the first bite of my maki roll at Tazaki made me close my eyes and just go "mmmmm."   The fish was incredibly fresh like it had been in the ocean just prior to appearing on my plate, and I was blown away by the flavor and texture of the salmon and tuna in my Pink Lady and Snake rolls.  Free edamame brought by the friendly, smiling waitress was also a nice surprise.  Prices were average to high, but worth it for the quality of the food and service.
author: Sheri W.

description:
This place was close to the house we were staying and was recommended by friends...it was a decent japanese restaurant but i have to say that i'm probably a bit jaded just coming back from japan!! so i'm trying to be as objective as possible....its located in a residential neighborhood and i think a lot of customers are locals.  

i ordered the tonkatsu which was a large portion of cutlet...two pieces of deep fried goodness but a little bit oily and on the heavy side....my GF had the bento box w chicken katsu which was good, tempura veggies which again had a heavy handed batter...we also had a salmon skin cut roll which was tasty and a cucumber maki which was good.  i do have to say that the rice was warm, seasoned well in su and very nice compression...not packed hard like so many places do nowadays....

i will come back sometime and try just sushi....
author: Doug U.

description:
$3.50 butterfish! I'm a fan! 

Came here around 5PM on Friday evening and the restaurant filled up fast. My friend and I wanted to keep it low budget, so we ordered 1 bento and a couple nigiri. The bento was decently priced with 3 items for $13.95. We got the saba, veggie tempura, and chicken karaage. The chicken karaage is a must! Something about the sauce makes it taste delicious. We were also impressed with the freshness of the salmon and butterfish. 

TLDR: good fresh food, decent prices and portions for bento, left happy
Also, its a nice place to watch the warriors game.
author: Christina G.

description:
Came based on a friend's suggestion - probably wouldn't have ever went to this place otherwise. I don't expect much of sushi restaurants especially when I haven't heard or read about it (quite nitpicky about fish being fresh) - but I'm glad I've had a chance to try it now since their fish was fresh and priced fairly!

Location - near the beach - convenient as its right by the N line, parking isn't too bad around this area.

Restaurant - small, clean restaurant, fits maybe 30 people max? Doesn't seem like it gets SUPER busy. They have 2 tables where you can sit traditionally on the floor :)! I wanna do that next time. Fairly quiet and fit for a casual dinner.

Service - attentive and quick.. they checked on us and refilled our tea regularly. (Then again I came on a Tuesday so it wasn't busy either.)

Food - Fresh and decent portions! Good fish to rice ratio, I'd ideally have liked a bit more vinegar in the rice, but not bad at all. For a sushi restaurant in the Outer Sunset, I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of fish.

The spoon - $6.50/1pc : uni, oyster, raw quail egg shooter - YUM!

The creamy roll - $7.95/6 pieces - huge and worth it! Came with a generous amount of spicy tuna and scallop with avocado and not too much rice at all. I'm typically a sushi purist as I like to taste and feel the fish on its own (without the distraction of sauce/rice), but in this case, since the portion of fish was huge, it was actually a good mix of everything in terms of flavor and mouth-feel.

Moriawase sushi combo $13.95 - essentially, 6-pc nigiri with a small cucumber roll - HUGE pieces of fish for nigiri - again, wish they had slightly more vinegar in the rice but not bad at all. Good deal!

Seems like a lot of locals come here on a regular basis as the waitstaff recognized quite a few people in the hour I was there and they were constantly working on takeout orders, which is always a good sign!

I'd definitely return if I had a hankering for sushi! Definitely recommend =)
author: Emily C.

description:
I'm sad to write this review, as I was formerly a Big fan of this neighborhood spot. I've delayed in writing this review as I held such a Long affinity for Tazaki, but unfortunately their treatment of me earlier this year was insulting.

My friend and I ordered 5 rolls of sushi, 4 of them coming on one plate. As we started sampling the rolls, I felt the dreaded sensation of a hair in my mouth. I alerted the busboy and showed him the hair, who apologized and altered the manager. I set the hair on the table, as I no longer wished to hold it. 

The manager arrived, and we explained the situation to her, but she was quite skeptical and asked to see the hair. Despite the busboy saying he had seen it, the manager asked us if we were sure it wasn't ours. The hair was clearly an employee's (long and jet black) as opposed to our curly hair (and quite short). 

The restaurant then took the entire plate of 4 sushi with only one piece missing per roll(we weren't sure which roll it was in) then brought out the bill, adding insult to injury by taking one roll off of the entire order. We were left hungry, had to pay for a meal we didn't even get to eat, and treated quite poorly by the staff. I went from regularly attending Tazaki once a week (Creamy Roll fan) to never again.
author: Chase S.

description:
My friends live walking distance from Tazaki so we were craving sushi and decided to come here last minute. It's a small hole in the wall restaurant. There were 7 of us and they were busy so we had to wait a little, but the waitress came out and gave us menus so we could order right away (genius idea!) 

We were given complimentary edamame and the miso soup was so fresh and tasty. 5 of us ordered bento boxes and it came with so much food for a very good price. We also ordered the snake roll and the lily maki roll which were really good. My bento box was supposed to come with only 5 pieces of tempura, but instead I had it loaded with about 10 pieces! They were also very generous with wasabi and ginger. Our bento boxes came with ice cream at the end of our meal and the waitress gave us two on the house for the people who didn't order the bento box. So sweet!

Overall, the service was excellent and the food was delicious!! 5 stars for sure!
author: Shanice C.

description: I really enjoy this sushi spot! I ordered the salmon, Saba, walu, kampachi, amaebi, and uni nigiri. All of the nigiri were super fresh and nice big slices. This place is definitely and the quality is great. If you're looking for a cheap and nice quality spot for sushi I would definitely recommend coming here!
author: Jessie S.

description: So. Much. Food! You want some sushi rolls with names like 49er, Lion King and Philadelphia - this is the place to go. The bento boxes come with a huge amount of food (note: I'm usually in the Mission eating bentos the size of Blowfish Sushi). I had the three item with teriyaki salmon, beef teriyaki and sake sashimi. It came with a full bowl of white rice and salad. Salmon was nicely cooked and they didn't over do it with the teriyaki. The sashimi were big cuts. Beef was good and not chewy at all .. something i come across quite often at similar Japanese restaurants. Finished it off with green tea ice cream for dessert. It wasn't the bright green and super artificial green tea flavor either - they had the right stuff in stock! This isn't the restaurant for an authentic sushi experience but just a filling and good meal. Would definitely come back.
author: Samantha L.

description: Came here for dinner one night while in the Outer Sunset and was amazed at how great the food and attention to detail is. Great service and all of the rolls we ordered were amazing.
author: Chris M.

description:
Decided to take my friend to Tazaki sushi today because it is very reasonably priced. Of course, their fish is not super good quality, but it's very much worth the price. Their salmon and yellowtail nigiris are only $3.50 for 2 pieces! I'm aware that most Japanese restaurants in SF these days price them at around $5 nowadays, so it's always good to have a cheaper alternative if you're not feeling like a baller. This is overall a place where I can see myself going to often if I'm craving sushi, but don't want to spend too much.

::MUST GETS:: Pumpkin Sushi, Scallop Nigiri, Yellowtail Nigiri

-Pink Lady Maki (~$14): Blue fin tuna and avocado on the inside with salmon on the outside, topped with a mayo based sauce and tobiko. A very decent roll if you enjoy creamy sauces (; Flavors blended very well together, but nothing really "popped" if that makes sense. I might go ahead and order some other roll instead during my next visit.

-Pumpkin Sushi ($6.50): Salmon sushi topped with scallops with mayo. I actually enjoyed this a lot because I love mayo everything. A big pricey but I feel like it's worth trying.

-Salmon Nigiri ($3.50): This surprisingly melted in my mouth! However, there wasn't a sweet salmon taste that you usually get with good quality fish. Oh god I feel like my descriptions are confusing lol. But because I am a salmon lover, this did the job just fine!

-Scallop Nigiri ($4.95): This was bomb. MMMM! Very sweet and delicious scallops that made me incredibly happy. I would definitely recommend this!

-Uni Nigiri (Seasonal): Nope. Just a big fat NO. This filled my mouth with bitterness ): Maybe it was just a bad day for uni, which I understand. 

-Hawaiian Butterfish ($3.50): This was pretty good. Melted in my mouth just fine, but no distinct strong flavors. But then again, this is a subtle fish to begin with. 

-Yellowtail Nigiri ($3.50): Strong flavors, melts in your mouth, GET IT! haha

-Chicken Teriyaki: The flavors were good but my friend said it wasn't as moist as she would have liked. Overall it was just okay.
author: Jackie T.

description:
For a really great price, I got a bento box with teriyaki chicken, 4 pieces of a California roll, and tempura vegetables. It also came with a side of salad, rice, and soup. Overall, it was very yummy. I can't eat avocado so they were nice and replaced that with cucumber. The teriyaki chicken was good, though I wish it had more sauce. My favorite was the tempura vegetables. Perfectly crunchy!

It seems that you have to have good timing to get a table here. We did. The people behind us didn't. There aren't a lot of tables so perhaps call ahead!
author: Hannah R.

description:
Came here for dinner around 630pm and the place certainly filled up by 7pm. So get here early.
Service was efficient not overly friendly. 
Now let's review the food. Overall, fair.
My guest ordered sushi and the rice was average in appearance and no unique taste. The bento box is a good value @ $13.95 for 3 items but the portions were on the small size. 
A place to eat but not much more to review or rave about.
author: David H.

description: Love this place. Best sashimi in town. They've really stepped up with their service and quality has always been on point. A staple in SF.
author: Rj L.

description:
I go here all the time with family. My parents have actually been here for many years so we know the owners well. They're very kind. Servers aren't as friendly and aren't as attentive. 

However, the food makes up for everything. The flavor and freshness is almost always top quality. My favorite is the ankimo (monk fish liver) and karaage. Their karaage is a little unique compared to others, in the best way possible. Edamame and ice cream are complimentary I believe. 

Bathrooms are dirty but tables are relatively clean. There's a space where you can sit in a more traditional Japanese style if you'd like that.
author: Ashley P.

description: Miso soup and sushi is always on point here. I recommend anyone looking for delicious Japanese food in the sunset district to make their way here and hey will leave absolutely content.
author: Manjeet M.

description:
IN LOVE with this place!!! Almost don't want to write a review so I don't add to the customers they get because ALL THEY NEED ARE ME AND MY FRANZ. 
Jk they deserve all the customers because they are SO good at what they do. Free edamame appetizer per table, huge slices of fish on their nigiri (highly recommend...all of the fish), and great staff. Constantly filled up our teacups and water cups, didn't make us wait long for the check or for ordering, which I really appreciated, and generally high spirits that really made our experience great. It's a small place so try not to come here with a huge group, but it's great for date night and small group dinners. Everyone will leave so satisfied!
Also, their green tea ice cream is TO DIE FOR. So def get the bento box (great value for your $) and enjoy the wonderful green tea ice cream.
author: Mio W.

description:
Great sushi, good service at fair prices.

Interior moderately small and not fancy.  Max seating maybe 30 persons.
author: Robert M.

description:
Went here for dinner to try out their Chirashi Bowl based on the recommendation of my friends that live near the area. I had been here before and had the bento box dinner with tonkatsu and beef teriyaki, which was pretty good and had huge portions! During dinner service, most of the meals come with salad, soup, and ice cream (desert) so I was pretty intrigued to come back and finally try their sushi that everyone mentions.

When I ordered my Chirashi, it came back with tuna, salmon, whitefish, a shrimp, egg, uni, inure, and hamachi (mackerel). The sushi definitely tasted like it hadn't fully defrosted yet and had it flavor frozen too. It was pretty disappointing because everyone mentions this place is super sushi focused, but maybe because there weren't a lot of customers they didn't break out the good quality stuff.
author: Nick C.

description:
Pros: friendly and prompt service, no wait

Cons:  food wasn't good. Sushi was "fishy"
author: Bayarea K.

description:
The sashimi was consistently decent, the Butter Fish sizzling platter was extremely oily, and the rolls are okay. The food deserves 3 stars, but after the horrible service Ive experienced 4 times, I dont believe the restaurant deserves 2 stars. 

This may be a long review/rant, but if you experienced the quality of service I did, I doubt you'd want your disappointment to fall on deaf ears. The first three visits I made with my family, we had to wait at least 30 minutes to be seated. Understandable for a Japanese restaurant, but each time we watched as the waitresses seated parties that came in after us without even looking at us or the waiting list. The first two times it happened, we brushed it off because it seemed like they were friends and families of the owner and stuff like that happens. Same thing happened during my third visit, but in addition to waiting 45+ minutes to be seated, I had to wait another 45 minutes for a sizzling platter they said "will be ready in 5 minutes" over 3 times. I then waited another 10 minutes for the bowl of rice they twice forgot to bring out. 

Tonight's visit however, is what led me to compose this review. Again, we show up expecting to wait a while because they are busy. After 40 minutes of waiting we are finally next on the waiting list for a table/tatami of 3. BUT THEN, a waitress comes over to the middle aged couple that came in 20 minutes after we did and whispers something to them (they didnt even write their names on the waiting list). We already knew what was happening, but we didnt realize how disrespectful it was going to be. 
-10 minutes pass and a table of 6 leaves, and im expecting a waitress to skip us and give it to the next party of 5 (actually a practical thing to do). Instead, she tells another waitress to not seat that table and hands it over to the couple she whispered to earlier. 
-They tell her it seems really awkward to cut so many people and be put at a larger table. So this waitress tells them to just sit at the table and she'll move them over to a smaller table thats getting ready to pay the bill. 
-The smaller table is cleaned and lo and behold she moves the nameless couple over. Only THEN does this party of 5 get seated at the table large enough for 6-7. 

Once this happens, my family and I are FINALLY disgusted enough to decide to leave after patiently waiting for 40 minutes and then watching in angst for another 15-20 minutes as they "sneak" this couple in front of us. Before I left I went to the waitress who literally turned her back to us the entire time to avoid the shame of what she was doing, and I asked if her manager was around. She said yes. I asked if I could speak to them, so she said okay, she would go tell them.
-She goes to the back, comes out ignoring me going about her business as the restaurant is still busy. After a few minutes of making me wait, she comes to me and suddenly says the manager is not at the restaurant. 
-I then ask her why she seated the party of 2 before us and she starts playing DUMB AF. 
-She says "oh, let me check the waiting list." and we take a nice stroll to the front door. I told her they didnt write their name on the list, which is why Im questioning her actions. She then tries to play it off even more by saying "Oh, the party of 5?.." Before she can continue I said "No. The party of 2. Do you want me to walk you over to them?" As if im not making ANY sense to her, she then says "Oh, the party of 7?" (I kid you not, these questions are quoted word for word). I respond with the same answer and she allows me to walk her over to the table and point directly at the couple to avoid any further confusion.
-Then she says they called and made a reservation.
