I tell her we tried doing the same thing 2 hours ago but they told us they dont take reservations for parties of 6 (also very common and nothing im complaining about). She then tells me those reservations for small parties arent taken by the staff, but by the owner because "theres a list in the back" of people who are close friends/family.
-Still giving her the benefit of the doubt, I ask why did she not tell us anything and openly ignored all the other guests who waited well before that couple got there. She then has the nerve to say "I understand your situation." Thats when I realized there was nowhere else this conversation could go and left. 

After 4 visits (4 waits, 3 meals), I have spent over 3 hours standing and observing their waitstaff. What I have gathered is they give decent service to half of their customers while the rest take a back seat to the owners friends, family, the takeout customers, and a few lucky patrons. The groups they seat faster also always gets their food faster, while everyone else is forced to wait /be ignored. I cant recommend Tazaki Sushi to anyone unless you like being served by people who visibly care for only SOME of their customers and simply dont care for the rest.
author: Andrew P.

description: Good neighborhood sushi joint with cheap but good quality sashimi plates. The sushi chefs and staff are Chinese but who cares if the food is good. It was even crowded on a random Thursday when we came for dinner. I wouldn't come all the way out to the sunset just for this place but a good spot if you're just craving sushi and nearby.
author: Linda H.

description: This is place has horrible service and the sushi is not that fresh. It was very frustrating cause it took too long for them to figure out the seating for everyone which would have been worth it if the food was good but it wasn't.
author: Aylin K.

description: They have raised their prices!  even though the service was always inexcusably slow, i never minded because it was a cool place to talk with friends and get really cheap japanese food. Now, it's so not worth it! The entrees are definately not amazing quality, though the sushi is usually pretty good. The green tea they serve was basically hot water. And tonight, the service was so, so slow! I'm sad, this place is so convinient for me. But i won't be coming back.
author: Bethy B.

description: Very good sushi, had an excellent experience. The N-Judah roll was our favorite, followed closely by the yellowtail nigiri. It did take a while to get the sushi, but worth the wait. Best miso soup I've ever had.
author: Samantha D.

description: This is my neighborhood go to sushi joint! The fish is very fresh and delicious! The service is decent.  It's pretty hard to find parking since it's residential and people tend to be home during dinner hours.
author: Colleen L.

description:
Food
-fish are thick and huge pieces
-need to try those special sushi!

Service
-SLOW!!! Take off one star. We went there at 6:50pm and order. But never get our food until 7:30pm. I was told there is only two chief working that night. Even though it's busy dinner hour, shouldn't you have some more chief to figure that out?! 

Price
-$$ good price
-two people full to hell spending $100. But because we over order. It should be $20-30 per person
author: Sunny L.

description: My new neighborhood go to take out!  The sushi is delicious and reasonably priced.  The service is excellent and the staff is very nice!  Cheers!
author: Lisa P.

description:
Haha, i told a fellow yelper I don't much care for snushi. Though, this place proved me wrong.  I ordered a bento box which comes with three things of your choosing from a set list, +miso soup, salad, ice cream. I had the chicken age (the dark meat chicken nuggets as described to me by my friend's so), tempura shrimp,  and california roll. As a table, we shared crab avo roll, crab roll, shrimp roll. Nom noms.
  Good green tea, too. You just may need to prompt them re: your rolls as they can get backed up. Seriously, so filling. My friend and his gf both had entrees so, they had stuff to take home. The rolls don't go home so well, so consider that while ordering and eating. My friend says this is their second fave place, as in fairly affordable. Though, they treated, very kind.
author: Marin C.

description:
Wrote our name down at 8, seated at 8:45, got food around 9:30, finished dinner at 10:15. They seemed to be a little slow that evening but the owner (I think?) was walking around trying his best to accommodate. That was nice of him. However, that is most of the reason why I gave it 3 stars. A little too slow for my taste.

Miso soup was not too salty so we actually loved that. It almost had a cleaner taste than typical miso soups and we really appreciated that. 

Here is what we ordered: Sashimi Combo, Eclipse roll, Yellow Submarine, Cal Bear roll. 

Eclipse roll - Can skip next time
Yellow submarine - Boyfriend loved it! 
Cal bear roll - So small, not worth the price
Sashimi Combo - Fish was good, would order again.

Overall food was not bad, wait was horrible, service was not bad. Not sure if I'd really come again knowing how long it took us this first time but appreciated that the owner was nice to us. I did feel super bad about the other parties that were seated before us and got their food as we were finishing up; that bothered me and I would hate to have that happen to me next time.
author: Amanda L.

description:
I love going here Saturday and Sunday for lunch. Usually the only one there. Very friendly, love all the nigiri! White tuna, super white tuna, yellowtail! 

Went here with a big group of friends and was very affordable. 

Only negative is that they are closed on Mondays!
author: Amanda M.

description:
I've been here a few times and it never disappoints. I always get the sashimi and nigiri. The fish is fresh - my favorite is the salmon. There is a seating section by the window where you can take off your shoes and sit cross legged/on your knees by a low table - getting the true japanese experience!

Love that this is located in the outer sunset, I feel like there arent too many japanese restaurants located there. I never have too much trouble with parking either.
author: Annie L.

description:
What I don't understand is how they have 4 stars with over 400 reviews because to me, this place deserves a 2 1/2 stars max. 

I came here on a Tuesday night with two other people. My best friend and I usually go to sakesan in Richmond for our sushi fix, but we decided we should try out a new place and that it might be better than sakesan. Oh man, we were so wrong...
Upon walking in, I noticed right away that the interior of this place was quite old while I expected a lot more. We were seated right away, there was no wait on a Tuesday night. I was super happy because we were STARVINGG. Once we were seated we started to look at the menu. You order by checking a list. We got California roll, sake maki, philly, caterpillar, Alaska, two orders of sake nigiri, and a sizzling fish plate. I had no idea what that was but my boyfriend wanted that. 

The food took quite a long time to come out especially since there weren't many tables and those tables had already gotten their food. Once the sizzling plate came out, I was so shocked to see how little of a portion we got for the price. The sizzling plate also said it comes with stir fried vegetables but all my boyfriend got was bean sprouts!!!! That's not mixed vegetables, what a lie. Honestly I didn't even know he had ordered ahi tuna  because what I saw and what I thought it looked like was chicken lol. I asked him why he got chicken and he told me it's tuna, and that it's super drying. For $3 more we got fried salmon along with that meal. Holy shit, the chef should feel ashamed of himself for even serving that salmon to us!! It was the saltiest piece of shit I've ever ate.. it was so salty.... it wasn't edible. The rest of the rolls came and to be quite honest, everything tasted very mediocre. I was so disappointed because it definitely didn't satisfy my sushi craving. The California roll was the worst, the crab meat was so dry, I couldn't eat another piece after trying one. 
However!! Their sake nigiri was pretty fresh and good. 

I'm just super disappointed with my experience here. Can't believe they had the audacity to serve us that salty ass salmon, and I love salmon!! 

Their service is slow af too. At the end of the meal, my boyfriend was really upset with his meal he complained to one of the waitresses about the fish and salmon. She even said that it is dry.. then why do you guys keep serving this inedible dish?! Wtf. They still charged us for it. $60 for a pan of bean sprouts, salty ass salmon and mediocre sushi. 
Definitely won't be returning.
author: Tiffany K.

description:
I am so glad we found this gem!This is me and my girl's 3rd time here in 2 weeks. 

We only ordered nigiri our 3 visits here, however it never disappoints! The fish and prices can't be beat and all of our servers have been exceptionally nice to us. We even got free ice cream at the end of our meal. The wait can be kind if long depending on what and how much nigiri you order, however. I think we are known as regulars now. Lol

We get the salmon, hamachi, unagi, and white tuna nigiri every time. Mmmm.. My mouth is watering just thinking about it.
author: Anderson V.

description: Totally worth the wait. Sushi is fresh, delicious, and hit the spot on hot summer night. The house cold sake is delicious, and comes with a generous serving! Prices are great -- especially for SF.
author: Kristin S.

description: Had a first date here and it the sushi certainly helped with the success of it. Good service. Shrimp tempura is delicious. I go here at least once a month now and the consistency in taste and service is great. Their daily roll specials are worth giving a shot especially with the elaborate names to them.
author: Fernando G.

description:
Great spot!  We are staying south of Golden Gate park, and had walked our feet off in the park, so we wanted a very close, local place. Yelpers give this place 5 stars, and it delivers on all levels. Full of locals, we were lucky to get a table on a Tuesday night, although there were a couple of seats available at the lovely sushi bar, and a low table in the window seat. All seats were full by the time we left with people waiting for our table.
Service was very friendly and conscientious about checking on us. Prices were amazingly low. We ordered a shrimp tempura platter which came with a good miso soup, salad, rice, 4 shrimp skewers and  6 veggies AS WELL as dessert for $11. The veggies were okay, but the shrimp was incredibly battered, and cooked to perfection. Mmm, still reliving their crunchy goodness. My husband and I split the order, but since we had ordered 3 different sushi rolls, we did not have room for dessert. All the sushi rolls were tasty and fresh. 
Beer and wine are available, with a glass of nice red wine for $5. They apologized profusely for not having a large bottle of Sapporo, only a regular size, which ended up being a good thing, since we did not have room for dessert, much less more beer.
author: Debra R.

description:
I'm a fan of good Japanese food, unfortunately, I'm not a fan of Tazaki Sushi. My best friend, however, loves this place. Me, not so much... The restaurant is fairly small so there's a wait for mediocre Japanese food. Let's get into further details.

Food:
My meal was bland, tasteless, and overall lacking flavor. I ordered the Katsu Curry (~$13), expecting lots of flavor from the sauce. I found myself adding salt, soy sauce, and at some point even Sriracha to my katsu. The katsu should provide the flavor for the white rice, that's the whole point. I ate a quarter of my meal, not even half. I also tried some of my friends' California Roll. It tasted like straight up mayo (One of my major pet peeves! Don't drown the sushi with mayo, it defeats the purpose.)

I did like that the meal came with Miso soup and Ice cream though!

Service: 
The food took forever to get to our table, which I usually don't mind because it gives me time to catch up with friends. However, this place was extra slow. Not sure if they're understaffed in the kitchen, but man it took about half an hour for our food to arrive. Our food also arrived at different intervals, so my food was cold by the time my friends had gotten their Bento boxes. 

The waiters though are very attentive and nice, which I appreciated. Good service on their behalf. The food preparation was definitely something out of their control, so can't blame them on that part. 

Atmosphere:
Lots of families and group of friends. We visited on a Saturday night and it took us about 10 minutes to get seated which is relatively fast considering their small venue. The interior is nothing fancy, pretty simple and straight to the point. It was clean, from what I could see. I probably wouldn't go out of my way to come back here again. There are better Japanese restaurants in the same area.
author: Stefany Z.

description:
My friend lives nearby, so we decided to give this place a try. This review is based on my takeout experience only. 

I came with the intention of simply ordering a specialty roll to go, as I wasn't too hungry - but the moment I walked in, my nostrils were engorged with the dazzling aroma of sweet and savory teriyaki sauce. I ended up ordering salmon teriyaki ($12.95) while my friend ordered ahi tuna teriyaki ($14.95) to go. 

We waited about 15-20 minutes for our food. Each of our orders came with a side of miso soup, small side salad, white rice, and our entree - pretty standard. The miso soup was nice and hot, warming my palate at first sip. The salad was just some pieces of lettuce with thousand island drizzled over it - nothing special. 

Now, when I bit into the salmon teriyaki.... INSTANT DISAPPOINTMENT. When I took another bite, and another... TOTAL REGRET. The salmon was extremely bland; it didn't taste the least bit seasoned. The teriyaki sauce was light and watery, sweet and savory, but not at all powerful enough to combat the utter lack of flavor from the salmon. The salmon was also very dense and overcooked and chewy. There was nothing that could save this dish. My friend said her ahi tuna turned out similar...as in tasteless and overcooked. I am saddened to say that this was probably the worst salmon teriyaki I've ever had at a Japanese restaurant.

Aside from the total miss from my teriyaki takeout experience, I do remain hopeful and would give this place another shot. Everyone deserves a second chance, right? Although i can't comment too much on the service, every staff member I interacted with seemed pretty friendly. The restaurant itself is pretty cute and quaint inside as well. Next time I'll definitely skip the teriyaki and try the sashimi/sushi instead, which is what I intended to do in the first place... 

Tl;dr - Never judge a restaurant by the way it smells...Lesson learned.
author: Cheryl N.

description:
First time trying this place on a friend recommendation. Wait til I see my friend! I'm gonna kick his ASS!!!  

I ordered the Butter Fish. When it came out the waitress covered the fish. When I uncovered the fish I was in a state of shock, disbelief, angry and mortified how tiny the 2 pieces of fish I got. It was like Nigiri Butter Fish!! If anyone ever had the feeling of being completely cheated, ripped off or scammed, that's how I felt. For $15.28 I got 2 tiny pieces of fish and the rest of the sizzling platter was full of Bean Sprouts! So actually they should rename the dish to Sizzling Bean Sprout with a Dab of fish. The owner, who was behind the sushi bar should be ashamed of himself for serving this. I told the waitress I do not want this if this is all I'm getting, it's not worth it. She took it back and showed the owner. He said it isn't like the picture we saw and that was the wrong picture. I said no matter what picture you should be ashamed serving so little food for that price. He told me he will take the fish back and said for me not to come back either!! Instead of saying "let me add more fish".  See what happens when a place gets too popular? The owner doesn't care cause he doesn't need your business. So that's why I'm giving the Cheap Son of a Bitch 1 star. Not only is he ripping people off, over charging for his food and he doeant give a shit about his customers! The ones he kisses ass to he knows he is cheating them thats why they keep going back. I can only hope people will see how he treats his customers and eventually he will go out of business! 

Here is the positive: the slices of fish for the Nigiri was very good sized, the fish was fresh and the service was good. Even with that, because of the shitty customer service from the Owner I gave 1 star.
author: Rod W.

description: Came here on a double date and the food was pretty good the staff and the waiters and the owners were really friendly. We got tons of food table filled with food and all for under a hundred which was super nice. What I like the most was it wasn't just any typical Japanese restaurant they actually had a lot of really good rules a lot of good food so I definitely will be back price as awesome as well
author: Michele T.

description:
Came here after church service on a Sunday.  One of the deciding factors to come here was due to its location, knowing that there would be parking around this area.  Another reason is that it's big enough to fit a carseat, one of the things you start considering when you have a baby.  
We had sushi, I don't remember which ones.  I love the variety of fish unlike other places that only serve salmon and tuna.  Quality is good too.  Husband and I agreed that this is worth going back to when we're in the city.  Definitely gonna try more of their other dishes.
author: Claire J.

description:
A mixture of a modern restaurant with 2 large flat screen TV's blasting sports and a traditional floor-seating area in the corner. Overall, not intimidatingly fancy and a casual place for sushi.

Food: Loved the complimentary edamame with fresh and large beans inside! The miso soup was somewhat salty, but very flavorful. The yakisoba came in large portions, but it was too heavily drenched in salty soy sauce for my taste. The bento box comes with 3 selected dishes and miso soup, white rice, and ice cream. We picked the salmon teriyaki, salmon sashimi, and hamachi sashimi. Very fresh, flavorful, and perfectly cut fish. The ice cream comes at the end when you've finished your meal, and it came with 3 choices: green tea, rocky road, and cookies and cream! I'm a huge ice cream enthusiast so I love how they have unique flavors and it was actually pretty good quality!
author: Vicki L.

description:
I found a new favorite sushi spot! If only it wasn't so far from where I live...
But anyways, great prices, great sushi, fresh sashimi and I'm impressed with how big the pieces of sashimi are on the rolls! 

What I like about this place is that a majority of the rolls are under $10. 
The specialty nigiri stuff come with 2 pieces and those get a little more pricey, but that is because it has things like large pieces of uni, sashmi, quail egg, etc. 

What I've tried (and they were all delish! would recommend them all) :
- Yakuza Roll- soft shell crab, eel, avocado, and shrimp tempura
- 49er Roll- salmon, scallop, lemon
- Philadelphia roll- salmon, cream cheese (surprisingly my favorite)
- Pumpkin sushi- raw scallop and tobiko wrapped in salmon sashimi (2 pieces)

They also have bento boxes and udon, but I don't really pay attention to those because I'm all about sushi. I've always went when they are opening at 5pm, so I'm not sure how crowded it may get.
author: Kathleen Y.

description: Service improved and place is just a god dam good deal man so plus 1 more star for you all.
author: Vince L.

description: 3.5 stars. The fish tastes good but they use Thai jasmine rice instead of Japanese short grain rice. Perhaps they ran out of proper sushi rice on the day I went, but that is pretty unacceptable. It is a good neighborhood spot, but I would not travel out of my way to eat here. I would also avoid peak hours because the food quality does not justify the wait.
author: Jason C.

description: A sushi restaurant that is well rated should serve fish that is flavorful and delicate, not bland and thick.  The rice should be balanced and compliment the fish, not detract from it.  The fish here is so lacking in flavor that one can't tell the butterfish from the hamachi.  The chirashi bowl did look pretty and it had a dime-sized speck of uni as well as ikura, which details might have allowed for a second star in suburbia, but not in SF.  In the city, one expects flavor delivered to the taste buds, not just food that LOOKS Japanese.  You can smell it just walking in the door--this stinky restaurant serves mass-produced, clunky, and unrefined food, like sushi made in China.  Sushi made in China.  Sushi made in China.  Sushi made in China.  Sushi made in China.  Sushi made in China.  Sushi made in China.  Sushi made in China.  Sushi made in China.  Sushi made in China.  Sushi made in China.  Sushi made in China.  Sushi made in China.  Sushi made in China.  Sushi made in China.  Sushi made in China.  Sushi made in China.  Sushi made in China.
author: Zeus M.

description:
For the price, this place definitely deserves 5 stars! A good amoint of options, and the food is quite good!

The udon is a bit too salty though, but aside from that, I was extremely satisfied!!
author: Anthony G.

description:
Great sushi restaurant. We go here all the time because it's fresh, delicious, walking distance and nice staff. Chirashi sushi is our favorite dish. We get it all the time. We like the salmon teriyaki and the various sushi dishes. Pretty much everything we've tried here was excellent. 

Sometimes there is a line but no more than 30 min.
author: Patricia L.

description: Place was very clean, servers were very nice, meal came with complimentary edemame! Cold and not salted but still good. The sushi was sort of flavorless. I guess some people like that but I like to taste the fish and I like when there is a lot of sauce. Also, the ginger wasn't strong enough. Nice little place to try over the weekend...
author: Colby D.

description:
Meh - That's the first word that comes to my mind when I think of Tazaki sushi.
Don't get me wrong, it wasn't bad, it was just extremely mediocre and below my expectations. 

I got Philly rolls, Cherry Blossom rolls and Yellowtail rolls. First of all, I was pretty upset about the fact that both Philly rolls and Cherry Blossom rolls contained avocado, which wasn't mentioned anywhere. I don't like avocado so every time I order sushi I make sure there's no avocado in it. I suggest whoever takes care of the menu to write EVERYTHING that's in the roll and not just the kind of fish. Besides that, Philly rolls and cherry blossom rolls were pretty good (after I picked the avocado off of everything) while I personally didn't like the Yellowtail ones. 

The service wasn't impressive, it was alright and everyone was nice to us. It could have been better but it could have also been worse. Just like the food. 

To summarize, I just think there's tons of better sushi places out there, so I wouldn't recommend this one as first choice, but if you're in the area and you're looking for below average and mediocre sushi, then that's the place to go.
author: Valentina C.

description:
I went here with my family and my boyfriend and we thought that this was a really great restaurant!

My sister called ahead to reserve a table for four and we were seated smoothly. We also ordered almost right away. I got a rice bowl with beef and eggs in it as well as California roll and it was really good!

This is like a restaurant you'd never expect to find in the Outer Sunset and it's definitely worth a visit!
author: Rick O.

description:
Second time visiting this location while I was traveling to SF.  Sushi has always been fresh, Bento boxes are wonderful.  Hot green tea and ice cream after are included with a meal.  

Beer available but the food is enough to enjoy!
author: Adam R.

description: Amazing Sushi and Tempura Calamari definitely my favorite! I recommend this place to everyone
author: Ricardo C.

description: If you're looking for no frills, fresh tea, generous portions, and great food this is your place. Friendly service that was attentive but not overbearing. Free tea and ice cream afterwards are bonus. Perfect for families or that date night.
author: Danielle M.

description: We had chirashi bowl and a few nigiris.  Nothing special except the uni we had wasn't very fresh.  The price is pretty good though.
author: Jenny X.

description: The wait for food after seating was relatively long (~40 minutes) but normal for a sushi restaurant. There are two sushi chefs on a busy Friday night. They gave us a complimentary tuna poke to snack on as we waited which was nice of them. Waitresses were attentive and polite. I got the sashimi combination entree of 16 pieces but received a total of 20 (4 pieces used as a decorative centerpiece on the plate. Some pieces were relatively small but still delicious nonetheless. The side of miso soup, edamame, rice, and salad definitely made it a complete meal. Ice cream comes with all entrees at the end!  Fresh food, great service, good tea. A solid 4 stars for the value this sushi place offers!
author: Harry W.

description: Absolutely the best sushi we have ever had.  We had 5 rolls and literally choose from the pictures in the menu.
author: Karin O.

description:
This place is a bit pricey but what good sushi joint isn't? The fish is always fresh and I'm always left satisfied with my meal. The head chef/owner is super friendly and so are the servers, you really get that family kind of feel over here.

Besides sushi, their bento boxes are great as well. Big portions and it's a good deal with a nice bowl of miso soup and scoop of ice cream. Top that off with complimentary edamame and hot green tea and your day is made!

The only food I would avoid over here are the noodle soups (ramen/udon). Soy sauce is the only flavor I get from the broth and it just doesn't do for me. Ramen has more of an egg noodle consistency and lacks that thick and deep broth I crave for in mine.

Solid 4 stars
author: Katie G.

description:
Good food, awful service. Twice now, I've had to wait half an hour for my food to arrive, or nearly one full hour counting the time I asked where the tuna was from before ordering it. I wanted to be sure it wasn't the endangered, overfished bluefin tuna that so many sushi restaurants serve. Rather than giving me a straight answer, the waitress disappeared for 30 minutes or so before coming back to take my order.

On the positive side, the bento box comes with some appetizing choices and the Eclipse Roll is to die for.
author: Dan S.

description:
We walked in and the owner behind the sushi bar says it's been "years" since we've been back. That true.  
We met up with friends who live in the 'hood for dinner.
Started off with 8 hamachi nigiri ($3/pair) and they were good. The fish was fresh, room temp and the rice held up nicely but wasn't flavored.
BFF and I ordered the Walu butterfly sizzling fish dish.  I was disappointed for $13. 
The sizzling fish platters are more flavorful and better at Ozakuya on Taraval St. 
This fish had a metallic taste and was overcooked.  It did come out quit sizzly to the point the waitress had to cover it with a paper towel to keep it from splattering all over you.
The bean sprouts which I usually love in this dish was over cooked in some parts (burnt black) and then seemed a tad under cooked in other parts. 
They were generous with tea you got complimentary edamame (soy beans) at the onset of your meal.  
Hubby had the combo bento box - fried chicken nuggets (tad dry), teriyaki beef and tempura shrimp (2 prawns and 3 vegts) - which was good.  
Dessert was included - vanilla ice cream and mocha almond.   $70 for 4 of us w/o tip but we didn't have alcohol.  If we return in "years" from now, I might stick with the sushi instead of the dinners unless it's tempura.
author: Ry T.

description:
First time here today! We were impressed! We had the  sizzling seafood plate! We didn't realise they were having something special with the sizzling plates until the waitress told us so! 1 regular price of the seafood sizzling plate and you pay half with the other plate! 

The sizzling plates come with miso soup, rice, and ice cream for dessert!

The creamy roll's delish! 

I'll come back again for sure!
author: Emil J.

description: so far so great... Been very pleased with freshness of sushi. Bento box very satisfying for the price!! love the stir fry ramen noodles!!
author: Louie S.

description:
Randomly went to this place because we were craving Japanese food and this place looked good.  Both the complimentary soy beans and miso soup were salty, and the soy beans were overcooked. For two people,  we ordered 4 items,  which was more than enough.  Towards the end of the meal,  we were both stuffed.  

Midnight express $6.50,  2 pieces
Quail egg on black caviar on top of rice,  wrapped with halibut.  The halibut was fresh and tasty, however I didn't like this because I personally don't like black caviar.  

Pumpkin sushi $6.50,  2 pieces 
Chopped up raw (?) scallops with some sauce on top of rice,  wrapped with salmon.  I love scallops and salmon so this was the perfect dish for me. Both ingredients were fresh and I liked the sauce. I would definitely recommend this.  

Soft shell crab appetizer $7.95
The breading is different from other Japanese restaurants.  It's was more of a fried calamari breading..  I'm not sure how to describe it.  Although it was tasty and crunchy,  I prefer the regular breading.  It was also tiny for $8 so I wouldn't order it again.  

3 item bento box with salmon teriyaki,  beef teriyaki and vegetable tempura. $13.95
The salmon teriyaki was small but it was good.  The skin was crunchy and it was cooked perfectly.  The beef teriyaki was hard and chewy. The vegetable tempera was nice and crunchy.
author: May S.

description:
We were craving sushi in Outer Sunset and chose Tazaki Sushi due to the great reviews.  We've been twice and surprisingly Tazaki Sushi is a good choice for the area - if you order the right things.  

This small restaurant seems to be a neighborhood favorite and some people even call ahead to make reservations.  Our first dinner there we ended up at the sushi bar and ordered a variety of rolls: spicy tuna roll, spider maki roll, creamy roll and shared a bento that came with chicken karaage, California roll and shrimp mixed tempura.  I wasn't expecting much with the rolls but was surprised on the flavor and the freshness of the seafood.  I think the rolls could have been a little bigger though.  Our favorite was probably the creamy roll which was scallop and tuna with a creamy slight carroty tasting sauce.  The crab was perfectly breaded/fried in the spider roll, but I'm used to having a big roll for it.  Spicy tuna was standard but pleasing.  The bento box was big and fairly priced for what we got - wings & drumsticks of chicken karaage, 4 pieces of California roll, two big tempura shrimps with a handful of tempura veggies.  Chicken was delicately fried and had a nice sweet salty sauce.  The tempura wasn't very greasy either.  California roll was standard.  I totally miss Joy Sushi in San Mateo when the sushi craving hits!

The second time we came we got two rolls and a katsu don.  While the seafood was fresh, the pork, not sure if it wasn't fresh, but it was just rubbery.  I definitely prefer katsu don at other places.  The thing that kind of kills the rating here too, is the service.  It's pretty slow and I feel like the girls here can get flustered at times.  The guys at the sushi bar are cool, but you still can get ignored by the waitresses if you sit there since they have to take you order, bring you your hot food and check.  And, with both the katsu don and bento boxes on those two seperate occasions, it's a meal and includes ice cream, the second time we went one of the waitresses just gave us the bill when we asked for it and didn't even ask us about which ice cream we would like, we had to follow up with her.  

Lots of people seem to get one of the sizzling plates they offer.  We may have to try that next time with a roll or two of course.  Generally, if you stick with the sushi or chicken karaage or tempura, you're golden.  3 stars for now.
author: Cat C.

description:
This place (AKA: Tazaki Sushi) has always provided great food and service to me and whomever I am with. I have been here with someone like a grandmother to me, came here with a date before, enjoyed dinner while catching up with a friend, etc. In the past, I always seem to go when they aren't so busy. However, with the game going on and it being a Saturday night, I experienced the place being packed for once and I felt I was due to write a good review for this place. 

That night they were packed, they were understaffed, so the service was a tad slower than usual, but that did not stop them from checking on me and my friend just enough times (how we were, and for more tea). Plus, despite the crazy busy night, flagging down a server wasn't impossibly difficult. 

I order things in the menu that have raw seafood - salmon sashimi, fatty tuna sashimi, and sunset roll (aka uni roll) and the spoon (a spoon with uni, oyster, quail egg, tobiko, and garnish). As always, I'm never disappointed and can taste how fresh the ingredients are (FYI, it was quite generous portions). Seriously (for uni lovers), the uni they used in the roll was soft because it's getting mushed to get rolled up, while the uni used in the spoon was a bit more solid - both had the same vivid orange color and were yummy. Oh, and the fatty tuna was fall apart and melt in your mouth good. 

Anyway, what really pushed me to write this review on this place is when we checked on the status of a bento box they were taking unusually long to make. They were VERY apologetic that they neglected that portion of our order because it was written on the back corner by our server. I know that we're all human and things happen, but it's the fact that they took responsibility for it and put that missing part of dinner as top priority after realizing their mistake is what I'm very please about. 

My only memo to the business would be that their miso soup is rather salty, but that is an easy fix. 

Excellent food with courteous service!! This is definitely one of my top places for good Japanese food in the city - especially for raw seafood!!
author: Christina L.

description:
SASHIMI PARTAYYY IN MY MOUTH! Everything is high quality and reasonably price, but the melt-in-my-mouth SASHIMI is what brings me back. All the sashimi is fresh and buttery :3

All the combos in general are a great deal. Sashimi combo is ~$15. The bf & I usually get two combos, and usually leave with leftovers because there is a good amount of food. Combos also come with complimentary ice cream (green tea, sesame, vanilla, chocolate). 

There are three types of seating: regular tables, sushi bar, or "traditional" Japanese style on a padded floor! Really cute, esp for date nights.
author: Samantha C.

description: This is a neighborhood sushi joint that is walkable from Ocean Beach. It's not a fancy place, and by that I mean this is not the place to bring your date unless you've gotten past that stage of needing to impress someone with looks. While appearing homely, Tazaki Sushi delivers fast service and large portions of sushi. For 6 slices of salmon sashimi, a caterpillar roll, and one order (two pieces) of tamago, I paid $20. That's pretty darn inexpensive for California. Finally, I appreciated the real shiso leaf instead of that fake plastic leaf that most cheap places will give you. Thanks for not judging me while I ate my food alone at the bar. If I lived in SF, I'd definitely be back.
author: Jaclyn O.

description:
This is my go to SUSHI spot. It is delicious. I am hesitant to rave about this spot too much, because it is my go to- but they deserve an awesome review. 
Appetizers I would recommend the Hamachi Collar, or the gyoza. Both delicious. 
And for the courses my boyfriend and I ALWAYS get sashimi hamachi and sake. both are fresh and they don't skimp on the sizes. For rolls the 49 roll is delicious ( i believe that is the first one on the menu with scallops and fresh lemon on top!) and there also the entre plates. I have had almost all of them and never been disappointed. 
They have an average size sake collection, and they are always a fast spot. They only take reservations of a party of 4 or more, so get there during dinner rush a little early. They have great for small groups, the ambiance is pretty casual and it is never too loud. They have a larger room set aside for large parties, but you need to reserve it a little in advance, even if it is same day but just early in the day 
They do have a few tvs and are wiling to change the channel- but mostly they have the games on which is cool. 
One time, i got pretty drunk and left not one-but two designer sunglasses at my table. I called and they had them set aside. Life happens- and i didn't pick them up for over a week and they were right there waiting for me. I thought that was just a nice gesture because I couldn't have been mad if they didn't have them, or they could have lied, but the fact that they held on to them made me more grateful to have such a nice neighborhood spot, just a few blocks away.
author: Julie H.

description:
Gave Tazaki Sushi a try based on being conveniently close to me at the exact moment I had a craving for sushi. I will most definitely return soon.

Complimentary tea and edamame as soon as we sat down. Hostesses friendly and attentive. Portions generous, quality excellent, and reasonable priced! Complimentary ice cream at the end. 

Had an assortment of items on this trip, next time around will likely double-down on nigiri options. That was the winner that hit the spot for me this time around.
author: David G.

description:
I'm not sure why this place is so hyped up.. Maybe this is the best they get in SF but down in LA.. Toro is melt in your mouth and salmon nigiri is DEF not hard to chew.

The spicy tuna tasted like soap, they missed one of our orders (so we waited for like 20 minutes wondering why the last roll never showed, and apparently the waitress missed it on the sushi order form).. And to top it off.. Never been to a sushi place that didn't serve iced green tea. 75$ wasted.. And we left hungry and unsatisfied. 

Two stars because the Philadelphia roll was half way decent and we love it when they jam it with cream cheese.
author: Frances R.

description: Two Words: Midnight Express. Halibut, Quail Egg, and Black Caviar. Definitely coming back for more. Delicious!
author: Aldenn C.

description: Truly wonderful sushi.   I was a little reluctant to post a review because I am not sure I want many people to know about this great little restaurant.   It gets very busy on the weekend, but definitely worth the wait.   The California roll is made with real crab meat, and the taste is phenomenal.
author: Yang Q.

description:
First time I came here was about a month ago and everything was fine except that the service was a BIT slow and the sake tasted weird.

However, I came here with my parents today and it was a shit show. 
- We waited for over 30 minutes when there were tables available. 
- We waited over 45 minutes for our food! (It was just two combo sashimi and a roll) -- they basically had to slice raw fish for the most part 
- They didn't put in our order until 30 minutes after we complained (they also didn't put in the order for the table next to us)
- After complaining, they gave us 2 bowls of rice and a "roll" on the house but it looked like crap and one of the waitresses gave us attitude when giving it to us. 
- The sushi chefs are not attentive at all; when I went up to pay for the dinner (so I didn't have to wait another 30 minutes to get some service), he told me to not leave because my food will be ready soon.. WHEN I HAD ALREADY GOTTEN IT AND ATE IT.
author: Sherry T.

description: We did take out Sunday evening. It was ready on time and the maki and nigiri was very good. All very fresh. I think the prices are lower than trendy places so you get more value here. Highly recommended.
author: Kristin W.

description: I basically live here, so I should finally write a review. This place is amazing, and my husband and I are usually here once a week. The food is reasonably priced. We usually end up spending about $40 or less on dinner for the two of us (2 miso, 1 roll, 3 nigiri). The sushi is incredible! There are days when the fish is fresher than others, but the best sushi we have ever had was from Tazaki Sushi.
author: Abby S.

description:
If it came to just the food, Tazaki is a solid 4-4.5. The sashimi is fresh, the rolls are flavorful, and the combinations from the bento boxes give a great variety. Takazi also offers sizzling fish plates, ramen bowls, and really yummy ice cream. 

BUT, the service is less than desirable. This is taken from a slow Wednesday and an extremely busy Friday. Both were lacking of attention. Although all the attendants were friendly, many basic things were forgotten. They totally disregarded my party's miso soup. It did not come out for 35 minutes. I watched a whole 2nd quarter and halftime show of a Warriors game. Nothing came to the table, not even tea. Instead of admitting that they forgot, they insisted it was because it was busy and that we ordered sushi rolls. That would be true except we also ordered kitchen food including appetizers. 

Parties around us who sat AFTER us, with the same number of people, received everything including miso and entrees/rolls. After arguing, things started to slowly come out of the kitchen with large chunks of time in between orders. Just tell me you forgot, that's all. And worse, the waitress gives me the check without offering ice cream. When I bring it to her attention again, she brings us ice cream saying "it's on the house".   -__- It comes with the meal, lady. 

On the slow day, our waitress brought out everything but it took 3-4 reminders. That was frustrating in itself. 

I really do like this spot. It's convenient on my commute. I like small restaurants, especially those supported by the surrounding neighborhood. And Tazaki is big on Bay Area sports. But man, don't make me upset before you bring out your delicious food. It really spoils the appetite. Come here for the food, be weary of the service.
author: Carlo D.

description: After our neighborhood Sushi closed down we had to look for a new goto place for Japanese food. I think we just found it. Friendly place and very fresh sashimi. Sitting at the sushi counter we could watch the chef at work. The tempura was piping hot and crunchy. Definitely coming back!
author: Jan L.

description: 3.5 stars - uni sushi roll! Pretty decent! Sashimi was decently fresh. 35 pieces for $48 is a good price. There's no wait too. Service was good.
author: SCSR L.

description:
DISCLAIMER: This review is based on service, food was not a factor.

There is a good reason for this 1 star review, and I generally do not write a review unless I am trying to help the community. Let my mistake of deciding to eat dinner here on a nice Friday night be the savior of yours.

Me and a couple of my friends just finished enjoying a show and we were pretty hungry. This place came up on yelp, and we decided to bite

Big Mistake.

After we are seated, it took awhile for us to get our waiter. It seems they were more busy with closing down rather then serving their remaining eager customers. 
The food however was pretty decent. I enjoyed the chicken karage and the teriyaki salmon. Again, food is not a factor in this review

Our group finished our meals. Supposedly we were suppose to get mochi ice cream with our entrees as well, but since we were eating near closing hours, we figured we shouldn't bother with it since we thought they had probably already put everything away. 

Here's where things turn for the worst. 
In my group, 4 out of the 6 of us ate, as the other 2 were not hungry and saw no need to spend extra to eat on a satisfied stomach. So the 15% group of 6 gratuity should NOT have applied to our table.

After paying AND leaving a tip (generous already), just as we are about to exit the door, I hear "Wait!" "You still forgot to pay another $4 tip"

That is where my day ended in utter disappointment. How could a 4 star yelp restaurant ASK for a $4 for tip, when the 15% gratuity did NOT apply to us? Again, 4/6 of us ate and actually ordered. 

When a place asks for tip ON TOP OF CLEARLY already being tipped, that is where I draw the line. 

Hope you all find this review helpful, and hopefully you tip right the first time. Nothing.
author: Kevin C.

description:
1 star for friendly service, 1 star for creativity, 1 star for the few items that were decent ....I wish I could give this place more stars but everything was pretty bland land. :(

Good reviews on Yelp and the pictures all looked so good!  I was really looking forward to try their midnight roll (caviar/quail egg wrapped in halibut) and pumpkin sushi (scallops wrapped in salmon), but was disappointed as both were lacking in flavor.  Couldn't taste the fish at all.  Same with the sashimi combo.  Ordered several rolls, one was fried and came out soggy, the other two were tasteless.  Few items I did enjoy were the amaebi nigiri and deep fried shrimp heads and agedashi.  

Maybe my taste buds were off but everyone in my party were also disappointed with the experience.
author: The Q.

description:
I dont know how this place has so many good reviews. My girlfriend and I walked in to eat something for dinner because we were lazy to cook and ordered some Ika teriyaki. The squid was really chewy and the teriyaki sauce was watery. I ordered fired noodles with chicken and literally there was no chicken on the dish and it was over seasoned.
The food took over 20 mins to arrive and there were only 4 people eating. The employee at the sushi bar were talking loud and everything  was just unpleasant. 

NOT RECOMMENDED !!
author: Ashish N.

description: Our favorite sushi place and only a few blocks away from home! They open at 5pm, so it's nice to get out of work and rush over before the crowd packs in. It's fun to sit at the bar and tatami. The fish is incredibly fresh, the servers are so welcoming and friendly, and the udon is the best we have found in the city so far!
author: Erika C.

description:
This restaurant is awesome!  Great foods (great quality, especially the salmon sashimi and teriyaki, so yummy) and great service.  Both in-restaurant dining and delivery are more than fine.  Even when it is full house, the service is still great, courteous, and fast.

Just one request, please open for lunch as well, I think a lot of people will appreciate it, including my family :)
author: Meiko S.

description:
Probably some of the best sushi I've ever had. We live nearby & are lucky to have it within walking distance. We went recently for my boyfriend's birthday & it was a real treat to sit up at the bar & watch the chefs at work. 
Well worth checking out.
author: Fi M.

description: Tanzaki is solid. Big pieces of fish make up for their mediocre quality. Love the special "black pearl" nagiri with quail egg and fresh fish and roe wrapped around rice. Really enjoy that the squid nigiri comes with shiso leaf! I come here once or twice a month. I do wish they were as good as Yuzen that closed but a girl can dream! The service here is great! Sweet, fast, smiling people and the sushi bar is tended by real Japanese trained sushi chefs. Everything is fresh. I do wish they would get even higher quality uni, though!
author: Priya S.

description:
My friend Vivian loves this place since she lives very close by.  When we came in on a Saturday afternoon on Valentine's Day, they were still very friendly and accommodating.  

We got the chicken karaage entree meal and three orders of rolls for the two of us.  After splitting the soup, salad, and the ice cream, the total for all that food was about $40 after tax and tip!  Very affordable for that much food.  Oh and the karaage was super good and our three rolls of salmon, unagi, and spicy tuna were also tasty.

The place is definitely old based on looking around at the floor, tables, and chairs.  But other than a lack of parking on Judah in general, this place seems like a great place for a relaxing low key meal.  The next time I come up to visit anyone in the Sunset, Tazaki would probably one of my first choices to consider.
author: Ben H L.

description: My favorite sushi place in SF and maybe in California. I also live in Hawaii so I'm used to really fresh sushi that is also reasonable- and friendly service too. Tazaki has all of this and more. I have to go regularly. Extremely great staff there as well.
author: Georgianna D.

description:
This is one of those places I often pass by driving but have never actually been to. It looks small on the outside but is surprisingly larger on the inside. It's also pretty spacious as far as seating goes, with a bar and also one section of seating where you can actually sit on the ground (Japanese style, pretty cool). My friend and I were confused when we got there because a white dude greeted us to seat us, but maybe we were just being racist for assuming an Japanese person would greet us at a Japanese place (lol). 

Either way, we got seated right away. We split the volcano roll and ask each got our own bento boxes. The atmosphere was chill, and very lively. It's bright inside, too. There are a lot of servers and workers, who all were nice and on top of it. My tea got filled up every time it was halfway empty. The food came fairly quickly and was really good! The volcano roll was spicier than I expected but still delicious. My overall experience here was good except for the food being a bit pricier than expected for the amount I received. I'd come back again, though, for sure!
author: Krystle L.

description:
Congrats, Tazaki Sushi. You have made my top 5 list of best sushi spots, ever.

Right off the bat, you present complimentary green tea and edamame. 

Then the sushi portions I think are slightly bigger than usual and tastes like butter, so you know it's really good stuff.

The fact that you are 6 blocks away from me makes me very happy as I will make a point to do repeat visits.
author: John M.

description:
Great little hidden gem of a sushi restaurant! I hadn't heard anything about this place until I yelped a sushi restaurant open till 10 (a lot in the sunset area close at 9:30). The owner, May, and the sushi chef, Tazaki, are very friendly and open to conversations about their work or the sushi ^^ The three rolls we got were all excellent! Will definitely be coming back 

Holiday roll- hamachi and avocado filled, topped with tuna 5 stars 

Cherry blossom Roll 5 stars 

Sky roll -4 stars 

Customer service 5/5!
author: Kay A.

description:
This is my go to spot for sushi. 

I've been coming here for almost 3 years, and it does not disappoint. I have a few favorites that I order and it's always super fresh and fast. The service is good but they do get busy during weekends. Usually the process is pretty speedy, so no complaints that. 

I am usually ordering take out, so it's usually get in and get out for me and parking park can be rough. 

The quality of the food is worth the price you're paying, in my opinion. I've paid for more "expensive" sushi but the quality can not match to what you get here at Tazaki.
author: Nancy T.

description: I came here with my family on a Sunday night because it was close by and had no wait. I don't know how this place has 4 stars on Yelp as their service is lacking and slow and their sushi/sashimi is mediocre at best. Our group's water/tea was not refilled even once. The waitress never stopped to ask us whether we needed anything or if the food was okay. You order your food by marking what you want on a piece of paper like you would at a dim sum place, which felt off for a Japanese restaurant. We never received any edamame for our table while it looked like every other table had complimentary edamame. My group ordered hamachi kama and gyoza for our appetizer. The hamachi was dry and tasteless and the gyoza was bland even with the sauce. I ordered the omakase, which I thought was this restaurants only redeeming dish, but you can definitely get a better omakase elsewhere. The dragon roll we ordered was decent, but it seems pretty standard to get this roll right. I ordered another roll that included salmon, mango, and spicy tuna, and majority of it was spicy tuna. Even for the price, I wouldn't come back again. Avoid this place people.
author: Johnson C.

description: Great service from Karbo! Always ready to help with anything from refilling tea and making sure we had what we needed!
author: Kail H.

description: I ordered the $18 special promotion. Salty miso soup, some dry fish with no flavor, handful of bean sprouts and salmon cooked with a gallon of salt and ice cream. I rejected the ice cream because the food tasted like shit. They have no idea what the f*** they are cooking. This is an abomination. Food should be tasty. It should be tested at kitchen in home before serving to people. What the f*** were the cooks and chefs thinking... I pay no respect for the person who put this on the menu. Even the waitress agree that the fish is dry. This place is a joke.
author: John W.

description:
This is a great place to get sushi in the Outer Sunset! The prices don't break the bank, fresh fish, decent hot foods and good service. 

The 16 piece sashimi combo ($18.95) is such a great deal with a nice variety of fishes. Many of the meals comes with soup, salad AND ice cream. You get the whole shabang here! Most rolls average ~$10. You also get free edamame right when you sit. 

I'm not the hugest fan of the hot food, but it is a sushi restaurant so stick to what they're good at. The tempura was not very crispy and the beef teriyaki was a bit chewy. 

Service is decent here, but can be pretty slow during peak hours. It can end up taking awhile to get your food when they're really busy which is torture when you're hungry. Overall, this is my go-to sushi joint in the Sunset.
author: Hanhie D.

description:
I love this place! I may be biased, I live a little more than a block away and this is the place where we got engaged but I've been a fan for years now.

The fish is fresh and the service is amazing. The seaweed salad is one of my favorite things one the menu, it is super delicious. 

We almost always get the creamy roll which has a delicious carrot type sauce that adds a lot to the roll. The roll is fried so not for someone watching their waistline but definitely a highlight on the menu.

I love unagi and have tried pretty much every roll on the menu with eel. My favorite is just the simple avocado and unagi roll, a perfect mix of two of my favorites.
author: Stephanie S.

description:
Came here on a Thursday night around 545. Ordered a bento box and two rolls. Bento box came first about 30 minutes after we ordered. Two sushi rolls came after we had finished demolishing the bento box about another 30 minutes later. The wait was very long. 

Tomato in bento box salad still had the sticker on it. When I asked the waitress for another tomato she giggled. She did come back later and apologize. When the sushi rolls came out they were squished and did not look visually attractive. The sushi plate also came with a bug- non-flying black with a white stripe- which we trapped underneath the plate. When we told the waitress there was a bug under the plate she grimaced and killed it with our napkin and apologized. We paid our full bill. We were not offered any replacement food. I did not enjoy the food after I knew my salad had not been washed. I really did not enjoy the sushi knowing the plate had a bug on it.

I am sure the restaurant means well, the staff were nice. I still would not recommend.
author: Crystal T.

description: First time here the other night and will come again. Snake and Volcano rolls; 49er roll; California (real crab meat) and Cherry Blossom rolls; Spider Rainbow roll; and 2 Sake rolls.  We also had the Yakisoba which was delicious.
author: Cheryl W.

description: Having dinner here tonight was such a big disappointment. Just as me and my boyfriend came in, we asked for a table for two. The waitress tells us to write our names on the clipboard. Not a problem. She comes back and asks if it is okay to seat us at the bar, again, not a problem. However, just as we were sitting down, the couple after us ended up getting a table right after. How this makes any sense? I don't know. We finally placed our orders: 6 pieces of white tuna sashimi, 1 order oyako soba, and 1 bento with chicken, beef and yellowtail sashimi. The waitress was consistent with filling our cups with tea, but sadly that was the only thing they kept coming. It took 15 minutes for our seemingly thin and small 6 pieces of sashimi to come. Sashimi of that quantity should not take that long. As I sat at the bar, I was observing how they were preparing every order. They had already finished plating our sashimi and left it on the counter until the rest of other people's orders were prepared and served... After waiting for another 25 minutes, we began to wonder where our food was, only to find out that there's only one chef. We finally got our food, the food was mediocre, and portions were stingy. Overall, this whole experience was unpleasant and uncomfortable.
author: Kass L.

description:
I was in SF singing karaoke with friend and felt like eating sushi, searched Yelp and found this restaurant. But the name of the restaurant is a bit misleading - is it Judah Okazuya or Tazaki Sushi? 

Anyway, once entered the restaurant, on a Saturday night, the restaurant was quite full. Sat down, free edamame, and ordered the following things:

1. Sashimi Combo - there were 20pcs and to my surprise it was so fresh! I wasn't expecting much actually just wanted to get some fish; but there was no taste of "ice" which a lot of sushi restaurants do. There were 5 kinds of fish and all of them were good and fresh.

2. Soft shell crab combo - it was very well deep-fried and with the sauce, the whole thing was just very good

3. Karaage - don't know how to judge this one because it came with 4 big pieces of fried chicken instead of usual small bites of fried chicken. But anyway it was juicy and it tasted very crispy outside and soft inside.

4. Hamachi Kama - very surprised about this one because there were two pieces for one order! At the same time it was very well grilled; not overcook but still has that carbon taste which to me is quite essential for hamachi Kama

So after all, two people only less than $50 for all these!! If I were to get same quality and same quantity elsewhere in bay area, I guess at least $70. So good food good price. Five stars!

Oh and one more thing, I totally forgot my sunglasses in the restaurant and the waiter ran out, chased me for a block an gave it back to me. Very nice of him! All waiters and waitress service was super good and I felt like an important customer, one of these 5 stars must be given to the waiters and waitress!
author: Simon C.

description:
I've never felt the need to write a review before, until now... I ordered a couple of items to go and ate it when I got home within twenty or so minutes of when I picked it up. Against my better judgment, I kept eating it even as the fish seemed to be warm when sashimi should be somewhat cold even though it took me 20 or so minutes to get back home. Within half an hour of eating the sushi, I began to throw up along with bouts of sitting on the porcelain throne several times. I'm almost certain I have food poisoning.

To be fair, I've been to this place twice for takeout and this was the second time. The first time was absolutely fantastic whereas this time was the complete opposite. I'm not sure if the food sat out too long but they told me that it would be about 25 minutes to prep the food from when I called it for pick up and I did get there in about 25 minutes.

My order consisted of:
"The Spoon"
Midnight Express
49er roll
Yakuza roll
author: R C.

description:
So good I recommend the sizzling fish or tempura. Very good, servers are friendly, and prices are reasonable. 
Sushi is also delish!!
author: Emma G.

description: I guess I haven't written a review here. It's because this place doesn't need it. Tazaki is my go to spot. Always busy and as friendly as possible, even when swamped. I've only gotten take out but I'm treated just the same. Thank you Tazaki!
author: Koa K.

description:
I'm back on the Yelps to give further praise to my excellent local sushi joint. I am amongst the other spoiled 40th & Judah residents that have Tazaki just around the corner from their apartment, and I really can't say enough good things about this spot. It's consistently humble, comforting, delicious and a real welcome landing spot after dismounting the N Judah. 

You can always come here and receive excellently fresh ingredients. Try the sake sashimi, it's fantastic and always sliced generously. Their nigiris are also an act of generosity as they are cut to be big, satisfying bites. Their list of rolls is extensive, and it seems you can always find something you haven't had before. When it doubt, try these: Snake Roll, Swamp Roll, Dragon Roll, Summer Love Roll, and the Yakuza Roll. 

The miso soup. Oh the miso. It's such a lovely bowl of comfort. Always piping hot, full of flavor, and it's often the thing I crave after a 10 hour day at the office. 

The complementary edamame and attentively refilled green tea is very much appreciated, and it's a great touch that sets Tazaki apart. 

The service is always friendly and accommodating. Unless you find yourself in the middle of a dinner rush, you're never ignored at the door. They make sure to ask if the bar, a table, or a tatami is okay for seating instead of just assuming one way or the other. The owners always seem to be around keeping tabs on things, so quality of service is never left unattended. 

Until Tazaki, I never realized the necessity of having a homey sushi joint a measly 3 minute walk from my apartment. If I ever move, it'll be another requirement to add the the difficulty of finding a place to live in San Francisco. But in the meantime, I will happily continue to be a faithful Tazaki customer! 

Sashimi vacuum for life out.
author: Chelsea B.

description:
Amazing buttery sake sashimi here. Well worth the price. Service is a hit or a miss depending on how busy they are, but 85% of the time service will be on par. 

Bottom line, my favorite sushi place in SF. Affordable and amazing :)
author: Elaine S.

description:
Surprisingly cheap and good.

Judging from the location and decor, I had low expectations, but food turns out good and cheap.
We had the sushi rolls and be to box, tempura was alright, but fried chicken and grilled salmon are good! Portion are pretty big too. And then the sashimi was fresh too!

Good stuff! Will definitely come back before it becomes crowded!
author: Wing C.

description:
After a hike at lands end, my bf and I got hungry. I didn't plan to get hella full but I did here!  If you're one of those people who love  the sauce drenched sushi, you should go elsewhere cuz this is the exact opposite.

We came a few minutes after they opened. Surprisingly, we weren't first. Admittedly this ambiance is kinda weird. Doesn't give an authentic Japanese restaurant feel outside the bar area. It's just like another chinese restaurant. I also thought it was weird that our waiter was our chef and then later on, another waiter had no uniform (uh did you just hired him?)

Their menu is strange, the rolls are on a paper checklist and you just add a number next to the specific rolls. We were hungry and I think I ordered more than I could've finished.

Ordered 2 small 6 piece rolls (maki?). Shrimp tempura and spicy tuna I think? Very simple rolls. They don't even have fake crabs which I kinda wish we had. It will have just the fish u want inside. Definitely better than expected. Cheap, totally worth it. 

Got a holiday roll and some other salmon roll. Again, no sauce drenching here. Just fish as it is. The soy sauce brings out the flavors in the fish. Not exactly memorable tho.

Finally we got 3 nigiris. A hamachi, salmon and this midnight something. That last one was supposed to have a quail egg, caviar, and tuna wrapped but they ran out of quail egg and gave us uni instead. They did this before asking us which I felt was kinda rude. What if I didn't like uni? It's def not my fav, and I felt like I didn't have a choice and we didn't even get a discount because they didn't have the egg that I originally wanted. Yea I'm picky, but this is sushi. Tried it anyway. Wasn't spectacular at all. Caviar didn't even taste salty. This was definitely a disappointment.
The hamachi was good but my bf got the vein-y piece that were a bit too chewy. The salmon made up for it tho. Huge cuts and was so melt in your mouth good! Get this!

This place feels like authentic, reasonably priced sushi. I'd come back to try others.
author: Katie T.

description: I couldn't wait to give this restaurant 5 stars! I came here for dinner tonight (1st time) and it was delicious!, reasonably priced!, and had great service! What more could I ask for? I ordered the sashimi combo and it came with 20 (yes, 20!) pieces of delicious, fresh sashimi (salmon, yellowtail, red tuna, super white tuna, and swordfish)...for $17.95! Best fish was the white tuna...it just melts in your mouth! The hamachi and salmon were really good as well. The swordfish had a little tougher texture, but still pretty good. As if the sashimi itself wasn't enough of a good deal, dinner came with hot tea, edamame, rice, miso soup, salad, and ice cream! I love that! There were many other items on the menu that I wanted to try...must come back. Our waitress and the entire staff were friendly, helpful, and accommodating.
author: Jean S.

description:
It's the old Okazu Ya. The sign is still up.

Came here on a whim because my friend had a hankering for sea bass. 

You can have decent pseu-shi here, fairly priced.  This is not one of those places for sushi purists. You come here for rolls with sauces and multiple fish in it.

My friend got his sizzling platter of sea bass and it was huuuge with tons of bean sprouts underneath.

I settled for 2 rolls.

Nothing spectacular but it's decent.
author: Susy C.

description: This is my boyfriend and I's go to spot for sushi. The fish is always really fresh and I love how you can get free ice cream at the end of your meal. I always order either a bento box combo or the sashimi special. You can't go wrong with those two! The assorted tempura is also really delicious and great to share. The service here varies depending on how busy it is. This place gets packed around dinner time and the wait time can get intense. Try to stop by early to avoid the long wait!
author: Christine K.

description: Found our new shashimi spot! Salmon was like butta...melted in my mouth! Tasted soo fresh, unlike other sushi places I've been to. And they make it look soo pretty. I almost didn't want to eat it!
author: Anna M.

description: So my wife & I went last night to have dinner & had to wait 1hr to be seated. For the amount of people there was, the food came pretty quickly(30 min). Now, the food tasted pretty good but 3 hours after we had dinner both of us got sick! When I say sick I mean food poisoning! It was the absolute worst! This is the second time we've gone & the first was a lovely experience but the second was horrid. I figured I should write a review so people know, if it's packed on a Friday night, more than likely the fish has been sitting or contaminated!
author: Melissa L.

description:
How convenient that the one day I'm craving sushi, the sushi place near my work decides to be closed. Instead, my colleague and I opted for Tazaki.

We ordered agedashi tofu, a spider roll, kappa maki, a spicy tuna roll, and a California roll for take out. Not the brightest idea to order agedashi tofu to go because the sauce ends up making the tofu greasy. I don't think I've ever tried a spider roll and to my surprise it was delicious! All items satisfied my sushi cravings and were relatively inexpensive.

If I'm ever craving sushi again, I'll be back!
author: Mabel Y.

description:
What an awesome little Japanese place hidden in the Outer Sunset (right next to the perhaps better known Pisces) with great service and even great Golden Gate Warriors pride (the bar decor is definitely welcoming). Low-key, generous portions, and a HUGE fish selection. I'm definitely coming back to try omakase and the other sashimi platters, and hope to grab a spot in the floor seating area eventually.

Tip 1: The $13 steal of a bento box, complete with your choice of 3 mains, salad, miso, AND ice cream. Try the karaage (it's interesting and kind of sweet) and sashimi

Tip 2: The Yakuza Roll, a gorgeous crab-salmon-avo-shrimp tempura combo

Tip 3: Call ahead--the place isn't huge and was packed on a Tuesday night. They don't usually take reservations for less than 6, but if you call before you arrive, they were able to save a table for 5 for me for 20 minutes.

Tip 4: Ask what's fresh, but don't be too harsh--they were super honest with us about what was frozen (basically everything but the ahi steak), but I couldn't complain about the yellowtail or salmon we ordered anyway (if anything, I liked it a littl better than the overcooked ahi platter). 

One note/complaint: They don't put the plastic spouts on their tea pots so it is very, very easy to spill, which sucks.
author: Cailin H.

description:
I tend to complain when I've had terrible service (& I've been to some sub-par sushi restaurants in SF that I won't mention).  I should give credit where credit is due.

This is a hole-in-the wall restaurant that's outstanding.  I lived in LA for a few years & I tend to be selective with sushi -I have little patience for fake crab or fish that's obviously been frozen & thawed.  This is on par with some of the best places I've been -it's exceedingly fresh (fish is shipped in every day) & has the quality & texture of fresh, A-grade fish.  It has a large selection & unusual, exceptional dishes not typically found in local, casual restaurants (black caviar, tobiko & quail egg)..  It's generous with portions.  

The prices are unusually modest for a high quality sushi restaurant in SF.  The only others I've found of similar caliber are expensive & on the fussy end (Ozumo, Kirala,..).
author: Jack S.

description: Love their sushi especially their sashimi platter (very fresh) . Their filet mignon steak , rack of lamb is so tender and tasty that it just falls right off . ( need to pre order these manager special items a day advance and you will not regret it ). Order the filet mignon as medium rare .
author: Douglas Y.

description:
1. I've been eating sushi most of my life
2. I'm a total fucking sushi snob
3. I would never put wasabi in my soy sauce
4. A sushi roll should never have sauces or avocado
5. I would never dip my rice in soy sauce
6. Sushi is about the rice, not the topping
7. Jiro is my hero

If at least 6 of the 7 points above don't resonate with you, ignore this review because it's probably not applicable to you. 

Pros:
- Neighborhood spot. It's cloe, easy, and convenient. 
- Friendly owner and staff 
- Decent prices. You can get a full, abundant meal for about $45
- They deliver. Albeit slowly. 
- They have gluten-free soy sauce. This means I don't have to lug my bottle with me.

Cons:
- Not the freshest or best cuts of fish
- Not much variety in fish. I enjoy going to places that have cuts of fish I've never even heard of
- I've discovered bones in my sashimi on more than one occasion
- Owned by a white guy. This is not meant to be racist, but those that resonate 7/7 on the above will get my point here.
author: Johnson M.

description:
Good quality sushi. Expect a wait though.. it gets super busy during dinner!

The boyfriend loves it here!
author: Kristy V.

description: This is my favourite restaurant in the neighbourhood! My husband and I eat here every week (sometimes twice a week). Food is always delicious, the service is wonderful and they have a good price!
author: Rita C.

description: Food always good and the portion is huge! The best thing is the price still the same as 15 years ago... the only bad thing is always a long waiting list unless you start dinner at 5pm.
author: Jeffrey L.

description: First, we called in for a table of six. We got the reservation and were seated promptly at 7:30 on a Tuesday afternoon. We ordered and first the bento box arrived. My friend finished the bento box before the appetizer, poke, arrived. It took forever. We probably waited another 45 minutes afterwards for the sashimi and rolls to come out. The rolls and sashimi were delicious, but the wait was terrible. They were extremely slow and apologetic. I probably will not want to come back again because of that. The food was not coming out in a timely manner and it was very awkward to have some people finished eating before other people got their food.
author: Brandon L.

description: My friend and I have been wanting to try this place but never had the chance to until recently. We had their  chirashi bowl and it was pretty good. Their sashimi were fresh and delicious! Can't wait to go back again have their chirashi bowl again!!
author: Sophia L.

description: Me and my family come here every holiday. Super friendly service. I always get the 16 piece Sashimi Sake plate. Their salmon is the fattest most delicious I have ever had. This has become my go to plate every visit now. Love the ice cream at the end. Thank you.
author: Attic F.

description:
I was expecting above average food because this place had four stars. 

- The environment was a bit off for me. I sat in a table of two and it was right in front of the door. Was not very comfortable. The only open tables were big tables of six or the counter.

- The food was average at best. I ordered a bento box with sashimi, tempura, and salmon teriyaki. The sashimi was ok. Buffet quality. The tempura was lacking. The batter was too thick for the vegetables and it doesnt include shrimp. There were soggy pieces. The salmon teriyaki was ok. Nothing special. 

- The service was ok. Greeted by smiling waitresses. However, was seated at an awkward table. We didnt get tea refills until we were finished with our meals. However, the waitresses provided adequate service in taking our orders and getting us out. 

Overall a bit overhyped. Would give 2.5 stars but the dinner came with icecream.
author: Jake J.

description:
Came here for the first time on a Sunday night looking for a new go-to Japanese spot in Sunset. So when we arrived, I was glad to see that there were plenty of customers. You always think that an empty restaurant is super sketch right? 

5 mins - got seat (score, not too long of a wait)
10 more mins - the waitress came to give us plates and chopsticks
15  more mins - order was taken
20 more mins - miso soup arrived
40 more min - bento box finally came out

Food - Stay away from the bento boxes. Between the two of us, we ordered beef teriyaki, sashimi, chicken katsu, chicken karaage and salmon teriyaki. Sashimi is alright but definitely you pay for what you get and that's why the sushi here is so inexpensive. The salmon was probably the most edible thing out of the whole order, but the beef teriyaki was down right inedible.

Service - They're very nice and friendly, but when your food takes forever for a simple bento box, I just can't justify it.


TIP: Don't judge a restaurant by their number of customers!
author: Kristen C.

description:
My friend and I came here for dinner and thought it would be great since the reviews are... but we were wrong.

First problem: waited 30+ minutes to be seated
Second: waited 30+ more minutes for our food
Third: ordered tea and got water instead (not a big issue, but still) &mixed up our orders
Fourth: asked for the bill to be charged on two separate cards, half on each, but instead one card was charged $1.00 and the rest on the other. 

The waitresses were inattentive and it was just way too slow. My udon was too salty. 

Overall, we had high hopes but we're very displeased. Never coming here again.
author: Regel M.

description: Wow! What a gem! Delicious Japanese food. Love their bento boxes.  Prices are very cheap compared to other places in the city.  Everything was freshly made, so expect a wait for your food.  Definitely would recommend.
author: Kay L.

description:
Pretty good quality sushi at a cheap price! My Japanese friend lives walking distance from this place and we were craving decent sushi. His roommate suggested this place and after reviewing the menu we knew that it probably would be the same grade sushi as other typical cheap sushi restaurants.

For $40 the two of us shared a combination sushi plate that usually feeds 3-4 people. It included a total of 16 different nigiri and three specialty rolls. The nigiri were HUGE and the highlight of this experience! I loved the fact that they only used a small amount of rice so the fish was really the spotlight. I was also surprised that the fish was fresh and tasty for being so "cheap". The specialty rolls were not as good. They included a California, Spyder, and Caterpiller. We didn't think these were as good as the nigiri. The crab used in the California roll was really strange. We described it as having a furry texture, maybe because the crab was more on the dry side. Also the other two rolls had lettuce in it which was odd and probably just used as a filler (glad they didn't resort to the typical Americanized sushi with cream cheese).

It was overall satisfying and really filling! Although it's not one of my favorite sushi restaurants I think it is a bit better than other decently priced places. I will be back in the future to get my nigiri fix! My Japanese friend wants to come back and bring his family too! He plans to get Sushi Wasted every Wednesday.
author: Britney L.

description:
I have to say that every piece of fish I got here was fat and delicious and fresh (all nigiri) and also $1-2 cheaper than the Castro where I live.

They were very nice here (I sat at the bar.) They are not Japanese. Not sure where they are from.

They provide edamame (love that) and the miso I had was delicious.

There were a lot of regulars here. It is right across the street from the N Judah line.

I'll be back if in the area! Order the sake nigiri for sure and some miso soup.
author: Aaron W.

description:
So happy I tried this place out today! I was welcomed when I stepped in, seated immediately at the sushi bar, as I was alone, and served tea and edamame in a flash! I appreciated this because I was starving after a long day at work and a funky commute.

I ordered two nigris and a roll, along with miso soup and a Kirin.
The soup was delicious, not the instant soup packets and packed with tofu and green onions. Both nigiris (saba and hamachi) were generously portioned!
