Big slabs of fish and small amounts of rice, as it should be! Not your melt-in-the-mouth sushi BUT absolutely the best for the prices. Tasty and again, the cuts were impressive.

The service was impeccable! I was served immediately, checked on twice during my meal, and checking out was quick. On my way out every server, including the sushi chef thanked me for my business and I left with a bloated belly and smile.

I will definitely be back!
author: Olivia B.

description: Not bad, but also not amazing. If you're in the mood for sushi and it's getting late and other options are full or closing, this place will do in a pinch. But, it's not my fave. My guess is that it's not Japanese owned and operated.
author: Vanessa R.

description: After drooling over the pictures here on yelp, my boyfriend finally took me here to try this place out! I really enjoyed their tea and the complimentary edamame and miso soup as starters. The food here is pretty good and everything came out at a good pace. We ordered a lot of uni and this is where I realized that I'm not such a big fan of their uni here. Regardless, the servers were really attentive and nice as well. After we were all finished, we were offered free ice cream! Who doesn't like that? We chose green tea ice cream. Such an amazing way to finish off, just great! I would come back here again and try out other things (just not the uni haha)!
author: Abby C.

description:
The fact that this place is just a couple blocks from my house makes me really happy. 

Amazing service & the nicest servers (and sushi chef). The sushi chef had this sweet quality about him that really made me feel at ease when I was sitting at the bar. 

Fantastically fresh fish

I got all of their specials and (spicy tuna with white tuna on top, toro and Japanese Tai). All of these were so good. My favorite by far was the Tai. It just melted in my mouth. I loved how sizeable the fish pieces were for the 2pcs specials. If I had any criticism at all (which I really don't) it would be that the fish to rice ratio was a little off. There was such a big piece of fish (which I loved) and a very small amount of rice. I wish they would make the rice underneath a little bigger. Other than that... this place was amazing!

Definitely recommend sunsetters get their sushi here!
author: Jessie L.

description: Wife said it was some of the best sushi she has had.  I enjoyed the yakisoba which I don't find in most Japanese restaurants.  This was excellent as well.  Service can be a little slow.  They have two tables that are traditional Japanese style (on the floor).  There was a line by 630 on Friday evening.
author: Steven B.

description: Great local neighborhood sushi spot! Excellent sashimi platter and great salmon lover roll with real crab meat! Very reasonable prices. Can't wait to go back and try their sizzling fish plates!
author: Felicia F.

description: Super delicious & fresh sushi, i love this place. It gets really crowded, though, so it happens you'll have to wait up to 25 mins for the first rolls to be served. But well worth the wait!
author: Vanessa S.

description:
Our last full day in SF:  We explored the Golden Gate park with the kids, spent a bit of time on the beach, and decided some West Coast sushi would be a good way to finish our day.  Asked Siri what was nearby, found Tazaki, and we were en route-  hungry, but restrained with our expectations.

My 10-year old daughter loves sushi and wants everything on the menu.  My 7-year old boy is very cautious.  Between the two of them we had a confusing time placing our order.   I was very happy to find oysters on the half shell, which I had yet to experience Japanese-style.  Our waitress (looking at the receipt now, it seems her name was Mei) was very patient and smiled throughout.  We sat back and awaited our order.

I won't critique our meal item-by-item.  Suffice to say that we were VERY happy.  Hot tea and edamame -gratis- immediately after being seated.  Deliciously prepared sushi.  The oysters & ponzu sauce were so good I almost ordered a second half-dozen, except we already had plenty of food in front of us.  Complimentary ice cream for the kids!  And I was pleasantly surprised to see that it all set us back less than a night at our local sushi place would have.

Thank you Siri, thank you Mei, and thank you Tazaki Sushi!
author: N T.

description:
Local Japanese restaurant on Judah Street. Right next to PIsces. Casual joint. 

Bento Boxes for any 3 items  $12.95 (For duplicate items please add $1.00 each) 
Chicken Teriyaki, Beef Teriyaki, Salmon Teriyaki, Tonkatsu, Chicken Kara Age, 
 Shrimp Tempura (2 pcs.), Vegetable Tempura (5 pcs.)California Roll (4 pcs.)
Sashimi (4 pcs. Tuna or Salmon or Yellowtail)
 
Sashimi Combo

My order was a bento box with beef teriyaki and I doubled up on the sashimi making it $13.95. My husband ordered the sashimi combo. The sashimi quality was ok. I didn't really like the beef teriyaki. It is usually the thinner cut of the beef and not much fat, so it is more like teriyaki sirloin. 

One thing I didn't really like was their service, there wasn't a wait for tables, but yet, they kept pushing the bill on us. And the waitress forgot both my husband's miso soup and ice cream. The service seemed a little novice.
author: Janice T.

description:
I'm going to give Tazaki two stars for the food. 

Three stars off for the dining experience. 

When we first arrived, we were seated right away since there was no wait. However, we had to wave down the waitress to take our order after 15 minutes of waiting. Then, our friend got her bento box 15 minutes after we ordered. She decided to wait for us to start since we ordered chirashi bowls, which didn't need to be cooked (other than the rice). We waited another 20 minutes, we asked the waitress and she said 10 more minutes. 10 minutes later, we asked another waitress which then said it was going to take a little bit longer because the fish was difficult to cut for the chirashi bowl (?) Then we waited another 10 minutes and finally got our food. During this time we were waiting for our food, I was glancing at the sushi chef here and there to make sure it was coming when they said it would. However, the entire time he was making to-go orders until 15 minutes before our food finally arrived. I really don't think that "the fish was difficult to cut" if he didn't even start on it yet. I wish they would've been more honest with an apology. I wouldn't be so irritated. They also forgot our salads that came with the meal until the end of our meal. 

Our entire dinner from the time we sat down took 2 hours. On top of that, they split the bill incorrectly. 

The food was good! The chirashi bowl was definitely a bang for your buck, but, with the unpleasant dining experience, I'd rather pay the extra $5 and enjoy my meal.
author: Thatcher H.

description: I absolutely love this place. I don't know how I've never reviewed them! I've been coming here for years. It's a great neighborhood restaurant. The owners are super nice, make you feel very welcomed and taken care of. The food is great, I love their rolls and the boyfriend and I are fond of their short ribs and teriyaki chicken. They also have great deals when you dine in. This is definitely a popular spot on the weekends. Parking can be a little tricky but luckily we can just walk around the block to enjoy it! For those coming from outside the sunset, muni stops right in front of them.
author: Mariacecilia B.

description:
Food is good and service is very attentive and friendly. We asked the server that we wanted a cooked roll and she kindly suggested us couple things on the menu. We took her suggestion and ordered a "Davie" roll. It had tobiko on the outside, spicy tuna and shrimp tempura inside. It was ok, but disappointing at the same time. The spicy tuna was raw. That is why I rated 4 stars instead of 5. 

We also had the bento box and the donburi which were both very tasty. They offered us ice cream at the end,  and being an ice cream freak, of course,  I said yes. We will definitely come back to try again and hoping we will get a more accurate recommendation.
author: Ella A.

description: One of best sushi places I've found in SF. It's authentic and the servers are super nice too. They have a lot of different options when it comes to rolls, but my favorite is the yakuza roll. I like to get delivery so I can stay in and eat. :)
author: Elizabeth K.

description:
I have been eating their sushi for years and I can honestly say that this has got to be the best sushi joint I have ever been to! Everything that I have ever tried here (ramen, sashimi, sushi, tempura, fried chicken, etc.) is absolutely cooked to perfection. Everything is always so fresh and so delicious and the outcome is always so consistent. I truly enjoy everything on the menu and I have honestly come close to trying everything on that menu. Not to mention the fact that the place is clean and employees are so friendly and nice and they provide such prompt and professional service. 

It takes close to an hour and half to get here from my house and it's totally worth it.
author: Samantha C.

description:
Dragon roll ($9) was delicious I have no complains about it. 

California Maki ($5) was delicious too I like it when they add the cucumber inside. I like the crunch taste. 

Rock n Roll ($6-7) it was rather small compare to other places ,but it was still good

Catipilar Roll ($7) this was good too. 

Honestly, I sarted to confuse the rolls when they arrived because they arrived one by one. i couldn't remember which belonged to which name. But obviously I was able to tell the difference between the California Maki and  Dragon roll. 

I also ordered the 3 piece bent box for $13. 
Shashimi - fresh and good size
Beef teryaki - not steak, but strips of beef. It was a real disappointment
Tonkatsu - dry and the batter fell off before I was able to put it in my mouth
Salad - did not like the orangy sauce - blah
Miso -  a little too salty for my likeing
Green Tea Ice Cream - tastes like plastic
Rainbow ice cream - I didn't like the hint of mint 

Service - constantly refill your drink, maybe even too many times, but it's better than no refill right? 

I would say to come here for rolls, not bento boxes
author: Jess W.

description: I'm impressed. Reasonable prices and good portions (thick cuts of sashimi) are A++ in my book! Service was ok (could be more organized). Good local neighborhood joint. Will be back!
author: Stephen Y.

description:
Best sushi in the sunset. Very good, consistent and stable quality. 

Always packed so get there early. Car parking is a little rough during dinner time as it is a residential area. 

It is worth the time to go to this place.
author: Kirk L.

description: Literally the worst service BY THE OWNER. He couldn't pronounce the name so he skipped us. Absolutely ridiculous how this place has 4 stars. Take your business elsewhere, like we did, there are much better Japanese restaurants who actually appreciate and respect their customers.
author: Clarissa O.

description:
Oh man! Oh man! I LOVE this place. Wonderful atmosphere, amazing food, great service AND its only a 3 minute walk from my home! Ive been here over a dozen times and have yet to find something I don't like. Tazaki today, Tazaki tomorrow, Tazaki forever! 
 
p.s. dat  49er roll doe (scallop, lemon, salmon)
author: Paige M.

description:
If you happen to be in the set you will not find a better Sushi Bar! Even if you have to wait for a table!
 
Best sushi in the set! Live fish and free tea  and very reasonable prices!Stop in to see the show!
author: Craig S.

description:
Originally, my parents and I planned to go the restaurant next door, Pisces, but it was closed. My mom was taking a walk and she said it smelled nice, so we walked in. 

Sitting down, the ambiance was sort of nice - no pop music or even the stereotypical Asian music playing. The door was open and you could feel some of the sea breeze blowing through the restaurant. Very relaxing. Other than us, there was no one else in the restaurant. (besides a couple sitting on the tatami mats in the corner)

The waiter who served us was most likely the owner. My dad asked how long the restaurant has been on business, and he said about 15-17 years. My expectations for Asian restaurants are never very high (as all TRUE down to earth Asian restaurants have pretty bad service) and this man proved that somewhat to be true. He was wearing a white apron, and put our food down a bit brash. He was older in age, so I think his tendency to spill was a little higher. (Watch our for the tea -it's good tea - but it spills EVERYWHERE. Literally) but otherwise the food was amazing!

Hamachi Sashimi - One Word: FRESH. The hamachi was cut perfectly and was very cold, as if it was cut and served immediately. It was extremely tender and left me wanting more.

California Rolls - Although these were good, they left a bit more to be desired. The crab meat was a little dry, but the avocado helped balance it out, along with the soy sauce. 

Tonkatsu - One thing I particularly enjoyed about the Tonkatsu is that he gave us an entire bottle of the Tonkatsu sauce. Many restaurants drizzle the sauce over the meat for you, but usually by the time the meat gets in your mouth, the taste evaporates. Having a bottle, I was able to use it to my hearts content.

Teriyaki (Beef and Salmon) - [heads up: the teriyaki sauce is more salty than sweet] the salmon just melted in my mouth. No need to keep ranting how good it was. The beef was extremely thin cut so it was easy to chew, unlike the restaurants which give you the fat along with the beef.

Tempura - the tempura was the perfect balance of crunchy. While some restaurants don't add enough "panko" AKA breadcrumbs, others overfry it so the covering is too hard. This place had the perfect crunch to their tempura! Yum!

On the house ice cream! Yay!

Overall: amazing food, quiet mood, mediocre service.
author: Calvin H.

description:
I had the chicken teriyaki, una roll, and shitake roll. My friends ordered combination dinners and other rolls.

Food: The chicken was dry and mostly tasteless. The una roll and shitake roll were very small - about half the size of regular sushi. They were not rolled up well and fell apart as soon as I picked them up. Also not much flavor.

Service: The waitress asked if we were ready to order, and we replied "yes." She then walked away, forgot about us, and we had to flag her down about 5 minutes later to actually place our orders. 

She came back often to refill the hot green tea, but she consistently spilled the tea onto the table at the end of the "pour," getting our plates, dishes, and table surface wet. They mixed up our order with the neighboring table and the rolls came 10-15 minutes after our entrees. 

The kicker: I had bloody diarrhea afterwards for 3 hours.

I will never go back.
author: Myles L.

description:
Excellent sushi. Food was great, vibe was great.

The salmon is always fresh, the wait staff is super friendly. 

I've been here a few time now and the salmon is the freshest I've ever had at any sushi restaurant. 5 Stars for the Salmon. 

The miso soup is ok not the consistency I'm accustom to that is the only reason for the 4 out of 5 stars.
author: Marlon F.

description: Awesome place. I'm not a sushi fan, and they have really excellent alternatives (veggie sushi, bento boxes, etc). My husband, on the other hand, is a sushi fan and he loves every roll he's had. Friendly service and comfortable environment. Have been back and will be back again.
author: Madeline M.

description: The Saba Shioyaki and Shrimp tastes good and fresh. Bento box has reasonable price and also includes white rice, tea and ice cream.
author: Laura D.

description:
I come here for dinner with my mom when we're feeling lazy, and I haven't been disappointed. The restaurant is Chinese-owned, and the prices are very reasonable. The fish is very fresh, but the size of nigiri can be very inconsistent. My mom and I had two orders of salmon nigiri, and there was one slice about half a centimeter, and another almost over a centimeter. It was strange, but no biggie.

The rolls are a decent size, my mom and I normally get about 3-4 orders of nigiri and two rolls. By the time we finish all that, we're stuffed. This place actually gets a little packed on the weekends, but I've never experienced a wait of more than 10 minutes.
author: Erica A.

description:
This small, but very cutely decorated sushi place is one of my favorites to go to! It is conveniently located in the middle of quiet, suburban San Francisco and away from the crowdedness of other areas of the city with large clusters of restaurants.

They have a wide variety of food items on the menu, such as sushi, donburi, ramen, and udon, for a decent (and even somewhat cheap) price. I personally like the chicken katsu because it's probably one of the crispiest chicken katsu I've ever tasted. The sushi (which is usually what I order) is consistently good quality and the pieces are large.

Tazaki Sushi also does a good job with to-go orders. My boyfriend and I like to order to-go all the time. Every time we pick up the food, it is packed in a way that is as compact and stable as possible and the hot foods even get a hole poked in them so that the condensation does not make the food soggy. Now that is a very thoughtful thing to do!

Overall, love this place because it's a small Japanese restaurant away from the hustle and bustle of crowded areas that also serves tasty Japanese food.
author: Nirel R.

description:
Wow, yelpers!  What a disappointment!  I always seem to fall into your trap.  
Ok, so this was our first time trying this place as my kids had a soccer game nearby, they wanted sushi as their "winning treat".  Based on the star ranking on yelp we decided to give it a try.  BOOOOOOOOOOO!!!!  Never again.

The waitresses didn't know anything, I figured at first it was probably just that one waitress (she was probably new) but it was damn near all of them.  My hubby asked for a pepsi, they didn't know what pepsi was, when we finally got her to understand she said they didn't have pepsi and had to run over to the fountain to see what kinds of soda they served.  Ummm, ok, don't you serve soda everyday?  I asked for more edamame and she said they don't have any....so I pointed to the ones we just finished, WTH!  

You're given a menu and a list of their sushi that you mark off stating what you want.  I hated the fact that their sushi list didn't give a description of the sushi. I'm sure your typical "dragon roll" are all similar but I'm sure each restaurant adds their little individual tweeks.  

No bueno - wont be back!
author: Sarah N.

description:
Great local sushi place. Everything is really fresh and with decently sized pieces (which can be all over the place when it comes to sushi). It was a last minute dinner decision and it didn't disappoint. I can walk here from my apartment so that's a huge plus. They've got lots of stuff on their menu, all traditional Japanese fare, but their sushi is the highlight. The place was busy when we went and everybody was eating some kind of raw fish with rice.

I tried several of their rolls, regular Tuna, and three of the more exotic ones (Cherry Blossom, 49er, and Spider Maki), plus a couple pieces of Himachi and Uni nigiri. All of it was excellent, although you really do have to try their traditional stuff. While the Americanized rolls are great, the freshness of their raw fish takes what would ordinarily be a boring roll you'd get elsewhere into something really special.  

Uni (sea urchin) is my favorite type of sushi and it's one of the better ones I've had in several different cities in the US.
author: Byron E.

description:
I like this place a lot ... I have been here twice and it was in the early evening, got to sit in the window tables both times!  

I F'ing love the seared salmon nigiri, also love hamachi kama and chawanmushi, some great rolls too!  If you are in the area and hungry for sushi, I think this is a good place to go.
author: Arthur M.

description:
Was never a big Sashimi fan until I came here. I can taste the freshness and how it just melts in your mouth. Prices are extremely reasonable and they are NEVER stingy on their portions. I always like trying other new places but I always end up back here. I can't even count how many times I have been here. They have not disappoint me. 

The staff are always accommodating and friendly. I don't have to ask for certain things; the staff always seem to know what to do such as extra napkins , forks for my older kids and extra tofu in miso soup for the toddlers, etc. Its the little things that counts! Before I forget, love watching games on the big screens!
author: Jasmine L.

description: What can I say.  Amazing every time.  You can walk in any day of the week and expect quality sushi!
author: Adele W.

description:
Actually their food is fresh. However, it will be better if they keep it in the right temperature. I ordered salmon, and i felt like the fish was not hard enough! 
The rice to make maki and sushi was not sticky enough, and the flavor was missing. The fried shrimp head was awesome. I would like to give the food 3.5/5, however, the ice cream  saved everything... Their green tea ice cream tasted delicious. 
Service was okay.
author: Angie N.

description:
Fsvorite sushi spot in the Sunset!

Tazaki is a small, homey restaurant. Never too noisy, and the owner sometimes serves you himself. The rolls on the menu are simple, but the fish is so fresh, and the sushi is prepared with such expertise that I find this sushi so much better than the super-massive, mayo/sauce drenched rolls offered by other restaurants in the area. The Eclipse Roll (tuna, black caviar, tobiko, quail egg) is my favorite! The gooey quail goodness gushes everywhere when you bite into it! The entrees are pretty delicious too - super tender beef teriyaki, crispy tonkatsu, and thick, buttery slices of sashimi.

5 stars for the food, but the service could use some work. When there is only one sushi chef present, the food does come out rather slow (although well worth the anticipation and wait). But, everytime I have come, the owner has given us ice cream on the house!
author: Shawna C.

description:
Bento Box (3 items) is about $14. I would recommend the Chicken Karage and Salmon Teriyaki. The sushi looked good too, and those who order it enjoy it.

I would not recommend Chicken Katsu (Curry entree). It is like one thick, very crunchy piece of batter-skin, a bit of chicken, and another thick piece of batter-skin.

When you're in a big group and a lot of people ordered meals that come with Miso Soup or ice cream, they seem to serve and offer it to everyone there, which is nice of them.

It is almost never crowded here so service is relatively good.
author: Derek M.

description:
in all the times i've driven down Judah or ridden the N down to the beach, i have never noticed tazaki! however, i recently saw some yummy pictures on the internet and decided that it was time to check it out.

first off, it's a chinese staffed japanese restaurant. we could understand the waitresses telling the sushi chefs about the orders because they were speaking mandarin. i'm not complaining though, i'm chinese and i've worked in a japanese restaurant as a waitress before, no biggie.

sat at the sushi bar and ordered a sashimi combo dinner. soup, salad, rice, ice cream, and 16 pieces of sashimi (salmon, red tuna, white tuna, yellowtail, and monkfish). we also ordered two pieces of unagi nigiri. the fish was good quality, not the best i've had, but it still satisfied the urge quite nicely. i was also somewhat irked that the only flavor of ice cream available was chocolate. apparently they had run out of strawberry and green tea. i don't mean to sound like a spoiled brat, but i do love me some green tea ice cream and look forward to it almost as much as i do the main entree itself.

overall, the food was pretty good quality at a decent price, but it's not anything that blew my mind. the staff was friendly, the food had good presentation, but not sure if i will be back again soon.
author: Caitlin C.

description:
I came to Tazaki Sushi with my mom and brother for a Mother's Day late lunch.  Our regular Japanese place wasn't open yet (too early for dinner) so we decided to come here because it was close enough.  Definitely a departure from the regular!

I ordered the pork ramen ($8.95).  The broth was bland and flavorless.  My mom got the katsu and egg udon, which was okay.  The broth left a lot to be desired.  

We also ordered a dragon roll, caterpillar roll, salmon maki, and salmon nigiri.  The rice in both of the rolls was "softly packed".  Each piece felt like it was going to fall apart when I picked it up with chopsticks.  The dragon roll was really good.  The caterpillar roll - eh.  

The salmon maki was fine.  The salmon on the nigiri was way too large for the amount rice given (about 2x larger than the rice), so it was kind of awkward to eat and grab.    

Price was about $50 for a good amount of food for 3 people.  

TL;DR: Bland food, pretty good Dragon Roll, but probably would not come back.
author: Wayland L.

description: I usually order sashimi and nigiri from here, but last night my bf and I decided to order their rolls. I was expecting them to be pretty small at only $7-9 each, but they were huge and the fish was so fresh! We ordered 4 rolls, 1 nigiri, and 12-piece sashimi dinner which comes with miso soup, salad, and ice cream. This would have easily amounted to over $100 at most sushi restaurants, but our total was only $53! Crazy cheap for quality sushi. Service was excellent as always. The waitresses always look happy to be working there and the manager (or owner? Not sure) gave us 2 bowls of miso soup and green tea ice cream instead of the 1 we were supposed to get. If you're looking for good, affordable sushi in the sunset, this is your place!
author: Stephanie G.

description: Been going to this neighborhood sushi house for about 20 years. Seen the place expand 2x as big as before. My favorites have been their Tazaki Clam Ramen, medium spicy, which is very flavourful with adequate clams. Their sushi has always been pretty generous with fresh fish. Kids love the gyoza with the spicy tangy sauce. Great place to take in a GSW or Giants game on one of their 3 tvs. It does get busy at times.
author: Ming W.

description:
Tazaki. Tazaki. Tazaki. (rinse, wash, repeat)

Seriously. I love this place. The beau lives nearby, and one night I had some extra time before he got home. I was starving. I wound up at this little Sushi place in the Sunset, and man am I happy that I did!

First off, they've got a TV. And the Lakers were on. Things are good. (although since the Lakers have now been eliminated things aren't so good... but thats neither here nor there).

Next up, they've got a nice staff! I walked in, was greeted, had a fabulous conversation, laughed a lot, and generally felt like it was a Tazaki Party.

Third? Fast service. 
(3.5? Clean place.)

Fourth? Sushi was delicious.

Fifth? Takes credit cards. 

Lakers, Laughter, Speed, Cleanliness, Deliciousness, Plastic -- what more could I ask for? Nothing, that's what. TAZAKI!
author: Thom S.

description: Awesome place! regular here. All of their sushi and rolls are all fantastic. Seafood is Fresh all the time. Sizzling Sea Bass, signature dish, great. Spicy clams with noodles also yummy.
author: Richard C.

description: Good fresh sushi, very convenient for us who live in the Sunset that likes good sushi and don't have to drive far to get it.  Service is good and food is good!
author: Peter L.

description:
Great neighborhood sushi joint! The fish is fresh and the options will satisfy most palates.

The prices are very reasonable...
author: robert C.

description:
If you're looking for a great local sushi place in the Outer Sunset that's within walking distance of the beach, Tazaki sushi is it. The owner is *so* friendly here (I'm a local, so I've been here quite a few times and he's always incredibly friendly -- as is his staff!), and I always feel very welcome when I dine here!

There are cross-legged seating spaces by the window, plenty of tables, *and* a sushi bar, so there are plenty of places for you to sit yourself down where you feel most comfortable.

I've been here both with friends who live nearby, visiting friends from out of the city, and on dates as well, and it's always a nice little sushi spot!

It's not the fanciest place in the world, but for sushi that is inexpensive in a low-key setting to get to know someone or chat with friends, this place is perfect.
author: Sherilynn M.

description:
If you want authentic Japanese food, go to Japan or be willing to shell out the cash for the most exquisite yet miniscule meal you've ever experienced! But for me, Tazaki is as good as it gets for the price, quality, quantity and for being a Japanese place in the Sunset district.

I've been going to here for years and consider Tazaki Sushi a step up from the Okazuya it used to be several years ago. They are a family-owned restaurant and have always provided attentive and friendly service. 

I still give them 5 stars even though I've witnessed some of their off days, because I like the atmosphere, the price, the taste, the service and have been to other Japanese restaurants in many districts of the City for more money and have not been as satisfied as I am at Tazaki's. 

Because I am friendly, come in frequently during slow times and treat them like humans instead of subpar sushi making robots, Tazaki often throws in something free like soup, a new sushi roll, prepares a roll in a special way, or something extra and will from time to time give us the expensive stuff, like O-o Toro (Fatty Tuna) rolls. 

Pluses:
-Salmon Skin Maki: very crunchy and tasty, not chewy and gristly like other places
-Creamy roll: Never thought I would like lightly fried tuna, scallop and avocado
-Sizziling Chilean Sea Bass
-Hamachi sashimi: Tazaki knows how to slice Hamachi (should not have that dark red part on it), it's flavorful and worth the price
-Beef Ramen: Love the flavor and noodles
-Agedashi Tofu
-The service
-Located right in front of an N-Judah stop
-The price 
-The atmosphere
-The quantity
-They now deliver for the very busy or the very lazy!

Things to consider:
-Veggie Tempura: the batter is okay, not my favorite pick of veggies
-Sometimes they watch TV, not all the time, but typically if there's some big Giants game on. I don't have a problem with it, but I guess some people do
-Parking can be sparse at times
-Sometimes they have off days, like EVERY other restaurant, Japanese or not


Regardless of the very few unfavorable reviews Tazaki has received, they have received many great reviews, they are always busy for dinner, I see many regulars, families, couples, people of all ages and cultures enjoying their meals at Tazaki Sushi.
author: Solitaire M.

description:
FOOD
1.) Philly roll
2.) Rainbow Roll
3.) momo roll? 
Rolls were all good

SERVICE:
not too bad


ATMOSPHERE
Two Japanese type seating by the window pretty novel, the rest is just a simple Japanese restaurant with a small bar seating
author: Angela L.

description: Usually you make an order to go not to have to wait for the food when you get there . We got there 45 minutes after we made the order and that's when the hostess put in the order, after we paid. Her excuse was that they were busy but waiting an extra 20 minutes outside just because they prioritized the house orders before ours isn't very professional. They didn't even rush to prepare our order. We weren't offered even the free tea they serve since it was cold. Usually go here a lot but after that experience never going back. Don't plan on getting your food on time when you order it or good service.
author: Vika N.

description:
Over the years, we have been coming to Judah Okazuya for its food and convenience.  Many times we just walk down from our house as parking around the area is poor.  For unknown reasons, we stopped going there and our Japanese food of choice is Spiral located in Westlake area in Daly City.

A couple of days ago, we had guests and decided to return here for a quick bite at about 2PM on a Tuesday.  It was pretty quiet, since it was after the lunch hour, but the service was very slow and the people did not appear very welcoming.  

There were four in our party and we had cooked sushi, another sushi dish (can't remember what they ordered), chicken teriyaki entree, and beef teriyaki entree ($12.95).  I can't remember the prices of the other items except for mine as someone else picked up the tab. I did noticed that the prices are higher than what they advertise on their web site.

Our teriyaki dishes were bland and the meat was rather tough.  Also it didn't look that appetizing.  The dessert of green tea ice cream was good (what could go wrong with ice cream?)

Overall, it is a much better value at Spirals, as Judah Okazuya has sat on its laurels for way too long and thus the food quality and service has deteriorated.  It is unlikely that we will dine here again.
author: Robert J.

description: I have celebrated every birthday of every family member, including myself, here since 2011. The owner is super friendly and can often be seen walking around the restaurant in a Giants baseball cap, conversing with customers and inquiring about their satisfaction. Tazaki is an excellent restaurant for large groups of people, and is always busy and cheerful. It is somewhat fancy, though there is no need for black tie attire. The food is top-notch and the sashimi and ramen are authentic Japanese. Overall, I absolutely love Tazaki and fuly intend to continue to give it my business. Great job! :)
author: Pella R.

description: Really tasty fish. I got the Sake (Salmon) Sashimi set that came with a salad, miso soup, and rice. The sides we pretty standard Japanese restaurant combo sides but the salmon was really good. I also got the Tuna Poke which was just out of this world!! The seasoning was perfect, a little spicy but not too much.
author: Maria S.

description: Good sushi and at a great price. The sashimi is very fresh and enjoyed it very much. Highly recommend the bento boxes as well, perfect amount of food. Would definitely come back again.
author: Philip K.

description: I waited an hour and half for my sushi that I preordered. They didn't make my sushi till I was personally in the restaurant. I don't recommend this restaurant if you plan on eating anytime soon. The sushi was mediocre. The staff was so unprofessional it was almost like I was an inconvenience to them while waiting the extra 20 minutes for  my food. I was very disappointed. I will never go back.
author: Becca V.

description:
4 stars for its convenient location (to me), and the real crab meat in the sushi.

The place to come to when I just do not want to cook and too lazy to go even slightly out of my way to get food.

Most ordered items are the Cooked Sushi Combo and the Special Combos.  Both are well made and reasonably priced. 

The only thing you should look out for is the longer wait for take-out orders.  They usually take 15-20 minutes so make sure you account for that time so you're not waiting for too long in the restaurant.  I mean... it just means they take longer to prep your order, hence more effort into it?
author: Emily W.

description:
Overall: Cheap, good portion sizes but not flavorful. Service meh. Bathroom and kitchen is GROSS.

FOOD: We Ordered the mahi entree, white tuna roll and a bento box w/ tuna, chicken and shrimp teriyaki. The white tuna was mushy. Mahi and bento box was good. Miso was too salty. 

SERVICE: The chef came out to take our order and a few check backs. Odd. He was a bit pushy and didn't seem friendly. Waitstaff had to be flagged down for items such as tea refills.

CLEANLINESS: The toilet had shit stains on it and clearly hasn't been cleaned in awhile. Fucking gross! The soap dispenser was one of those old school pumps you have to push up on and it drips soap down the lever you're pushing on (Highly annoying and gross). The kitchen looked nasty too and you could see buckets on the floor w/ food.

Service and lack of cleanliness = no return
author: Jason N.

description:
Great staff and great food...what more can you ask for? Best Japanese by far in the outer Sunset. Reasonable prices to boot. Their bento boxes rock along with their sushi.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aVgtlaqmV58
author: Marc W.

description:
Service was good and fast.  Beer was cold and tea hot.  Atmosphere was nice and it seemed busy enough on a Thursday night to show it's well liked.

Food?  Meh... I'm having a hard time finding good sushi in the bay area it seems.  The shrimp tempura had a strange texture (frozen then fried too long?), miso soup was too salty, spicy tuna wasn't spicy at all and the tuna itself had a weird texture.  I know it's normal to have minced tuna in a roll but this tuna seemed like it was minced then mashed.  It was like a paste... I really liked the vegetable tempura and the salad was crisp and tasty.  Also, kudos to the chicken teriyaki according to my bf.

For the price, I'm sure there's better places we could go next time.  Maybe I wouldn't mind coming back just for convenience sake since it's within walking distance.
author: Nic E.

description: Had the summer lover roll (might be seasonal) and it has now become an all time favorite. Everything we had was perfect. Go here.
author: Ian W.

description:
We started coming here since we moved to outer sunset a few years ago. We are now in Oakland but come back to get our sushi/sashimi fix. 

Their fish is ALWAYS fresh. Their prices are great, and they give gigantic slices of sashimi. I have seen other restaurants whose slices are a quarter of what Tazaki serves. 

The owners are always there and super friendly. 

Their cooked entrees are OK, we don't go there for teriyaki chicken- we go for the fresh fish.
author: Char L.

description:
-Great low key place to bring kids
-Or good for low key date night (sit at the little sushi bar to get away from the kids at the tables...)
-No frills sushi menu: you won't have crazy-named rolls here, just the basics
-Very affordable: entrees are around $13 and include edamame, miso, hot tea, and ice cream!! We and kids love the green tea ice cream...
-We love the vegetarian udon soup. It's loaded with veggies and the broth is delicious.  It's a steal for less than $10 and I always have plenty leftovers
-Service has always been very friendly
author: Angela W.

description: Hit the spot after a fun filled day at Stern Grove and the beach! The Summer Lover Roll made my day complete! I will be back!
author: Mark G.

description:
I decided to try this place out since I live really close. It was pretty busy on a Sunday afternoon. It seemed slightly understaffed since it took quite a while for our food to come. I had a nigiri plate. It was good and in my opinion decently priced. My sister had a sukiyaki and that's what took the longest since the kitchen was busy. It was just a bit awkward since I got my food first, ate, and finished before my sister got hers. Then she got her food. We basically watched each other eat. We got to eat edamame to eat as we waited at least. Our meals were lunch specials so we got miso soup, salad, and green tea ice cream.

I guess it was a good meal despite the amount of time it took.
author: Mindy C.

description: After a really bad experience with ordering delivery at Tazaki, I was shocked at how they went out of their way to make it right. One of the co-owners came to hand deliver an apology letter as well as a full credit card refund + the discounted $50 we had paid - so basically our entire meal was on them. He was deeply sorry and told me how while it was no excuse, they had a crazy busy night, with several people call in sick, but made it clear that our business was important to them. We didn't expect a full refund, we just wanted some acknowledgement that they had messed up in making us wait for 2 hrs, but were very pleased to see how they handled the situation. We order from them pretty regularly and and will continue to do so!
author: Melissa M.

description:
Decent Japanese cuisine. I would say its well priced, not cheap and not expensive which is always a good thing.
What I really loved was their Hamachi fish and the Teriyaki chicken. What is also a plus to this restaurant, they have free ice cream which is a very good thing. They have green tea, vanilla, and strawberry!
author: Shan M.

description:
Came here for a casual Valentine's dinner without reservations.  We got seated and the place just started to get filled up, then a line of people waiting.  We had to share a long table with another couple (the other guy had to get out of his seat so I can leave).  Bad.  

The sizzling plate fish is a very yummy dish.  I got the seabass.  Careful as the heat of the steam can burn!  Keep that napkin covered until the steam/sizzle settles down.  After we finished, we still had to wait a good 15 mins before our sushi order came.  During the wait, 2 waitresses came by and asked if we are ok (so I'm getting the pressure of rushing me to leave when my food hasnt even arrived yet).  So I had to ask the server to check on our order.

As it starts to come it, the sushi order comes out a dish at a time! OMG.....  This place is not fit for serving a crowded night.  Service was super super slow, sushi was below par, sashimi is good, sizzling fish platter is good.  Beer, as is, perfect. 

This restaurant is very similar to Okazu-Ya on Taraval and Noriega St (in terms of the sizzling plates and sushi order paper list).
author: Ju D.

description:
I would have given a better rating, however, every time I come here the service is super slow. They always seem to forget I'm even of sitting there at a table. The only time you get immediate service is IF you sit right at the sushi bar.

With regards to sushi, I do rate them very well. I've tried a multitude of rolls over the number of times having ate there so I suggest the Creme Roll. It's scallop and spicy tuna coated on the outside with tempura, topped with a creme sauce. If you happen to have extra creme sauce, use that as dipping sauce for other rolls that may be a bit more bland.
author: Elysha O.

description:
Hip hopped to Tazaki Sushi, I had been craving sushi for a while! I have to say this is one of my favorite sushi restaurants for now. It's an awesome place to hold a party for family / friends.

Sit at the sushi bar with my friend, we were entertained by Jin's (the owner ) dry humor. Jin is a funny and friendly guy, especially if you understand Shanghainess.

Now, let's go back to their food. Two words can describe the food in Tazaki: Fresh + Fresh. Sorry, I know this only count as one word yet that's all I can say!! I'm a uni person but never dare to try uni in the restaurant I first been. Feel free to call me conservative. But if you are an uni lover like me, you should know what I am talking about! But trust me, the first-time-uni-journey at Tazaki just simply pleased both my tongue and stomach with its freshness, sweetness and just right temperature. We were served with a half dozen Nama Kaki Viagra (Raw Oyster w/ Uni) placed on ice. I had four of them. Yes, I admit that I was spoiled! They are just sooooo good! 

Atmosphere: Nice, about 8 tables + sushi bar, have TV for sports lover.
Service: Friendly
Price: $18.95 for 1/2 dozen Oyster w/ uni, not bad!
Parking: Street parking
Reservations accepted for parties of 6 or more only. 
$15 minimum credit card charge. Minimum charge $5 per person.

I will definitely go back again!!!
author: Jade L.

description:
I really wanted to like this place, but I think I just had my first and last experience here. 

A bit ironic that my partner and I came here for sushi after watching Finding Dory (don't judge, lololz), but anyway, this place was pretty poppin' for a Tuesday evening. We came in around 7:45pm and left around 9:20pm...for a table of two...after having ordered three sushi rolls and a "salad." Service is just that inattentive when they get busy and I don't blame the servers because from what I observed, there is a lack of a division of labor at this place and it's a hindrance. This place is pretty small, so having multidisciplinary servers ain't a bad thing, but they just don't have their stuff together. I witnessed a party come in and get asked within minutes of each other how big of a party they were by three different servers (who also host, run and bus). Communication is key - just not at this establishment. Many other tables seated around us were also impatient because the turnover time for food was just too slow and nothing was done about it. The servers are super nice, and had checked up on us/refilled drinks for the first ~30 minutes of the meal, but after that, we were forgotten about.  

The $9 cucumber shrimp "salad" we ordered was really just thinly sliced cucumber and four shrimp in a small ramekin soaked in some sort of soy/mirin mix and topped with sesame seeds... I can't even imagine how much they're profiting off of this dish alone because the portion was so small. 

Real crab is used at this establishment, which I appreciate because imitation crab meat is actually just mystery meat, but I found it a bit too fishy for my taste. My partner ended up waking up later that night with a stomach ache, so idk duuudes - beware, I guess.
author: Rebecca N.

description:
Celebrating my graduation? Not exactly...and it's been my turn to pick for the last few times!!!!
I wanted to go to Ebisu because I've never gone & I was suppose to go for my birthday last year...we didn't go last year because the wait was too long...EBISU EBISU EBISU!!! I really wanted to go (or maybe I didn't) but NOOOO, my friend wanted to go to the Okazuya on Noriega. Being the stubborn person I am, I yelped it before going. Does that make me stubborn?!?! I don't know. Now I sound like a brat. If I see lots of ehh or bad reviews OR something that just doesn't stand out to me, I won't go to a new place. So...we didn't go to the Okazuya on Noriega, but the one on Judah. Why??? Because the one on Judah has better reviews.

While I was yelping for the Okazuya on Judah, I had to get over the confusion of why the Okazuya on Judah had a Tazaki Sushi website only finding out it was renamed from reading yelp reviews. Whatever, still going to the one on Judah.

Came in on a Friday around...6PM, there were people already eating. I've always sort of noticed that people ate later when I go to restaurants. Well...this place was 3/4 full. We were seated right away, which was nice. I'm not a fan of waiting unless I brought something to do, then I'm ok with that. We sat near the door, so it was cold at times.

Let's see what did we have??? Well...the things I'll name are what I ate and split with someone. BBQ short ribs entree, caterpillar roll, 49er roll, white tuna sushi, spider roll, and something else. Entree included...miso soup, tea, rice, salad, and ice cream. For 2 people, this was A LOT A LOT OF FOOD. White tuna sushi came with 2 pieces, slices of fish were thick, but not much rice. My favorite roll out of the rolls we got was probably the caterpillar roll. I don't understand the hype from other yelpers for the 49er roll, didn't really like the lemon on it. Spider roll was good though. 

My friend had sea urchin in her sushi, that was the GROSSEST THING I HAVE EVER TASTED. You know the smell of a dirty smelly beach, well...that's how it tasted like. 

The ice cream that came with my entree was suppose to be green tea. It looked like it, but didn't taste like it. There were also icy chunks of ice in it, so that wasn't enjoyable. 

Total was about $50 not including tip for 2 people, so...about $60 for 2. Not too bad, since we had leftovers.
author: Kylie L.

description:
I came here a few times in 1998 and thought it was excellent. i moved to a different neighborhood and didnt make it out there but always thought about it. 
so when i moved back to the richmond a couple years ago i was excited to see how it fared. 

 the size of the pieces of fish arent matched anywhere else in the city and the freshness is always top notch. the price is also super cheap considering each piece of sushi is equivalent in size to 2 at most places. they occasionally get some good toro and shellfish and if you let tazaki pick a roll of his choosing you wont be disappointed. 

theres almost never a wait and the staff is cool.

as far as price, quality, and availability of seating i dont think theres a better place in san francisco.
author: Mayo M.

description:
As we live within walking distance of this restaurant, we have been able to stop by a few times over the years. Typically I have ordered the hot food including chicken teriyaki and karaage which weren't too bad for a quick and cheap dinner.

But as my better half wanted to try them again,  we went against my better judgement.

We ordered seaweed salad, spider roll, california roll, dragon roll, and salmon, tuna, unagi, and hamachi nigiri. 

Simply put it was not good. It did not taste fresh and like I was headed for a stomach ache as may be evidenced by today's issues.

Even the seaweed salad was slimy, over seasoned and barely edible.

I will not be going back.
author: Miharu Y.

description: I enjoy eating sushi by myself because my bf is a sushi hater. lol I don't mind though. I came here twice for lunch and I was the only customer both times. oh well, more attention on me? Very friendly staff and sushi chef, they always made sure I was okay and had everything I need.  but why 4 stars? .. well I ordered their hotate nigiri (spicy) and it was.... bad....... like it was sitting there for a while.. getting its tan on by the beach.. so the next time i went back, I stuck with their lunch specials..
author: Annie Y.

description:
Tazaki's Soft Shell Crab is better than Maryland's, $6.95 each.  Go good with hot sake.

Their Chicken Kara Age is out of this world, by far the best.  Just the right combination of sweetness and crispiness.  

The Tazaki combination dinner offers three choices of entrees with generous portion for $12.95.  Came with Miso soup, salad, rice and ice cream.  Can't beat that.  

The order took a long time.  Otherwise, it deserves 5 stars.
author: Thomas L.

description:
Went here for an early dinner tonight by myself - got there around 5:30 and was the first one to arrive. They were setup, the place was extremely clean, pleasant and simply decorated. Immediately I was greeted with a menu, and a hot tea with free edamame. 

I placed an order for the yellowtail roll and the rock and roll (eel and avocado) roll with a miso soup. The miso came within 2 minutes and was the perfect temperature! It  was warm and amazing - especially on a chilly, foggy evening in the Sunset. 

The yellowtail roll was outstanding, beautifully plated, and the flavors were precise and delicate. I could eat two orders of that and still want more - and also a super great price for 6 pieces of sushi. 

The eel roll was also phenomenal. Everything, the miso soup, two rolls (12 pieces total) including tip was less than $15 and worth every penny. 

I will surely be back again! What a gem this beautiful little place is! 
Prompt polite service, thoughtful wait staff and pleasant atmosphere - I can't wait to go back. 

Thank you!
author: Betsy K.

description:
Super white tuna sashimi. 
.... Nom, nom-nom nom NOMMM!
author: Taylor C.

description:
Best place for sushi in the outer sunset...they always seem to be busy and for good reason...food is super fresh..service is great and sushi is awesome.

I usually get the combo box ( very affordably priced for 3 choices!  $12) dinner and some sushi to go.

I love this place, John is great and he manages the place terrificly...he's super friendly too.

Can't say enough about this place!!! 5 stars
author: Anthony G.

description:
I am a tempura lover and their vegetable tempura is my far my favorite out of all the places I've tried. Their dipping sauce actually had flavor and they had my favorite vegetables in the tempura - yam, cucumber, broccoli, etc.

The fish was okay. It's not super super fresh, but it's decent. Overall, I think their food is pretty good at a decent price. 

They gave me free green tea ice cream in the end. That's always a plus.
author: Amy T.

description:
I came here for a family dinner, so there were 20 of us in there. Yes, it's a large party and can be difficult to manage, but it's not a good excuse to be slow and careless. Most of the time the staff couldn't figure out which side of table a dish belonged to. The food took forever to come out and the staff was nowhere to be seen half the time. Some of my relatives didn't receive their dishes until the rest of us were done eating. They even gave my cousin's dish to another table by accident. How does that even happen? It didn't help that the waitresses barely knew English. They were better off speaking Chinese to us; we probably would have understood them better.

My food was OK. I got the katsu donburi, but my pork was a little dry. My boyfriend got the curry pork cutlet dish, but he said it wasn't even hot when he got it. The only good thing was their sashimi. The hamachi and salmon were very fresh and smooth.

The only thing that saved the night was when the owner came to apologize about the mix-up. It got really uncomfortable when he was lecturing the waitress in front of ALL of us though telling her that she has to make everyone happy. You could tell she couldn't really handle the stress because she cracked and was shouting at us for our ice cream orders. She yelled,"EVERYONE HAPPY?!" several times. I felt bad for her, but that was no way to treat customers. 

To make up for it, they covered our drinks, which didn't really do anything, but it's something I guess. I definitely will not be returning.
author: Kathy L.

description:
I have been going to this sushi restaurant since moving up to SF 5 years ago. I give it a five-star rating because, although it is not the best sushi house in the city when it comes to selection, it has consistently been top notch in service and quality for the price. 

The owner(s) are at Tazaki every day/evening and all staff are sure to greet you when you walk in. Edamame and hot tea are served right when you sit down by a smiling server. I like that there are a few servers who constantly survey the room and they all take it upon themselves to check on you, never picking and choosing their specific table. There are very efficient on taking your order and getting it out to you as soon as possible and are NEVER rude. 

Bottom line, my boyfriend and I choose this place over most restaurants because of it's consistency and convenience. I would go as far as saying it is the best sushi house in the Sunset District (excluding Ebisu in Inner Sunset).

If you are not a sushi snob, and you sometimes like to get Nigiri on a Tuesday evening "just because", go here!

Try it (but don't tell everyone you know ;))! You will not be disappointed.
author: Danielle A.

description: My favorite neighborhood spot for dinner. Sushi is fresh and delicious and service is great. I come here all the time! Love the specialty rolls.
author: Whitney O.

description: Best tempera ever and the chirashi bowl was amazing too!
author: Sarah K.

description: First time here. Good stuff, got a deal on the price, all my friends liked what they got, nice ambiance. Only weird thing was that my former landlord from the Mission/Delores Park apartment sat down at the table next to us...in the Sunset. Random. I'd definitely try Tazaki Sushi again.
author: Seth H.

description:
I like how they have an area where you can take off your shoes and sit on the mat like you see people do on TV in Japan. But after awhile my legs start to get cramped because there's not enough space under the table for all those legs. 

I have a friend who loves tempura and really like the sauce from here. I have to admit, their sauce for their tempura is definitely different and special. While the rolls here are decent sized and tastes fine, the fish itself is not that fresh. I had an udon from here and it had so many onions in it. It made me feel like I was having onion udon instead of the chicken and egg udon I ordered. Unless it's supposed to have so many onions? I've also had their beef teriyaki, but that was a miss since it was a little burnt. It's a little hard to flag down the servers.

At the end of the meal, we've always been given green tea ice cream, which is nice.
author: Jay L.

description:
Great little place in the outer sunset.

I love their chicken Katsu, it is really good, as is the beef teriyaki.

Sushi is pretty good too! Wish there were more special unique rolls
author: Sheila S.

description: Stopped for lunch here. Nice place. Not fancy but good food. One suggestion - make Lion King roll in foil to keep it moist. Was a little dry for my taste.
author: Katerina K.

description:
Sashimi was fresh! 

Yellowtail. 6 pieces for $8 buttery sweet.

Also tried a slice of Salmon. It was fatty and delicious.

The restaurant was completely empty. But the service was excellent. We had one extra person for 6 people table and they gave us another whole table. (given that it was completely empty) Still (the owner?) did it with a smile and a positive attitude. 

Great local outer sunset dig.
author: Christopher S.

description:
I live in the Outer Sunset, and since moving here Tazaki has become my 'go to' restuarant. The kind of place where you always go because you just know it will be good, and it feels relaxed and comfortable. The sushi is delicious, and they have an array of other Japanese dishes. It is casual and no fuss, which is the type of place I like to go after a busy day at work! Another great thing about Tazaki is the prices: they are very reasonable! I always leave there happy. The service is really good too, they are quick to get your food to you.
My only reason for not giving them 5 stars is that some of the dishes on the menu (sizzling plate, noodles) were good, but not amazing. Now I consistently order sushi or one of their combos. If you are in the Sunset I highly recommend Tazaki!
author: J K.

description: I am officially a fan of Tazaki Sushi! I've been here a few times already and was here again today because I wanted my mom and brother to try this place also! Parking was easy to find and we got seated instantly. We ordered 4 sushi rolls (6 pieces each), 2 orders of The Spoons, an order of the Midnight Express, 2 orders of the pumpkin salmon, and the Hawaiian fish steak special which includes a toro roll! Even though there was only 1 server working today, she was really great and attentive. Everything tasted really deliscious and fresh! I think everyone's favorite dish was the fish steak. It was really flavorful and tender! We should have ordered 2 of those! I also really enjoyed the pumpkin salmon. We were all really full by the end of our meal but since the our fish steak included ice-cream, we shared a green tea ice-cream, which was rich and creamy. Yum! Overall, everyone was very impressed with the quality of the food. I'm sure I'll be back here again really soon! :)
author: Mary C.

description:
This is somewhat traditional an modern sushi bar mixed together. Service was fair to good. Not bad but not so great either. Greeted & Seated fast , most likely because it was Tuesday night. 
Food was rather tasty and generous. We started off with some nigiri ( Ika, Saba, and Hirame)  She had the combo bento plate , While I had the traditional mixed nigiri. All the dinners come with salad, soup, and Ice cream. I cannot but say good things about this place. it's clean and fresh tasting cuisine is a must try, not to mention it's a good bang for the buck.
author: Jesse S.

description: came here with a party of 4 for dinner on a friday night. the wait was around 20-30mins. seated and the waitress gave us water and took our orders. we all ordered bento boxes and fried chicken wings appetizer. the chicken wing appetizer was pale as a ghost and the garnishing on this plate looked like the chef didn't even want to be there.  the fish was fresh for the sashimi but other than that nothing about the bento's stood out to me. coming back? maybe...
author: Anita L.

description:
I think I've found my new go-to sushi place. The food is good, the prices are good, and there's plenty of parking. 

I love those little green salads with iceberg lettuce and house dressing that you get at cheap Japanese restaurants. I'm always disappointed at the upscale joints which only offer more authentic seaweed salads or green salads with only gourmet lettuce. Tazaki doesn't disappoint--and the salad is only like $1.50. The creamy sushi is as good as the other yelp reviews claimed. I've been craving it since. The little bowl of edamame that we were served on arrival was also a nice touch. 

Tazaki looks like a typical cheap sushi joint--it's pretty bare bones inside. Yet, still, it was comfortable enough that we lingered over dinner for an hour and a half--even with the fast service.
author: Susan S.

description: Nothing bad about this place! Everything I tried was fresh and delicious! The waitress even gave my boyfriend and I free green tea ice cream for dessert once. Good prices too. Also very close to my house which is a plus but they do deliver!
author: Annalise T.

description:
3.5 Stars

+ Same menu as Okazu Ya
+ Decent Prices
+ Fast Service

Came here with my buddy Kylie L, and her BF for dinner a while ago.  We arrived around 6 pm and were quickly seated by the waitress there who also served us green tea. The menu here is pretty much the same as Okazu Ya's so it was no problem for me to decide on what to order.

I had a Bentou with Teriyaki Beef, Teriyaki Chicken, Tenpura, salad, Miso Soup and a bowl of rice. Everyone was tasty and super filling. I especially liked the Teriyaki Chicken which was perfectly cooked and tender. 

Aside from the Bentou, I also had an Uni and a Philly Roll. The sushi here is not too bad, but not great either. You pretty much get what you pay for. The Uni (Sea Urchin) was good, but I've had much better ones. My buddy thought the Uni tasted/smelled like the dirty beach. Great... The Philly Roll  had avocados in them. Somewhat different than the Philly Rolls I normally have. 

To sum it up, Tazaki Sushi is a nice place to eat if you are craving for Japanese Cuisine without spending a fortune. I would definitely come back for the Bentou here. They're so filling! : )
author: Mona C.

description:
What can I say about this place that hasn't already been said? Tazaki is my favorite local spot. Best sushi in the sunset, hands down. 

Large rolls, HUGE pieces of nigiri, and some of the best fish I've had in the entire city, all for reasonable, below average prices. Their kitchen is on par with the sushi bar, so if you want to try a little bit of everything I highly recommend a 3 item combo box. 

It is often crowded if you go after 6:30-7, so your wait time for a table and for the food can be sluggish, to say the least. However the quality, generous portions, and friendly staff make the wait worth it. 

Writing this review makes me want to drop in tonight!
author: R K.

description:
Awesome find! Stellar food and great deals. You can get a 4 course meal (edamame, miso soup, entree and ice cream) for $13 and leave with no room left in your belly. 

Really nice and considerate staff. Everything is good!
author: Adrianna M.

description:
After living less than 1 mile away from this place for the last 17 years, I've finally decided to come pay it a visit. Walked in, service was nice. I was acknowledged immediately and was shown the table. There were 3 families also eating.  

The table that I was shown to was not exactly stable. It's one of those table that tilts whenever you put your arms on it. It's ok I guess, but then it's sticky, so whenever it tilts, it makes those stickyass sounds. Not so bad, but a bit irritating after awhile. But it's ok, as long as the food is good right? Wrong. I couldn't be more wrong with this place. I came here with humble expectations. Ordered three dishes that I'm fond of - Cold Soba and two rolls (one is an Uni roll while the other is albacore with white bass. 

First of all, the portions were decent. They're pretty big, and you will get full off it, unlike the pussyass portions from Ebisu. But besides good portions and decent service, everything else goes into the shithole. So where do I begin? Well let's see....

The cold soba was soaked. At first I thought it was from me dipping it into the sauce, but after looking at a growing puddle underneath the noodle box, I noticed that the liquid was clear, and not black. My noodles literally took a piss while I was eating it. Can it get anymore disgusting? Not only did it felt weird to chew on soggy noodles dipped in the sauce, it also tasted weird. How did they manage to fuck up something as simple as cold noodles with a cup of sauce for dipping? It's like eating out a girl while shes taking a piss at the same time. Now that's just sick.

The albacore / white bass sushi roll was cut unevenly. One piece would be really big, and the other would be small. The fish was not even cold! It was room temperature, which made me to start imagining how it's the optimum temperature for bacteria to grow on dead flesh. I'm sorry, but after taking biology class where you learn about incubation, you start to think about this shit when eating something that's in the wrong temperature. Knowledge is power right? Yes it is.... Did I mention that it had no flavor, but somehow has a weird after taste. How weird is that? 

Finally let's get to the uni roll. Uni is one of my favorite dish. I've tried a few varieties of Uni, whether it's live, nigiri, boiled with soup, by itself 'sashimi,' etc. But I must say this is the first time where I've had 'shit uni.' I'm not joking. The uni was so pressed against the rice that it literally looked like diarrhea. Surprise! The uni was also warm! You can probably guess that it was also not firm; it was liquidy. So can you imagine what this soft uni looked like mixed with rice? Yeah, like literally a pile of soft yellow feces being mixed with white maggots. This is just sick, I had two pieces (one with soy sauce, one by itself.... they both tasted like shit) and couldn't take it anymore. Even Lacy rejected this pile of vomit after I brought home the other 4 pieces, and it's fucking Lacy for god's sake. Oh, Lacy's my dog by the way, and she's willing to eat anything that's not shit. This, obviously, is shit. I ended up having to throw it all away. How did they fuck up so much with this? I love uni, but this was just a miserable shitload of fuck.
author: Calvin D.

description:
This is my go to sushi place because it really is the closest and the only one I really know.

To me, everything is average. It's sushi and they don't go wrong with it, it's just nothing crazy or exciting. I get my typical rolls, which consist of a rainbow roll, philadelphia roll, and one roll at random. I usually add in 2 salmon nigiri because it's my favorite. Those taste the freshest. I really like that it's not cut too thick and it's the perfect portion.

The only big thing that I'm a fan of is their tempura. It's delicious and I absolutely love it. It's a huge portion, especially when I get it for myself. There's always enough of everything and typically, I end up leaving a few onions on the plate. Still overall, delicious.

I really enjoy that they give you edamame and green tee as soon as you get there. It's a nice appetizer that's free. They're good too.

If I find a better place in the area, then I'll probably not come back, but I haven't found anything convenient as Tazaki, so I'll stick to it.
author: Andrew T.

description: I love this place! Everything and anything that I've ordered here is delicious! The sashimi is always fresh. The hamachi tastes like butter, the white tuna is sweet, and the amaebi is to die for. I've also had their combination udon, which comes with a shrimp tempura, fish cakes, chicken, and napa cabbage. The udon portion is big so it can be shared with a friend. The sizzling fish platters are also superb, especially the sea bass and the sword fish. The bento boxes are a good deal and delicious. I can't say enough about this place and I recommend it to friends and family all the time.
author: Annie M.

description:
I've been here several times but I've been sitting here for an hour, received sake and beer and salads and seen 3 other couples served while we wait.  I'm hungry.


They came back and made the evening extraordinary so good on you!!
author: Jessica B.

description:
We wanted to find a Japanese restaurant near Crepe Temptations, so we yelped it and here we are. I wasn't expecting much out of this random sushi restaurant with houses next to it, so I just wanted some sushi! 

The service was very good, the waiters would keep asking if we wanted tea. Although I did not need more tea, it was nice to know that they are there when I actually DO want tea. The prices are pretty good, I got the combination bento box with sashimi, chicken karaage, and tempura. It was around $12 or so, and comes with salad, soup, rice, and free ice cream at the end! The choices for ice cream were pineapple coconut, mango, green tea, or vanilla. 

I enjoyed my time there and it was a pleasant experience because everyone there was very welcoming. The sashimi was fresh, and everything was delicious. All I had to do was save room for a crepe later. :)
author: Natalie W.

description: Hearty sushi rolls, freshly made and delicious. The tempura is always crispy and the sashimi always fresh! Foods are always on point with their flavors. Their creativity is a plus too! I tried a lot of things on their menu and am happy about all the selections I made so far. Tazaki is a place I will keep coming back. They take care of my tummy!!!
author: Diana T.

description:
This used to be called Judah Okazu-Ya.  It still has pretty much the same menu as the other Okazu-Ya restaurants on Noriega and Taraval, and may be run by same group despite the change in name.

I came on Saturday night and was surprised how busy it was. Overall, I guess crowd-wise it could be about the same as Noriega, the latter has a bigger space.  The sushi tasted fresher here, it seems.  Also, when I come to one of these Okazu-Ya restaurants, a must are the raw oysters.

For those who are fans of dining tatami style, they have those tables here.  It appears one there is truly sitting on the floor, seems like there's no space cut out underneath for the legs unlike what other restaurants I've seen with this setup do.
author: H K.

description:
I ate here tonight for an after work trip to SF and I was pretty hungry for some good sushi. First look into this place it is so adorable! It is small but I thought it was great for the mini date that I had. It has a small sushi bar and probably isn't good for a huge party but nice and quiet at the time that we went. 

The service was good. The friendly waitress was good about refilling our tea. We ordered 5 sushi rolls which was a good amount for dinner. The rolls I found were good sized and the price wasn't too bad. The tuna and salmon rolls were kind of skimpy when it came to the rice content and a little too much seaweed was used. But I loved their Cherry Blossom roll for it's presentation and taste! The sushi came out at separate times, which I guess was good but there were intervals where we had nothing to eat.

I will definitely try this place again to see how the other items on the menu fare. Overall, I think it was worth the price and I found the service to be good.  I am glad that everything tasted fresh and well put together! Cute sushi place in the Sunset.
author: Tracy Joy K.

description:
I am always looking for a new place to try.  And Tazaki Sushi was close by and open for dinner.  Its located on Judah street and parking is kind of difficult.. so my husband circled around while I got us a table with the kids.  The staff was really nice and they provide you with complementary edamame, which is super cool when you're a mom with starving children at the table.  

We ordered their Sake Nigiri, Caterpillar Roll, Dragon Roll, Spider Roll, and a combination bento for the kids. The sushi was awesome it tasted fresh and was flavorful.  The teriyaki beef was a little under whelming but was everything was edible.  Inside the bento included a small portion of seaweed salad.  And we ended the dinner with some green tea ice cream for the kids.

Cozy interior, lots of tables (it looked like they might have a small room in the back for a private party), small flat screen TV which was great to keep track of the sports scores for the men, and a small fish tank to occupy my the kids while we waited for the food.

I liked the place....and will def try it again.
author: Sheenie L.

description: Fresh sushi, reasonable price , friendly and fast service.  This place was packed on a weekday which says a lot about the place.  We ordered chirashi, dragon roll, tuna and hamachi sushi . Everything we ordered was really fresh and superb.  Their Chirashi included Uni which was rare for most sushi places . It was my first time to try Uni and it was delish. Will definitely come back to this place and try  their other nigiri and sashimi.
author: Claudine V.

description: I came here last night after reading all of the amazing reviews.  The place is cute and there was no wait (it was 945 pm on a Sat night.)  We got a chef's special sushi dinner and the shrimp tempura udon.  Everything was okay, not spectacular but okay.  The nigiri fish pieces were really big but not that flavorful.  The tempura was under seasoned.  We didn't wait too long for our food and the service was fine.  It was VERY inexpensive - $32 for more than enough food!  I won't go back though, it was not good enough considering all of the great food in this city.
author: Reggie G.

description:
Recently moved to the neighborhood and wanted to try a new sushi restaurant. I was pleasantly surprised with Tazaki Sushi. 

The service was very quick, all the servers were polite and took care of us well. The excellent service and fresh fish is why I will definitely be coming back. My favorite of the dinner would have to be the salmon sashimi or the Creamy Roll- I would order both again. And free green tea ice cream was a nice surprise after our entrees!
author: Megan K.

description:
Dinner bento combos were totally worth it! I've tried combo A and B. Both really good. Chicken kaarage was very flavorful and juicy. Tonkatsu was average, beef teriyaki was good, sashimi was very fresh. 

Rolls here are good. I don't have a favorite yet.

This place is always crowded. so go there early. Also they have poor ventilation and when people order those sizzling plates, it will be stuck on your clothing.

I took off a star because their service is inconsistent. While my table was attended to quite well. The table next to us were very annoyed because their order was mixed up, and when they wanted to pay, there was no one around. They ordered the tempura appetizer. but this guy came with the dinner tempura, and when the customers asked the guy he left to go check then came back and just dropped the same plate on their table without saying anything. Really??
author: Erica L.

description: Yummy! Bento boxes for dinner @ 12.95: Tazaki combination has a variety of choices, you can select 3 options that come with miso soup, salad, rice, a dollop of seaweed and 2 slices of pickled ginger, and your choice of ice cream (green tea is amazing). Sushi here is ok, but the bento boxes are really good. I took a photo of the combo options. A cute restaurant and good service.
author: Ally W.

description: Spicy Hamachi Roll? Delicious.  Philadelphia Roll? Delicious.  California Roll?  Best I've ever had.  Salmon Nigiri is to die for, and the Summer Lover Roll (Spicy Tuna, Salmon, and Mango) was a game changer.  I haven't had sushi this consistently good in a very long time, and it's the first sushi place I've been to that actually makes me want to explore the menu and try things I normally wouldn't try.  And if you dine in or even just wait inside long enough for your take out you get free tea! Eat here and you won't regret it, but the other sushi places you've been going to might.
author: Eric L.

description:
Hmmmm when did Judah Okazuya become Tazaki???

We originally wanted to go Isobune on Geary but the wait was too long. Then I suggested Taraval Okazuya since that my fav sushi spot but there's prob a wait there so I suggested Judah Okazuya. Drove here, empty but the name has changed. I wonder if it's the same owners.

There sushi menu is still the same but what I liked here is that they give you the prices of the rolls instead of keeping it a secret until the bill comes! So I ordered my usual Okazuya roll, Dragon Roll, Tekka Roll, and the Creamy Roll. I didn't intentionally wanted to order all these to myself, but my friend doesn't eat raw fish and told me AFTER I had ordered it and the food had already arrived! 

Loved the okazuya roll. Always good and always hits my sushi spot. Tekka roll? Not so fresh. The tuna was mushy and discolored. Gross. The dragon roll was good and it was huge! Lots of unagi. They don't skimp on that! And the creamy roll.. they don't make it the same as the one on Taraval! No wasabi side dip =(

Owner and waitress was super friendly and even offered me miso and my tea cup was always filled...
author: Juliane N.

description: Fresh fish, extensive menu if Japanese dishes, delicious rolls, and so inexpensive for the quality meal offered.  Hidden gem!
author: alexa c.

description:
***Disclaimer: I don't know why there are two Yelp pages for the same store and location so I'm posting this on both*** 

Let me just start by saying the pictures are not an accurate indicator of the slide of fish I that ordered. I don't know if they were ever that good as the pictures form 2012 but the Sake sashimi I got tonight was about 3/8 inch thick, not the best quality cuts, and oddly shaped (some were rectangular and the size of a thick pen, while other were thin and flat). My date had the pork ramen, which had a soup that was as bland as water. We poured pepper flakes and soy sauce into the soup to no avail as there was little to be done to resuscitate the lost cause. The noodles were very thin, similar to some Chinese dishes I've seen and were not really ramen noodles, unless it was supposed to be some sort of spin on the traditional ramen that I'm not aware. The green tea dessert, on the other hand, was delicious. I'm not sure if the contrast between the flavors at dinner had anything to do with my experience during dessert because green tea ice cream is pretty safe dessert where ever you go. In all, dinner ran a little under $30, which is cheap for Japanese and for SF but neither person leaving satisfied, I would rather spend the couple extra bucks at a better place. The high ratings and reviews makes me question whether I experienced an off night or San Franciscans have never actually been to good sushi places.
author: Dang T.

description:
