I must say...the last sushi roll on the Maki (Roll) Sushi menu, "Yakuza Maki (Soft Shell Crab, Eel & Tempura)" is my ultimate favorite roll.   My second favorite is "49er Maki" (because the flavor of lemon is light and it isn't overpowering).

We spent approx around $100 between 4 hungry people.  Not bad.
author: Wendy T.

description: Good place, but unhelpful service.  Their menu doesn't describe their entrees, and when I ask them about it, they aren't very knowledgeable.  Other than that, their food is pretty good.
author: Karen L.

description: The service was slow but only because we came on the day they reopened after closing for vacation. I can understand why everyone had come that day because the food is great! Not super authentic in my opinion (i have had sushi from Japan) but it was still delicious and well priced. The owner and staff are all very friendly and if you love fresh eel this is the place to go!
author: Caryn S.

description: Hidden gem of the sunset! This place has some of the best sushi I've ever had. In particular, I would recommend their volcano roll and spicy tuna hand roll. It gets a bit busy during dinner time, so expect a wait, but its definitely worth it.
author: Ilona S.

description:
It would really, REALLY have helped if the guy serving our food had washed his hands. He had dirt all over his hands and under his fingernails. Gross.

Other than that, it was pretty mediocre. The eel was particularly fatty and poorly cooked.
author: Beth D.

description:
Went here for dinner one night . Just a typical Japanese place with alright rolls. Nothing impressive.  A friend of mine got the uni and didn't each much of it because it started to get old. 

next time you can train your staff to know what each roll is ........
author: Michael T.

description:
it would have been 5 stars. I love their food. I loved the little family I met. Nice clean shop.

I don't love ordering delivery and then being called back to be told they are to busy to deliver.

I'm too busy to patron you.

Don't list it as a service if its not a service all the time.


PPS the English speaking guy on the phone was kind of a dick.
author: Kitten M.

description:
Pros: Consistently tasty food, excellent staff, and open past 8pm.

Cons: Small/not a lot of seating, and since the last few times I've been there a family has been celebrating something, it can get cramped.
author: Megan L.

description:
We go there very often, but this time the service was very very slow, we were neglected sitting on the counter seats.
The dinner took about 1hr and 40 minutes. Too long for 2 dishes.
I hope the owner see this review and correct this bad service practice.
author: Max W.

description: I never write reviews but I HAD to for Tazaki sushi. This place gives exceptional service which is something I never experience when I hear the employees speaking chinese. They're always smiling and they make me feel appreciated. They serve delicious and fresh sushi (haven't tried anything else, I've been there about three times). I love their location and hours. I recommend to anyone looking for Japanese food in the outer sunset. Keep it up!
author: Vicky H.

description:
We came to this restaurant today right when they opened.  I was surprised that the staff apparently show up for work only several minutes before opening.  We had to wait while the staff removed the chairs from their tabletops from the prior night's cleaning.  I should have picked up on this lack of professionalism.

In short, I was disappointed with my lunch and I believe the 4 star rating this restaurant has on yelp is much too generous.  The service was excruciatingly slow (especially considering how empty is was), the waitress barely spoke English, and she never offered to refill our water or tea.  She got one of our order's wrong, and the entrees came out at varying times, up to 10 minutes apart.

The food itself was mediocre at best.  The sushi was just OK, and the udon broth lacked an authentic flavor (it simply tasted much too salty). 

There are much better options in the Sunset district for Japanese food at or slightly above the prices here.  I recommend you consider your other options first before going here.
author: Jeff H.

description:
I guess it is a hit or miss when you come here.  After reading some bad reviews of this place, I was scared that we might not get fresh fish.  Howver, when you look at their menu and photos on their website...you're taken aback with the look of freshness and deliciousness!

So we ordered with caution because advertisements and photos can be deceiving.

First of all, walking in, we were seated immediately as the first customers for the lunch hour.  I was a bit hesitant - as always - when the staff are speaking Chinese in a Japanese restaurant (or any other language).

We ordered the following:

Nama Kaki Viagra:  6 raw oysters served with heaping portions of uni on top with ponzu sauce on the side.  It was okay.  I read other reviews saying their uni tasted bad, but it was okay today.  I've had bad uni at the best of places, so it's really a hit or miss when taking your chances....in fact, the nama kaki viagra was the best thing we had at the restaurant.

Nabeyaki Udon:  tender noodles served piping hot in an clay pot.  Poached egg on top with just the right amount of onions and napa cabbage, chicken, shitake mushrooms, fish cake, and 1 shrimp tempura.  This was okay as well...better than some other places.  The broth was flavorful - not bland at all.

Rolls:
Creamy Roll - which they seemed to be famous for.  It was made with scallop and spicy tuna - not to spicy, and it had an abundant amount of spicy mayo sauce that drowned it.  I like to taste the fish - not mask it.

Spider Rainbow roll - deep fried soft shell crab topped with a variety of fish - this was okay, but our fried soft shell crab was burnt

Sunset Maki - sea urchin roll with tobiko - this was good....I could have done with an order of this and 3 orders more of the oysters and be set.

I don't know if i'd venture to try this place for other stuff.  The rice for the sushi was not so sticky that the rolls fell apart..  Fish was fresh - but I've had fresher fish (at least it didn't taste like it sat in the fridge for a few days)

Overall - okay.
author: JJAMZ C.

description:
I'm on the border between 3.5 STARS and 4 STARS. Seeing as how there are plenty of Japanese restaurants to compare with, I will lean more with 3.5 STARS.

This restaurant offers some KILLER Chicken Katsu Curry! Compared with other restaurants this is a solid 4 STARS. Flavor was on point with Japanese Curry. It had a good portion of carrots, onions, and crispy delicious chicken katsu. I was surprised at the quality of their Chicken Katsu mainly because when you have a Chinese Owned Japanese Restaurant (majority of Japanese restaurants in SF) quality and authenticity comes into play. But their Chicken Katsu was by far some of the best I had in the city. You can expect to have large pieces that are crispy, full of flavor, and not overly breaded. 

Their sushi on the other had is more on the 3 STAR side...but when you take into account the price, portion, and size of rolls I will give it 3.5 STARS. They have a great selection of sushi to choose from, which is great if you are a picky sushi eater. If you live in the sunset district or are in the neighborhood and have a late night craving for sushi, it will suffice. 

Overall, this is the kind of place where it's late, all the really good Japanese restaurants are closed, you are on a budget, and need some JAPANESE FOOD!!! Great neighborhood place to get decent to good Japanese food, but nothing to travel for or take a date. If you live around here and are craving Japanese food, give it a shot, you won't be disappointed. But don't expect to be blown away...unless you order that KILLER Chicken Katsu Curry...=]
author: Nick C.

description: Sushi's good but the wait is bad. We went on a Friday with the entire family, kids included. Took about 20 minutes to get a table which wasn't bad. We ordered udon for the kids and the adults ordered sashimi and sushi rolls. The udon came out fairly quickly. However, 45 minutes later still no sushi or sashimi. We ended up taking everything to go since half the family left. We ended up waiting an additional 15 minutes for the food to be ready and packed up. Needless to say we had plans to eat dinner at 7:00 but ended up finally eating at 8:45...at home.
author: Kathy Y.

description: Very fresh sushi/sashimi.  Best by far in the Sunset area!  Reasonably priced.  My favorite neighborhood gem!
author: Cindy C.

description:
I came here on a Thurs night with 2 friends. The wait wasn't too bad for peak dinner time. The food was actually very good. They start you off with free edamame. We ordered entrees of chicken katsu, deep fried scallops and beef sukiyaki, each was ~$10 (a pretty good deal as far as Japanese places go). The sukiyaki was a pretty large portion and the other ones were standard size/as expected. We also ordered a 49er roll to share (scallop, lemon, salmon) and they were generous with the salmon and scallop, very little filler stuff. The entrees come with miso soup, rice, salad and ice cream! Most places charge extra for ice cream so we were very excited about this. I wasn't a huge fan of the salad dressing (I don't really like ginger flavor), but that's just me. The rest of the food was great!

The reason for the low rating is the terrible service, probably one of the worst experiences I've had! 
1. The food did not come out around the same time. My friend got her chicken katsu at least 15-20 minutes before the rest of the food arrived. I understand that sukiyaki takes a bit longer to cook, but it should be timed better so everyone at a table is served within a reasonable time frame. Service in general was SO SLOW. Our meal from start to finish took well over 2 hours with the majority of it waiting around!
2. They messed up our order multiple times. My friend ordered the deep fried scallops, but the waitress apparently heard "fried soft shell crab" (which sounds very different to me). There was also a separate order form for sushi and we marked off 49er roll, but instead she input California roll (what the hell??). The waitress didn't seem to understand English that well so I can somewhat understand the scallop/soft shell crab mixup, but I don't understand how she could've messed up the sushi order when we wrote it ourselves! My advice to her would be to repeat back orders to customers to double check.
3. They flat out forgot to give us our ice cream at the end and we had to ask for it. Not only that, when they told us our choices were green tea or cookies and cream, my friend ended up with coconut (or maybe it was coconut cream??). Either we didn't hear right or she doesn't really know what the restaurant even serves. We were so fed up with the service by that time that we didn't bother to ask about it. Sigh.
4. Some of the waiters seemed more preoccupied with the TV than actually serving customers. One of the waiters just sat there drinking beer and watching the game (I'll cut him some slack because it was the NBA finals, but still...). We had to ask for the bill twice. However, they were quick to take our money afterwards!

3 stars may be a bit generous. Based on this experience, I probably won't be back.
author: Janet N.

description:
Mmmmm.  SUSHI, SASHIMI, and what-have-you.

Look, it's the cafe formerly known as Judah Okazu-ya!

Nice neighborhood joint.  Full menu-- there's plenty more Japanese food than just raw fish.

You're in the outer avs and want a quick Japanese pick-me-up nosh on a lazy Sunday afternoon?  Tazaki is perfect.

Very low-key, all ages-welcome, no attitude.

Fab value!  Lot of food for your $.

Those of us who ain't gettin' no stoopid super-media-hyped tax rebate this year, need to watch our dimes, you know.  ;P

I'd like to keep this spot our little secret, so prices don't get jacked up like most other sushi places.

5-star because... ordering a fruit juice then requesting it be heated up/microwaved was accepted graciously with zero questions asked or disdainful looks given.  :o

Maguro was great.  Broad deep-red hued slices draped over rice.  Not a fish vein in sight.  Mirugai was yummy too.  Yeah my sushi palate ain't too diverse.  Those are my faves.

Tempura was the only weak spot.  Seemed too.. batter-y.

Frankenstein-o review now:

Sushi..  Gooood
Puh-rys-uh.. gooood
Sah-vee-suh.. gooood
Pahh-keen-guh gooood.
Maach-machh bettah zan Taraval, or Noriega, or J-town.

Me want more.
Next time me in City me come back Tazaki.

:D
author: Jade T.

description:
I'm hoping that I'll be able to come back here and write an update with a better review soon, but as for now, here goes.

I was checking out Yelp to see if there were any other good sushi places aside from the one that I always go to. I wanted to try something new. I find Tazaki Sushi, formerly called Judah Okazu ya. It's got some great reviews, I check out the menu and fell i love with the half dozon raw oysters w/ uni and decided to come.

We walk in around 2:45 - 3 ish, completely empty. The server, sushi chef, everybody was eating lunch at a table watching TV. Which is fine, they're people too, they get hungry. The table we sit at is sticky. Ew. I ignore it and decide to order my appetizer, uni maki, philidelphia roll, and a couple others that we found appealing on the menu. The food overall wasn't BAD. But for the price I paid, I felt like it could have been better.

And OMG the presentation. It was so sloppy, I should have taken a picture and posted it. The Philidelphia Roll (Cream Cheese & Salmon Maki) was literally a piece of frozen cream cheese  with a small block of salmon barely the size of my pinky nail. The sushi was hastily made and the rice was falling off the seaweed and the cheese & salmon was falling out as well. The uni Maki looked just as sloppy, it looked scooped out of the tray and placed into the roll. Not even pieces of uni, scoops. You could see the spoon mark where it cut into the uni. Now, that wouldn't have been bad if I could pick it up without the uni squirting out. AND THE UNI WAS WARM. WTF?! WARM UNI IS DISGUSTING. 

The appetizer that I came for was good though, So I have to give an extra star for that, bumping it up to a two star review. The oysters were a little small, but the amount of uni given was generous, and the ponzu sauce was pretty good. Even though I could see the sugar they threw in quickly to make the sauce sweeter. Ack.

Overall, I didn't really enjoy my experience here. They dumped the food on our table and made it quickly to get back to their lunch and whatever TV channel they were all fixated on. I understand that they're hungry too, but in business, customers are a first priority.
author: Desiree C.

description: This place is a wonderful family run sushi restaurant.  It's fresh and delicious and they have great specials.
author: jessica v.

description: My very favorite sushi place in all of San Francisco! After discovering Tazaki all other Japanese restaurants seem like a waste of my money. Fresh, delicious sushi and sashimi that come in big pieces and cost a fraction of what you pay anywhere else. It's also family owned and operated, which is a big plus. Go there and see for yourself!
author: Feliz L.

description: Blah...typical sushi restaurant owned by Chinese who's quality of sushi is less then mediocre.  I really didn't enjoy anything I tried...
author: Patrick C.

description: Pretty friendly environment. Food was alright and the service was really nice. I don't have much big to say nor have anything negative.
author: Sonlay V.

description:
1 star for opening late for lunch.  They do not close until 3pm.  

Ordered some rolls and some sushi.  Also, had their fried oysters as well as the raw oysters with uni on top.  At least 1 out of the 3 raw oysters were not fresh and my friend thought 1 of the fried oysters was going bad.   

We were bracing for sickness but was glad it didn't happen.   

The rest of the sushi and rolls were just eh.   not particularly fresh or impressive.   

Service that late, also was just so-so.  Didn't clear our table of plates, took a while to get our water, and our check... but we were the only ones there.  

nah, will not be returning here.   If sushi craving.... YuZen is the place to go.
author: Regi K.

description:
If it wasn't for my fear of mercury poisoning I would eat here 3x a day! 

The staff is extremely friendly and the prices are reasonable.  

Most of all you can opt to have Real Crab Meat! Let me say that again: you can have Real Crab Meat in your maki rolls!
author: Alton P.

description:
Just moved from Kailua town on the Hawaiian island of Oahu & NinjaSushi's "SuperMan Maki" is thee greatest, but went to Tazaki Sushi restaurant & the chef there created a similar dish for me & put it on the menu & his is more spicy but always good. I've ordered it over 7 times now & each time it was amazing with more sweet then spicy but this last time it was the worst sushi icpve ever had with the meat was glossy slimy like it was washed of with water then made & tasted not good.

But I'm not going to let this 1 out of 8 times of perfection come between my 4 star rating. Would of been a perfect 5 star if that last one didn't make me sick. Literally did not feel good after & even till the next day. But other then that, there delivery is fudgen awesome & I do recommend them & for the most part amazing. 

Ask for the "SuperMan Maki", most likely it will be so amazing & you will never order anything else sushi wise again, it's that good :-)
author: Makana R.

description: Loved the atmosphere. Not TOO crowded. Sake bombs definitely helped. Didn't like the hamachi or albacore very much. Warm  and didn't feel natural because it was TOO juicy. 49ers roll was a fail. Dynamite was so-so. Cucumber salad is a MUST. Small portions, but good for the price. Saba was REALLY good. Vegetable tempura appetizer and Gyoza was as expected.
author: Charles G.

description: Great food! Friendly atmosphere. Took a little long to get my friends vegi tempura. But overall a great sushi bar
author: Rich M.

description:
I came to Tazaki looking for a yummy bento box experience. I looked over the menu before I came and just seeing all of the options under the entree list and even the sizzling fish options, everything sounded very enticing. 

I stopped by for dinner and I settled for a Tazaki combo with beef teriyaki, shrimp tempura and tuna sashimi. Our waitress was a bit soft spoken so I couldn't really hear what she was saying half of the time. She brought out edamame, tea, followed by miso soup. She dropped off bowls of rice before our bento boxes came out. The bento boxes looked super good and it even came with a bit of seaweed salad. Unfortunately, I wasn't impressed with my bento. The beef teriyaki was sliced too thinly for my liking and was in a sauce that tasted bottled. The salad was not drained properly and was sitting in water. The sashimi was nice and thick but wasn't very fresh. My favorite part of the bento were the tempura veggies which came with the shrimp tempura. The veggies were sliced thinly, enough to hold that good crunch with the batter. However, the shrimp looked a bit gray in color. I also tried my bf's ca roll which just had no flavor at all. 

As for the scoop of ice cream that came with our meals, green tea, mango and butter pecan were available.  I ordered the mango which was nothing special but I was just happy to get something sweet at the end of the meal. 

Whom I think may be the owner seemed really nice. The restaurant is larger than I expected it to be and it's great that they have a tv for sports fans. However, I'll just have to pass on Tazaki's.
author: Maya S.

description:
Because of a time constraint, we pulled an audible and went to Tazaki since Outer Lands was slammed for lunch. It turned out to be a great decision. Seating was ample, but not nearly as ample as the size of the fish in the nigiri! Possibly the biggest I've ever seen. I can't say I was a huge fan of the pot stickers, but the unagi made up for it. Seaweed salad was light and refreshing. 

Pricing was very respectable. The inside could use a little facelift as the Snoopy curtains separating the seating area and the kitchen made me chuckle. 

I don't make it to the outer sunset too often, but if I'm in the neighborhood again, I'd probably stop by.
author: Alex O.

description: Decent neighborhood sushi joint but definitely "Yelp-hyped" where the Yelp score is much better than the actual food. -1 for disappointing service. Our table was located around a corner so the waitstaff often forgot about us. Some of our waiters were wearing regular street clothes, so we didn't even realize they were waiters at first. I'm all for casual but... really?
author: Rob C.

description:
Are you looking for a good sushi place in the Sunset, reasonably priced?
Then, Tazaki Sushi is your new friend!
The sushis taste very fresh, not frozen like in other places. They have a good lunch menu choices for less $10. Miso soup, rice, salad and ice cream and green tea included! A real deal! Try the salmon teriyaki or the tempura. 
If you prefer to go for dinner, arrive early, because sometines, they are very busy with local customers. Good choice of sake, too. Ask the waiter to help you choose. Try a cold sake!
The owners are family related, and the service is quick in general. I had a good culinary experience with Tazaki Sushi. 
My husband went to Tokyo and Osaka a year ago, and said that this little place is really like the kind of sushi place you find in Japan. Pretty authentic. That's a cool addition
author: Christine L.

description: Waited for almost an hour for two rolls for pickup. Rolls are very small for the price not worth it and didn't taste good. Wouldn't recommend.
author: E Y.

description: I personally love this place. When I come and dine in,  the owner is always very welcoming and warn.  Checking up on us constantly.  The sushi is very good and their meals are also good. I order for pick up from them also and they do everything in a timely manner
author: Sa V.

description: I expected to have authentic sushi but it was terrible. Too much wasabi on sushi rice killed the taste of fish. Fish was not fresh at All. I won't go here anymore.
author: Kosaku S.

description:
Good sushi and sashimi. Last time I went there, they had toro as today's special and it was almost as good as what I had in Tokyo.
Price is very reasonable and the personnel looks happy to work there.
author: Dominique B.

description: I partial to Tazaki because its local and Tazaki and John are very cool. love their rolls and appreciate me some green tea ice cream after dinner. and tazaki is always smiling... gotta love a happy sushi chef.
author: Abe L.

description:
Prices = higher than normal for this area
Food = good
Service = okay
Seating = close
Atmosphere = cozy and dimly lit
author: Fannie S.

description:
Yelped around for a sushi place because I wanted a change in my Japanese food and came here. I came on a Friday night about 630 ish and totally beat the rush. 

We ordered chicken udon soup, salmon nigiri, rainbow roll, and salmon skin with spicy tuna roll. The soup was great, a big bowl for tasty chicken pieces, thinly sliced bamboo chutes and onions and lots of noodles. Lots of flavor too. The rainbow roll was sooo good- it was soft shell crab in the middle with avocado and a hint of orange with diff kinds of fish wrapped on the outside. The soft shell crab gave it a good crunch and was delicious. The spicy tuna roll was great too. It was spicy tuna with crispy salmon skin. 

Would definitely come back here again. Parking was easy and ambiance was warm and friendly. I like how they give tea and edamame while you wait. yum yum
author: Joy A.

description: Reasonably priced and delicious sushi. Our local go-to sushi spot. Swamp roll and lily maki are our favorites. Attentive and friendly staff!
author: Tara C.

description:
Disclosure:  I am a friend and also their agent.

This place is cool.  It used to be one of the many Okazuyas in the Sunset district, Taraval, Noriega, and Judah.  There used to be one on Clement st. as well called...............you got it, Clement Okazuya.  

Michael and Joanna sold this to my friend and now it's called Tazaki Sushi.  Although they are not Japanese and probably not as authentic as other Japanese places, it is still good.

Stick with the stuff that they are known for and were trained to cook and perfected.

Chilean sea bass on their hot skillet.  I always order this dish because it is very good and it never disappoints.
chicken Kaarage.............for some reason, I really love the way they prepare it here. 
Stick with the rolls

The prices here are fair, service was quick and the owner.was nice and will drink with you during dinner.
author: jason g.

description:
Dinner bento is decent. Price is okay but their portions are pretty small. The cooked items are pretty good. The raw fish and sushi could be a hit or miss. But the last time the salmon sashimi was pretty good. 

Nice easy local spot that I could walk to. They usually have the Giants game or Warriors game on which is a plus.
author: K C.

description:
I yelped and bookmarked this sushi restaurant as it was near Golden Gate Park and the 16th Ave Tiled Steps Project that we visited that day.  I knew we'd be famished after a long day, so I made dinner reservations for a group of 7 adults and 2 kids.  The restaurant is casual and great for families.  The staff is quite friendly and accommodating.  We started with free edamame and tea.  We ordered the combo plate of sushi/rolls for 5-6 ppl ($76) and the sashimi combo with 60 pcs ($70).  I ordered a chicken teriyaki bento box for the kids to share $12.95, which included miso soup, salad, and ice cream.  The 3 items I chose for the bento box were veggie tempura, chicken teriyaki, and 4 pc california rolls.  Plenty of food for 2 kids and a mom that eats leftovers:)  In addition to the above, we ordered a few more sushi items.  But we were pretty well-fed with the 2 combo platters ordered.  

The owner or manager was kind enough to give us all ice cream when it came time for the kids to have theirs, which came with the bento box.  That was a very kind gesture of this man.  I wish I asked his name and if he was the owner.  He's caucasian and was sitting with someone who must've been a regular, because the patron shared his beer with him and they toasted glasses.  We chose the green tea ice cream, which was delicious, by the way.  And one of our guests brought some cookies from Anthony's, which made the dessert even more decadent!  What a great meal!

The fish itself was very fresh tasting, the pieces were more than generous in size, and everyone agreed that that was "the best sushi ever".  This will be one of our first stops the next time we're in SF. Street parking wasn't terrible on a weekday for our 7 pm reservation.

Thank you, Yelp!
author: Marylan S.

description:
Ultra friendly! 1 star
Very close to where my gf live! 1 star
Yummy seabass! 1 star
Cool interior! They got 2 table sitting on tatami mat.. which I adore so much! 1 star
FRIENDLY!! 1 star .. I did say that in the begining.. but I don't care HA!

Even though me and gf only order to go, the lady that work there over us water or hot tea while waiting. Since we're not really that thirsty, we politely declined. But still, to go that far just for a take out order? Now that called LOVE.

Next time I'm in SF, I will definitely pay a visit to this friendly restaurant.
author: Yohann S.

description:
Good sushi place!  It's smack dab in the middle of a bunch of houses.  It's open late on Friday and Saturdays to 11 p.m.  They charge 50 cents for take-out.  

My friends and I sat down and were greeted with edamame and tea right away.  I ordered light - spicy tuna and shrimp tempura udon.  The other sushi, especially the spider roll (soft shell crab) were absolutely beautiful!  It's definitely not a cheap roll -$13.95.  The udon was good but was looking for a little pizzazz in it -_-.  

The service was good, attentive, to our needs and the prices were relatively reasonable!
author: Jen S.

description: this place has a pretty good assortment of sushi and the prices aren't bad.. i love their cherry blossom roll the best. we also had the spicy tuna roll and the catapillar roll.. both were pretty good. i never had to wait for a table here. parking was pretty easy because it was at the lower part of sunset, there aren't any other stores around.
author: Belinda C.

description: My husband, 1 year old and I went for lunch last Saturday, and was so impressed by the quality of food, prices, and service. Our waitress & waiter were so kind and understanding to our baby. In fact the kind waiter brought over some tofu for her. It was just all around great experience. This is our new go-to neighborhood restaurant :)
author: Winnie L.

description: They have great service and amazing food! I highly recommend this restaurant, and have heard of people driving from far to go to this Japanese restaurant because of the high quality food and nice atmosphere. Every single time I've been here, my food and the food of those with me has been amazing.
author: Emma N.

description: A recent discovery, all thanks to YELP of course.  Upon entering, I did not know what to expect.  However, depending on what you are ordering it's a hit or miss.  But I did have some delicious sake nigiri and that is why it is rated at four stars.  A generous portion and fresh.  I am in loveee! Despite the fact that they can not make a decent ramen(just don't waste your $$ on this) is beyond me.  Service is a hit or miss too.  Parking is a bit difficult since it is near residential area.
author: Ann L.

description: I think their bento boxes are mediocre.  Teriyaki beef tastes like korean bbq because it's very thinly sliced.  It was quite good though. Tonkatsu was bland even with the sauce. I've had better sushi in sunset, such as Okazuya sushi and Sushi Zen on Taraval.   I will revisit this place and will update.
author: Jessica N.

description: I can't even think of a good enough opening line for how perfect this place is. This was the first place we ever had sushi when we first moved to the city and having eaten at many other sushi spots in the city, still find ourselves returning here for the amazing sashimi and extra tall (and extremely cheap!) glasses of cold saki. One of the only places in San Francisco that actually caters to those of us living with a champagne taste on a beer budget.
author: Nico A.

description:
This place is awesome! My boyfriend and I were craving Sushi and we wanted something near our house. We were blown away about how good and cheep it was! 
They have a fish (not sure the type) roll with some lemon in it and it was to die for!! Their udon is also really fresh and flavorful! Now pretty much anytime we want some Japanese food we head on over to Tazaki!
author: Thea M.

description:
Generous portions (rolls and sizzling plates), reasonable prices, easy to find parking (considering it's in the Sunset), attentive waitstaff, and complimentary ice cream at the end of your meal? 

Yes, please!
author: Jenny L.

description:
Walking in half sober, and hung over from a brunch at LIME, I found a seat in what looks to be a deserted restaurant. After looking at the menu I sensed some sort of CAL theme weaving through the restaurant, which is cool except for the fact that... we're not in berkeley, calm down bears. 

The service was great, they were attentive, fast, and friendly. Part of it might be because of the lack of patrons, but me and my hung over self really appreciated it.

They have menus where you can mark the quantity and the type of sushi you want, which lessens the hustle and bustle when it comes to ordering (love it). Tazaki has a fairly generous size selection of sushi and traditional japanese(american) dishes.

Sushi was fresh and delicious! Will definitely be back sometime in the future with my sober self instead.
author: Alex C.

description: There's not too many sushi rests in the area that is decent for quality of food, price and service. They have excellent service, always giving us miso soup & salad right when we sit down, oh and edamme! We usually order the Chef's special sashimi 36 pcs. Their fish is always so fresh!
author: Alyce l.

description: Anyone who rated this place below 5 stars must not have ordered the Midnight Express Roll or the PUMPKIN ROLL! These are 2 must-haves when you go here, no exceptions (unless you're allergic to fish... I guess that'd be a legitimate exception). Don't be fooled by the word pumpkin because there's actually no pumpkin in the roll. This place offers quality sushi at awesome prices in a chill ambiance.
author: Nancy L.

description:
I'm surprised I've been living in the Sunset for over a year and I only went there for the first time tonight.  The food there is pretty good, and it reminds me of Taraval Okazu Ya (T.O.Y).  The menu even looks similar.  There are a few differences though.  For one thing, they gave us a free edamame appetizer when we sat down, which is nice.  Also, the dinner combos are only $9.95 rather than $11.95, so it's a bit cheaper than Taraval Okazu Ya too.  I got the Tempura/Sashimi/Chicken Teriyaki combo, and it was pretty good, comparable to T.O.Y.  The sashimi was tuna and it tasted very fresh, I'd say that it's better than the tuna at T.O.Y.  The tempura was alright, comparable to T.O.Y.  The chicken teriyaki was very flavorable, although it was a bit dry.  I'd say that T.O.Y's chicken was better because it was more moist, but all in all, the flavor of the chicken here made up for that.

I would come here a lot more often if I lived closer to it, but because the food is so similar to T.O.Y's, I have a feeling that I'm gonna end up going to T.O.Y. (because it's 2 blocks from my apt).  But this place is definitely cheaper, so I think it's a great value for Japanese food if you live in the area.
author: Tyler C.

description: Tazaki Sushi has gotten better over the years!  Great service - fantastic food.  Get there early or else you'll be waiting in lines.  Their sushi quality is outstanding and fresh.
author: G. W.

description: 3 stars because it's close by home, it's good, the service is fast, and the staff is friendly.  Nothing is exceptionally good and their decor looks more like a cafeteria rather than a sushi restaurant.  I like the decor at the Taraval location much more but the food is about the same.
author: Rosalind S.

description:
Japanese food is my favorite. Spent my Sunday afternoon here with a large group of family friends (we pretty much took over the place).

My side of the table ordered family style, so I got to try a nice variety. Specialty sushi rolls, chicken karaage, gyoza, sizzling sea bass, filet mignon (special order), fried squid--it was all very tasty. I heard the chicken teriyaki is delicious too. I couldn't stop eating even after I was full. Too bad they were out of green tea ice cream though.

The service was also spectacular and so friendly. We had lots of noisy kids and ordered nonstop, yet they were able to handle everything very well.

Definitely try this place out if you're in the neighborhood!
author: Stephanie F.

description:
This place is great.  A little more expensive than my favorite sushi place in the Sunset, but it is 35 blocks closer to me.  I was unsure of what to expect and figured that it would be expensive judging by the street view.
However, the prices were very reasonable and the sushi was great.  2 Miso soup and 6 rolls only set us back about $30.  Not too bad considering that feeds 2 people.
By far the best sushi place in the Outer Sunset I have gone to.  The people there are nice and very friendly.  Also, if you get an order to go, they give you a very healthy amount of Wasabi, which I love more than almost anything.
In my opinion, the Lily Maki is the best I have ever had.
author: Shawn B.

description: Great place. .. fresh foods...very close to our place...love their uni.
author: Ben B.

description:
UPDATE: Well, after living in The Sunset over a year now and regularly stopping in at Tazaki Sushi...I feel I can offer this update to my earlier review. 

Still the same!! Maybe even better by a couple of hairs. 

As the majority of diners who have submitted reviews for Tazaki, I concur with all. Tazaki does focus on freshness. I'm am thoroughly happy everytime I go here to dine. I always looks forward to some fresh fish and veggies everytime. 

I do want to point out their prices are also as attractive as their dishes. 

You will not go wrong eating here.
author: Wayne B.

description:
sushi - good, seems fresh and decent portions

cooked fish - VERY small portions and too many sprouts

waitress seemed a little out of it

service was SLOW

table was wobbly
author: snausage s.

description: I keep coming back here, and bringing everyone I know. Everything is just really good for the price, you know? The pieces of fish on top of each piece of nigiri sushi is just really huge and delicious. The owners are just really nice and friendly and if you want to chat with them, they will be happy to oblige. This is my favorite from all of the okazu-ya family of restaurants. My family loves coming here and if they aren't too busy, they always give my son some little treats. I really appreciate that about a neighborhood restaurant, and even though I live further away now, I'll keep coming back here for my sushi.
author: Dom L.

description:
Perhaps I'm odd, even though I was raised in a Japanese household, I rarely crave sushi.  I think it's because it seems overly expensive to pay for something you grew up with and mainly when I do have it, I don't feel it's worth the extra pennies.

This is where Tazaki Sushi come into the picture...

One night, my friend wanted to have sushi for dinner. I found this place on Yelp that had overall good reviews and conveniently located along the N-Judah transit line. I enjoyed this place a lot, twice in one week too!

* Good, FRESH fish

* CHEAP and portions are GREAT

* Broad menu of various sushi (we liked the special pumpkin-crab one), bento boxes (combos), appetizers, udon, rice bowls, and sizzling fish dishes (these are listed on the wipe board when you enter)

* Variety of seating - sushi bar, traditional tables & chairs, and a Japanese-style area where you can sit on your knees on a mat. There is a low table to eat off of (warning: if you sit here, don't get up too quickly since your legs may fall asleep).

* This place fills you up so you don't feel like eating a burger after.  Thank goodness, since there aren't many burger joints nearby.

*  This place does a body + wallet good, and in a tiny way, I feel like I'm getting in touch with my roots.
author: Cathy K.

description: Creamy roll and 49er roll were unique and delicious. The sizzling plates looked heavenly. The servers were helpful and made sure our beverages were topped off. This is a popular spot so don't be in a hurry, it's worth waiting for!
author: Steph C.

description:
Came here with a group of old friends for a reunion dinner. As soon as we entered the door, we were promptly seated at our reserved table and immediately given menus, hot tea, and delicious edamame! I was already impressed in the first 5 minutes I was in the restaurant. The rest of our party was running late, so the few of us that were already there kept snacking away on the edamame. We would've been starving without it!

All of us either ordered sushi and rolls, but I got the donburi bowl. It was good just I wished the breading actually stuck to the meat for my katsu... The chicken/pork (I forget which one I ordered) was a little tough to chew so that made it a little less enjoyable :\ but other than that, the flavors were still good. The word on the sushi is that it tasted delicious and fresh! I'll definitely be ordering that the next time I visit.
author: Michelle Y.

description:
2.5 stars

I definitely had better sushi.  Rolls were unimpressive and not that tasty.  Sashimi tasted frozen and watered down the natural flavors of each piece of fish.  Wasabi was a joke and did nothing for us.

I guess if you live in the area this is a go to place for sushi for convenience.  If that's the case, get their bento boxes.  It's worth because it.  Comes with miso, salad and icecream.  Stick with green tea.  They offer coconut but it's really some weird version of pina colada.  

Service was excellent tho.  Nothing to complain there.  Tea was never left unfilled.
author: sherry t.

description:
I live in the outer sunset and am so happy to have a good sushi place only a few blocks from home. Great service, reasonable prices (2 people can easily eat and get some drinks for under $40, which is great for sushi), they always have the giants or 9ers playing on game day, and good, fresh food. What more could you ask for? 
My only complaint (and it's easy to fix) is that they put tobiko (those little orange fish eggs) on every roll and I am really not a fan. The only reason I even mention this is because the menu doesn't and so if you don't like tobiko, make sure you specify that because otherwise you will be unpleasantly surprised by it. Everything else is great. 
An outer sunset gem. We really need more awesome and varied restaurants like this out here.
author: Christina M.

description: I only take the time to review businesses if they are amazing, or terrible. Tazaki Sushi is amazing! The sushi is consisted of the most delicious portions of perfect, fresh fish, the service is incredible, every want attended to. This place is outer sunset's best kept secret, though the secret is out because this place is always bustling! The prices are very competitive, hot tea and edamame are served upon seating. Their miso soup and seaweed salad are fresh and delicious; their meat and tempura plates are incredible options if a member of your party doesn't like sushi. I can't reccomend this place enough!
author: Mo M.

description: Golden-needle in haystack.  5 star sushi.  2 star accommodations (which makes it cagey & cool).  Big fan..
author: Blake P.

description: I just had a lunch with my friend there recently. The food is average. We ordered 2 lunch combos, but how come we didn't have the free green tea ice cream???? I have been there two times, I never ever  had ice cream for my combo......
author: Wendy W.

description:
I live close to this sushi joint, so I knew when they were returning from their vacation and we headed over when they got back.  This is one of those places where they know their neighbors and everyone is treated like family.  They even gave us little holiday gifts, which was very cool of them.

This is a sushi place, so let's talk fish!  The portions on the nigiri were generous; long and thick slices of very fresh fish.  While we placed a large order of both nigiri and maki, they staggered delivery, so that we had sushi arriving throughout our meal.  Presentation on the nigiri was a little above average, and presentation on the maki was above average.  Some of the maki was really good, but a few items weren't spectacular.  Oddly enough, my girlfriend and I were hot and cold on different types of maki here, so your mileage may vary.  Overall, we were impressed with the quality of the fish.

When you consider the free edamame, the anniversary discount, the holiday gift, and the high quality of service, we were happy that we decided to walk over.

SUMMARY: Fresh fish, clean restaurant, good, friendly service, and walking distance from our house -- you can consider us regulars here.
author: Jon M.

description: nah, we were just hungry.  convenient and on the way home.  nothing was good, everything was just edible.  we were full so I'm happy I guess.  oh, karaage had some nice sweet notes but over done.  coming back...nah...
author: Kevin L.

description:
What more can I say about this place? First of all, it is convenient drive after work for me. 

The meal was definitely a blast. I highly recommend the Sashimi combo. This includes a small bowl of salad, large plate of sashimi, miso soup, and a bowl of ice cream. Not only the combo was delicious but it is very cheap for what I had. The sushi is much bigger than what is served in other Japanese restaurants. 

I definitely give props to the owner of the restaurant, as well as the staff for treating me with very nice hospitality. I will definitely come back and try some other sushi or combo.  

And of course, you can have a chat with any of the staff members, but there is no need to flirt with them. That is just a little warning just in case you cannot help but stare at them.
author: A S.

description: I went there with my friends last night,excellent sushi and the service is very attentive and friendly.  Love they snow Fuji roll.
author: Aidan C.

description: so glad to be neighborhood of this place, small place but homey and it just perfect food and prices for a family dinner.. something just a dinner, not too fancy but still good..I always get the Sunset Maki( Uni and tobiko) roll everytime visit, fresh sashimi, good appetizer. good and very polite service .
author: Angie L.

description:
Exceptionally fresh sushi, generous portions of fish, and delicious rolls.  Add that to a genuinely friendly owner, and what more could you want from a family sushi joint?  I love this place.

I found this restaurant when in dire need of a sushi fix at lunch one day.  After swearing off all the Inner Sunset regulars (including Ten [meh]; Ebisu [horrid service, too pricey]; You See Sushi [shudder!]), I had to expand my search radius.  Yeah, it's a trek out to 40-something Ave. but it's worth it.

Yum!
author: Kelly C.

description: The best place ever!!!! Tazaki and Jon are best people! I been coming to this restourant for past 15 years! Love the place!!!
author: Max Y.

description: A local spot for us, we love hanging out with Tazaki and John. They were among the first to welcome us to the Sunset neighborhood. Good bento boxes and really enjoy their tempura udon and mackerel (Saba). Simple but delicious. And we never turn down the ice cream for desert!
author: Squeaks L.

description: This place is my top 3 go to's for some delicious sushi, great company, and service. The staff is great they are always so nice. Sometimes the food takes a bit longer than usual, but then again they are 95% busy all the time. The sushi is fresh and delicious! Great little hole in the wall.
author: Julia L.

description:
I had the the Beef Don Donburi today! It was delicious! The quality of the food was amazing! The rice was perfectly cooked, the meat was juicy and tender, and the egg was nicely cooked over the rice and meat. The service was excellent too! 

Definitely come and eat at this restaurant!
author: Gabriel C.

description:
After surfing with the fishies out off Judah, I was ready to eat one.

Again, yelp app and found this place.  A few rounds of Sashimi and Tempura later- definitely impressed!

Slices of sashimi were ICE cold- just the way i love it.  

Perfect mellow lunch place, great prices!
author: Gabrielle J.

description: The only thing I hate more than being treated like an idiot is being lied to. I sat down here and asked if they have beer from Japan. They tried to sell me some Asahi shit from Canada. I explained that I didn't want Canadian beer with Japanese label but actually wanted Japanese beer. The guy behind the counter said it's not possible to get Japanese beer, they're all made in Canada. I understand that, yes, most of the mass market Japanese beer is made in Canada, his statement is false. There are lots of Japanese beers available in the US, though they might be harder to find. Oyaji and Kiss Seafood and Tataki all serve beer that actually comes from Japan. I ended up leaving this place because I couldn't imagine enjoying a meal that started this way. Sad.
author: Eater S.

description:
"Meh. I've experienced better" is right.

My moms really likes the soft shell crab here so we decided to come try it out. We rolled in on a Sunday night around 7pm. We dropped off my mom, with my niece, and I went with my sister to find parking. I felt like we were in the Richmond District because all the avenue parking spots were super small! We finally found a parking spot about two blocks away.

As we got closer to the restaurant, I was like "wow this place is pretty crowded!" to my sister. Then she replied, "The place we're eating at is next door." Well, I guess the restaurant Pisces is doing pretty good.

We finally get to our restaurant and had no problem finding my moms table... and I mean that in a bad way. The place is decently sized. It probably has like 8-10 tables and a sushi bar. Besides us, there were only three other people eating here. Notice, I didn't say three parties... I mean three people.

The waitress was top notch... in keeping my tea cup full. The Caucasian server guy was kinda weird as he was just in regular street clothes. I figured he was the owner or something. The Sushi chef seemed pretty cool. It was a little weird because twice they brought us food that didn't belong to us. Imagine how crazy it would of been if the place was packed! It cracked me up when the Sushi chef guy would tell the Caucasian server guy what the dish was when he brought it over to us. The menu was decent sized. I wasn't really impressed with the overall selection but it had the normal Japanese restaurant fare. 

We ended up ordering some plain Udon for the baby and about 8 rolls of sushi for the adults. I guess my mom was right because the soft shell crab roll was the best thing we tasted. The other rolls we had were OK... Definitely nothing to right home about. The fish didn't seem that fresh... but with only 7-8 patrons on a Sunday night, how fresh could I expect the fish to be?

The bill ended up to be around $80... which was kind of steep for what we got. I think I could of taken that $80 and gotten some better and fresher fish at another Japanese restaurant. Oh well. Lesson learned.

Would I come back? Maybe... Well only for the soft shell crab.
author: Leo C.

description:
I can't give a zero star? 

Ugh. I am sitting here on my couch writing this review with a hot water bottle on my stomach because I ate here two days ago. 

Two words: food poisoning.

I had their crazy maki - yellow tail over eel roll. The eel tasted worse than the supermarket frozen eel I can get at Sunset Super and the hamachi was sliced way too thinly. I also got the Tonkatsu dinner set. The Tonkatsu seemed okay, however, it did not come with sauce. Instead, there is already a bottle on the table of market bought sauce. At least pretend you made it or something. Not only that, but the katsu sauce was awful! I've never had sauce that strange.

There are also no descriptions of the dinner sets, which is why my egg-hating friend ended up with a raw egg on her chicken sukiyaki. When we asked what one item was, the guy who seemed to be the proprietor had to ask another waitress what it was. WAH???? o.0

I hope this awful feeling will pass as you will pass this place up if you ever cross its path. *shudder*
author: Melissa C.

description: My favorite Sushi place in San Fran. Unpretentious, cheap, generous and fresh!
author: Stéphanie S.

description:
We love going to this place to celebrate our big birthday dinners since they always accommodate our group of 20+ people without any problems. The restaurant is not huge, but they always reserve the tables for us with signs on the tables saying that they are reserved.

The service is excellent and the beer and sake are always flowing.

Some of the items that I recommend are:
- Creamy Roll
- Kirin Roll
- Hamachi Kama
- Sea Bass
- Super White Tuna Sashimi (not to be confused with White Tuna)
- Raw oysters topped with Uni
author: Lester W.

description: OKay Japanese restaurant. There's a variety of sushi rolls. I had uni (had better and fresher uni else where). Not exactly the best place for sashimi. The price was consider cheap. Sadly the waitress can't explain exactly what sukiyaki is. I felt the waitress was clueless. The chef had to come over and explain it. Chef was nice!
author: Cece Y.

description: This place is exactly like the other Okazuya on Taraval and Noriega.  Taste is the same, menu is the same.  Service crew and kitchen crew are new so they will make some mistakes.  My cousin ordered a sukiyaki with the beef placed on the side.  The kitchen accidentally gave the beef to another table.  Service was pretty slow.  Half my party finished their meal while the other half just got theirs.  Overall, place is...meh.  Rather go to the Taraval one.
author: Nicholas L.

description:
My girlfriend brought me to Tazaki for their caterpillar roll. I was way too hungry to look up reviews, lets go!

Its location is quite hidden and finding parking was a challenge. It was 8pm when we walked in the door. The bar was pretty empty and there was one open table. Considering it's  a Friday night with fair weather in the outer sunset, I think its business is on the slow side. Well, that adds a star for me, no waiting.

We were seated immediately and presented menus and a sushi sheet. I'm not sure if the idea of a sushi 'scantron' came from Chinese American. I just don't recalled seeing it in any Japanese owned sushi joint. Nonetheless, I think it's good idea.

What we ordered:

- Oysters in half shell
Nice and fresh, on par with other places.

- Caterpillar roll
Perfect size! I believe sushi should be in bite size.

- Amaebi nigiri
I could totally tell it's fresh. Before I saw the heads, I was wondering what kind of shrimp was used. Then the deep fried shrimp heads were served. OMG! spot prawns. Going price is $25 to the pound in the Sunset Super Market. 10-12 heads in a pound. Do the match, over $2 each, just the basic cost. Guess what, the whole serving of a pair of nigirl with very nicely deep fired heads, $5.95!

- Sizzling sea bass
No where near the same dish from Taraval Okazu Ya. I would say, not bad but not great either.

The bill... $40 before tips. 

My opinions:
- Good tea, good complimentary soy beans, miso soup, and dessert.
- Quality food in a more than reasonable price.
- Expect so so service from a Chinese owned Japanese place.
- Thanks to my honey for bringing me to Tazaki.
- I'll come again.
author: Rio T.

description: This place is very conveniently located from where I was staying. The service was a little slow, but the food was delicious. I loved their sushi and rolls. It has a nice quiet atmosphere and overall, it seemed to be a popular restaurant. I would definitely go here again
author: Ce S.

description:
Every time I travel miles away to make sure I've found the best japanese restaurant, I wind up disappointed, because I should have stayed close to home and gone to Tazaki Sushi.

The sushi is fresh and tasty, and the tempura is always crisp outside and tender inside. Prefer their rolls with raw fish to their unagi... I'm still on the lookout for unagi with crispy edges.
author: Erin W.

description: I love this little place. Great sushi - low key-definitely a little gem as someone else put it. I'd say the only thing that could use improvement would be atmosphere, but at the same time I like that it's not a fancy pants dining experience. Staff is super friendly and the fish is fresh. I'll be back again and again!
author: Melyss S.

description:
Up date!
This place also calls:
Judah Okazu-Ya!

I am not rich.
I am a cheap dirty old J-man. 
So,
I like cheap sushi.

This place is cheap.
Very very cheap.
I got very excited when I saw the price on the menu.
Maybe because location.
Out of nowhere on Judah near ocean beach.
I saw 2 guys at the sushi counter.
One Chinese guy and the other guy looks like Japanese.
Korean maybe?
I don't know and I don't care anymore.
I ordered 6- kind of nigiris, 2 each.
Nice big size and has dimples and all.
Under $20.- !
Yah! 
That's right. 
Under $20.- for 12 Nigiris Man!
But,
No flavor.
I know it sounds funny for raw fish but no flavor, period.
Something is missing in this place.
Rice? old fish? flat wasabi?
Something is not right.
Experience?
Made me puke for Saba and Ika.
I don't know exact what's missing and what's wrong,
But,
I do know that I would rather go to Balboa sushi house.
And I don't mind to pay a lot more at Okina or Ino.

1-tip,
Cheap place like this,
I won't order raw salmon and oyster.
Why?
Because I won't get sick.
It is a pretty serious problem in the sushi industry.
Eat cooked or smoked.
All sushi eaters should know.
author: Nobu K.

description:
this place may look like the generic, mediocre sushi restaurant, but dont let the neighborhood (outer sunset) fool u, this place is one of my fav. japanese restaurant in SF
ive been coming to this place ever since it opened back in 98,99, maybe 2000, so the owner knows me and my family, so we get hook ups from time to time...

but even if ure a new comer, this place hooks it up, the portion is huge compared to other sushi place
their MATSU SUSHI COMBO ($40 plus tax) has
4 pieces of salmon sushi
4 pieces of unagi sushi
4 pieces of yellow tail
4 pieces of tuna
3 huge rolls (caterpillar roll, fried crab roll, and i forgot the other, each roll has like 7,8 pieces)

and were talking big pieces, and its relatively fresh as well.

i highly recommended this place, its nothing fancy, but if ure craving sushi, please do come here and check it out

4 stars
author: Michael K.

description:
Great sushi.  The special dinners are a great deal.  I love me some salmon nigiri.  I know, I know, white girl special, but the salmon always melts in your mouth!  The eel is always perfectly done--firm and not drowning under too much sauce.  It's a little pricey, but you get what you pay for.

One busy night the waiter forgot about us for about 30 minutes, and the manager noticed, apologized, and brought us free sake to make up for it...all this without us even having to complain or say anything!
author: Jen D.

description: It was my daughter birthday so I went there to get sushi for her , but I could believe  it , the rice was so over cook and wet it taste like mash potato  the rice is the basic of sushi !!!!
author: C L.

description:
Magically Delicious!

Coming from the Midwest my sushi standards are probably a little sub-par for the Bay area, but this was great.  The prices were good were four of us were able to get out of there around $25 a person including sake and had more food then we could finish (well, I finished everyone's food).

I will definitely be going back to introduce more little fishies to my belly.
author: Dave K.

description:
Update 9/9/08- Not sure what's going on there...but at 6:30pm we were the only people there. Instead of getting more service...we got less. They were actually busy doing some sort of scratch-offs..!!! So yah,like they were busy!   Food still fresh and yummy,but I was put-off by the attitude.
49er roll still do it for me,though...
author: Nan H.

description:
This is a pretty good, no fuss Japanese restaurant.

The food is good - the service is great and the prices are reasonable. It has a very neighborhoody feel to it.

The entrees are a good value. They come with ice cream (mango or green tea), miso soup, salad, rice and edamame.

I had veggie tempura - the tempura sauce was yummy - the veggies (broccoli, sweet potato and eggplant) were average.

The salmon is really good - the sizzling fish plate is perfectly comes on a bed of veggies - mostly sprouts and a delicious soy based sauce. The teriyaki salmon is really good as well - the sauce is finger-licking good. I don't like that they serve the salmon with the skin though- yuck.

The California rolls are really good - they are made with real crab so they have a nice creamy consistency.
author: Chili B.

description:
It's my neighborhood Japanese restaurant, and I like it that way. Solid food, no surprises, family run joint. It's the equivalent of an old school coffee shop/diner with loads of comfort foods. Can the fish be fresher? Sure. Fish can ALWAYS be fresher. Seriously, they would need to grab a live one and filet it in front of you to be really fresh. But that's not what you come here for. You come because you live nearby and you are craving some soba noodles or oyako don, or a few nigiri, from somewhere unpretentious and laidback.

In addition to the small main dining room and sushi bar area, there's a raised section with the low tables and you sit there sans shoes. Little kids love it. In fact, little kids are very welcomed here. 

Worth a visit if you live nearby and want to add to your Outer Sunset restaurant list.
author: amy p.

description:
YUM.  

I'm hesitant to write a review because I kind of like the outer sunset being a big foggy secret.  But I love this place, and the fact that there's a great sushi place I can walk to in the "burbs" of the city makes me a happy girl.  

Tazaki is a classic divey hole in the wall with great sushi.  Not much ambiance, no frills, just really fresh deliciousness.  The salmon is the best I've ever had.  And if you order the whole dinner deal, you get lots of sashimi, salad, miso soup, tea and ice cream.  It's an amazing deal for $12 or so.  

If you happen to be out here in the fog and cold, it's definitely worth stopping here!
author: mona r.

description: I love this place! The service is great, the food is awesome and reasonable, and I confidently bring picky eaters here because I know they'll be taken care of.
author: Fiona F.

description:
This is my brother's favorite Japanese restaurant to frequent. He comes here so often they hook up the Salmon Sashimi. And I mean hook up .. there's so much extra I got full before I finished half the plate. 

Came here for dinner with a couple of friends and my brother and it was rather nice. They ordered the Matsu Sushi Combo for $40 and let me tell you it feed three people and still had left overs =x. I ordered #22 the Sake Sashimi with rice. It's so fresh and tender. I love Salmon Sashimi a lot .. this was worth it. Delicious.. and fresh Sashimi there always. Total came to about $93 and some cents. =)
author: Linda X.

description:
Whoever said good sushi can't be affordable has obviously not been here. 

Being that Tazaki Sushi is the local neighborhood sushi restaurant, my daughter and I frequent this establishment fairly often.  She especially enjoys the small section of the restaurant where the seating is more traditional (shoes come off and you sit old fashioned on the elevated floor.)  It's definitely kid friendly.  It's a family run business, they are very welcoming and friendly. 

The prices are low and the portions are of a good size.  

I recommend the Eclipse (tuna, black caviar, tobiko, quail egg)...VERY tasty!  or the Midnight Express.  The Creamy Roll is also high on my list.
author: Sara N.

description: "Okazu" means "side dishes".  I expected them to have decent Japanese at home side dishes, but they didn't.  Fried oysters I ordered was $6.99 for 6 pieces, but each piece was as big as the first section of my thumb.  Fish on the sushi was not bad, but rolls were so small.  I appreciated the fact the manager took off the price of fried oyster because the waitress forgot our first order.
author: Helen N.

description:
This is one of the favorites of my family. 

The sushi is okay here...I've had better. The main reason why I love this place is their grilled fish on the platter! The sea bass here is extraordinary! I've also had the butter fish...which is pretty good as well. 

If I'm not feeling fishy, my backup meal is the chicken karaage. It is pretty jammin! 

The owners are very nice here. Also have a big tv to watch sports games. That's always a plus for me. You might have to park a block away...which is not a long walk. It's just really painful when it's a freezing cold night in the Sunset.
author: Allan M.

description: I love this place.  They make the best sushi in town.  When I have out of town guests, I always take them there.  All my family loves it and we eat there regularly.
author: Lana K.

description: The sashimi weren't fresh but the miso soup was pretty good
author: Cliff T.

description:
My dad recommended this place one, so the entire family went one day.  We got to sit at their private room due to the size of our party.  Service was quite nice, we were attended to whenever requested.  They even have a cute little Japanese-style sitting area next to the front window.  If only it was more secluded, there is something about having random people walking by look at you sitting on the floor that weirds me out.

The sushi was good.  Usual rolls were up-to par with some more expensive places, their specialty rolls are not too shabby either.  

Parking is not a problem and there are no lines to wait through.  Very random location, but who cares.
author: Serge S.

description: I love Tazaki.  But I love him in more of a sashimi sort of way. He may have the best Hamachi in the city.  And I'm sure I'm biased because I live in the neighborhood, but I've eaten a lot of sushi.  On top of it, the price is very reasonable.  Everyone is super friendly there, and if you want takeout it's fast and convenient.  Sizzling anything is awesome.   Obviously seabass if you can forget about your conscience, or monk fish or scallops or whatever.  We also like the creamy roll, but I really haven't had anything bad here.
author: Dmitri H.

description:
I like Tazaki Sushi for a few reasons. It is only a few blocks from where I live, the rolls and sashimi are fresh and good, and they don't gussy everything up. It isn't the most spic and span sushi restaurant in the city, but it is clean and good. It is also appropriately priced, which is such a huge bonus. 

The other side things I like are the waitress with the stars behind her ears and the sushi master behind the counter with the glasses. He can be a little nutty.
author: Mark H.

description:
-the nigiri is better than their roll selection
-service is ok
-gets a little busy sometimes
-some sporting event is almost always shown on tv
-prices are more than reasonable
author: Rob N.

description: Good portions sizes for the money,  nothing special on the sushi, regular typical choices you'll find at a Japanese resturant. A good resturant to avoid any waits if you want to eat immediately.
author: Linh D.

description: I got the sushi sashimi over rice! I liked it, except for the ginger on the rice. Really nicely decorated too. My boyfriend got the seafood combo, but he didn't know it was soup based. He didn't like it though. This is gonna be our new joint! The bill was around $30. ($18 for sushi sashimi over rice and bf's was $12). It comes with ice cream, salad, and green tea. They forgot my salad though.. :(
author: Vivian L.

description:
Here are the top reasons why Okazuya Judah ROCKS:

--consistently fresh sushi, especially UNI
--down-to-earth environment, some might say "family style"
--VERY reasonably priced. Easy to get in and out, suchi + beer/sake for $20-30/person.
--decent service

This is regular, day-in, day-out sushi in the Outter Set and it's WAY better than the Noriega Okazuya!

BTW--parking is VERY easy out here in the Set.
author: CJ K.

description: Outer Sunset Gem.  Atmosphere is so-so which is the only reason it's not 5 stars.  Food is fantastic, and the service is consistently very good.  Get the hamachi sashimi!  I'm convinced it's the best in the city.
author: Jennifer H.

description: Love this place especially since it's in our hood.  We come here once a month to get our sashimi fix with the chef's choice for $40 which is enough to feed 2 hungry adults and leave us full.  They are always super nice, and the fish is of course totally fresh. Never had a bad meal here.  Good selection of sake.
author: Sfgpgirl G.

description: Friendly staff, but the food was bleh.  I'm pretty sure I won't be coming back.  I'm more a fan of rolls and they didn't have very many options and what they had didn't taste so great.  To be honest, i don't even remember what I got...it was forgettable.  The one thing that would get me to come back is the service, but other than that, meh. I guess it's just not my thing.
author: Romina K.

description:
Just like you should have a relationship with your fish monger and your butcher, you should know your sushi chef. Mr. Tazaki is awesome and his wife is great too. They run a smooth sailing business and everything is great! It's quaint and relatively quiet, and the prices are reasonable. The fish is alway great!
i go here at least 3 times a month.

A+

yes i know this isn't ebay...
author: Rich V.

description:
Okay, so this isn't the most amazing sushi I've ever had, but it's very good. And hey, it's only a few blocks away from me, so.... Yes I would most definitely go there again. 

As for the lack of customers.... it's Outer Sunset and is not really known for its wonderful restaurants. That's just the way it is... You have to be damn good to make people stay on the N past 19th Avenue.

But anyway, if anything is keeping this place from thriving, it is the service. It's not that the servers aren't nice, it's more like... unmotivated and not very hospitable. I feel that when I enter a restaurant, I should automatically be greeted and felt like I'm wanted there. I didn't really get that vibe at Tazaki. It's really too bad, because the food is actually good.

Let's hope there's a change in attitude soon, because that's the only reason why I subtracted stars.
author: Catherine H.

description: Great Price. Really really great price. First time I ate here it came out fishy so I'm iffy about it. But  since it's been aight
author: Ian D.

description: I have been looking for a good sushi restaurant all over sf. A friend recommend me to tazaki and so I decided to try it out. Very fresh sashimi. They have the best hamachi and super white in town. Very friendly services. Waitresses are helpful and sweet. The boss (the guy who makes cuts the sashimi I believe) seems to be funny and easy to talk to.  I also love their hamachi kama appetizer, very tasty and cheap in my opinion. I would definitely  come again :)
author: Jason H.

description: Very nice place and good food. They did all the little things right to give us a great reason to return.
author: Terry O.

description: Good food, good service, and a great variety of beers. This is my favorite sushi restaurant in the city and I have eaten at all of them. The price for the sushi rolls is really good and if you want to go real Japanese, you can sit on the floor at the sushi bar.
author: Daniel R.

description: Nice place...owner Tazaki is a cool guy who makes sure his customers are happy. Had the tonkatsu curry ...was good and portion large enough for meal the next day too! Would definitely go back!
author: Tiffany Y.

description: I dine here at least once a week! The fish is always Fresh! The steamed fish selections change according to availability! The presentations are served promptly with extra attention! (A nice napkin steam deflector) The atmosphere is upbeat and friendly! Its definitely "Heart Friendly"!! Tom Noble 9/12/2011
author: Tom N.

description:
I went here based on my roommates recommendation and I was not disappointed.  

1. I was warmly welcomed when I walked in.
2. The atmosphere was quaint, they even had the traditional seating on the floor.
3. The sushi was very fresh and I got a good recommendation from the staff.
4. The food is decently priced.
5. They were very attentive.
6.  And lastly, as I was getting ready to leave, the owners made sure that they got to know a little bit about me and introduced themselves.  I even met Betty (aka known as Ma).

This is a great place in the Sunset if you are getting the craving for Sushi.  Nothing fancy, but good, warm, and welcoming.
author: Jeanene B.

description:
This place is walking distance from where I live, so I frequent it fairly often. It's good cheap sushi, run by a Chinese family. I know what you're thinking... I'm also wary of "non authentic Japanese places" myself.

The fish is usually very fresh and they serve it in large generous slabs. Their sake nigiri (salmon) is my favorite. I've never had a richer more buttery piece of salmon! Their bento box combos are a good way to go if raw fish isn't your thing.

I've seen a few off-days in terms of fish quality, but the quality usually holds up. One time, I went on the day before Christmas Eve and had unfresh amaebi that they tried to cover up with extra wasabi. That was pretty gross. But it was my one truly negative experience, from many months of faithfully going to the place. I'm going to be sympathetic and assume that it's hard to get shipments of things right before the holidays. :)

There wasn't too much effort placed on the furnishing, but the food is very reasonably priced. The staff is friendly, but could probably be a little more attentive. Those of you who frequent Chinese run restaurants are probably used to this. (Hey -- I'm Chinese... so I can say that!)

My friend brought her 5 year old kid with us, and they gave her a free toy! I thought that was very nice of them.
author: Bekki J.

description: LOVED this place!!  Ended up here on a  Friday night when other places we planned to go to were closed.  The sushi was AMAZING!!  We had delicious rolls and chirashi was the best I have had in SF.  Cannot wait to go back!
author: Daniela O.

description: I really love this place; this is my Japanese restaurant of choice. The one thing that I must get when I come here is the Creamy roll, everything about it is delicious - the warm fried exterior of rice filled with avocado and raw spicy tuna topped with a special sauce. The "Sushi Man" greets each of the customers and always says goodbye and thanks before you leave. I can also say that their raw sushi is fresh. If I am going to pay $3 for two pieces of sushi - it better be fresh and it better be rationally sized. Tazaki Sushi does both of those things; you don't get a scrawny dry piece of fish on a giant piece of rice. I usually don't try the cooked food here but the times that I do try it, it is pretty good, especially the bento boxes.
author: Ryan L.

description:
The food here is pretty good all around. Sushi and Entrees. They have an average size selection and the workers are very friendly. I think this place is a little bit over priced. The Entree's aren't filling and the sushi is small.
Overall the food is good. You're just going to have eat x2.
author: Dao C.

description:
Yet another night feeling hungry lazy and no place in mind....Tazaki Sushi steps up the plate! Seems like every time I come here, the food' gets better and better....I'd recommend Combo Box A., which includes shrimp&veggie tempura, chicken teriyaki, tuna sashimi and the usual fixings of seaweed salad and garden salad. Fills you up and satisfies your cravings for a mere $10. Sure, the portions are a bit smaller than Taraval Okazu-Ya, but it's a bit cheaper too...so its all good. Another fave was the chicken kara-age. For lack of better words.....its helllaaaaaa good! 

The ambiance of Tazaki is relaxed, simple, and clean! There's a sushi bar, tables, and even a few tables for floor seating..cute!

Another plus is the service! The waiters are extremely nice and quick...my tea cup was never empty. The best part...because its in such a random location of Judah and 39th ave, you get the Okazu-ya tastes without the over-hyped, over-crowded, over-crappy service at Taraval Okazu-ya. Next time I feel like a ComboBox A, I'm gonna head down the block to Tazaki instead of waiting an hour and a half @ Taraval.
author: Jessica h.

description: Delicious sushi! Great prices and most of all all employees always had a smile on their faces and were so attentive.  So happy they are one block away from our place.
author: Mrs. F.

description: Great place - low key and not expensive.  The staff is always friendly and the food is prepared fairly quickly.  Definitely my go-to sushi place any day of the week whether to eat in or take out.
author: Lo Z.

description:
We love this place; the staff is very friendly, the service is quick and efficient, and I cannot think of another sushi place where you get more bang for your buck without sacrificing any quality.  Ambiance?  No, but the money they saved on keeping the decor low-key translates into generous portions of very well-prepared food.  A great neighborhood place, and on our short list of we're-not-in-the-mood-to-cook local eateries.

They even gave me one of their t-shirts to wear in the Bay to Breakers last year, and I was pleased to advertise for them.  I feel a sponsorship deal coming on...
author: Brendon O.

description: This place is excellent.  I know I can get good sashimi and ramen here, the customer service is also excellent.  Try their yose nabe combo!
author: Brian T.

description:
2.5 stars.  Maybe 3.  Not sure.

This is a no frills sushi joint.  The prices are low - $2.50 for a roll, $2.00 for nigiri - and the nigiri portions are large.  Usually, the fish is fresh, especially the tuna.  But occasionally (like tonight), when I've had the hamachi, it is a day old.  You can fool me on freshness with a lot of things, just not fish.  I've got a finely trained hound's snout for that shit.

Overall, value is decent for the price.  Just be sure to ask how fresh the fish really is.

Added bonus for the free edamame.
author: mcmalaprop ..

description:
I've been going to this place since 2006 - though my first time was in 2004 before I lived in the bay area. The food here is consistently good, and the service is prompt, friendly but not overbearing.

The rolls are what you go here for. Our personal favorites are the crunchy crab and caterpillar rolls (melts in your mouth).

They have a Tatami area with two Chabudai tables for a traditional dining experience.
author: Y B.

description:
I thought I was done with eating Japanese food until I accidentally stumbled upon this place. 

The sushi here is fresh and tasty and the atmosphere, like everyone else said, is very family-like. So far, this is one of the few Japanese restaurants that I will be continuously coming back to because I haven't ordered a dish that isn't good. Service is excellent as the main lady there will serve you tea while you wait for your sushi to go.

The prices here make this place that much more attractive.
author: Henry L.

description: fresh, fast, fair priced. I enjoyed the mixed sashimi plate
author: Chris M.

description: I have only been for lunch,  but we are pleased with this sushi restaurant. Great fish, great food, AWESOME service. Very kid-friendly, at least for lunch!
author: Beth W.

description:
This is a really nice sushi spot. The sushi is fresh and very delicious. Their bento boxes are great!  I usually get the tonkatsu and chicken teriyaki. Their salad is fresh and I love their dressing.

Very affordable prices. Not too expensive like the other overrated sushi places in SF.

The owner is super super friendly and accommodating. Always a great dining experience when I come here.
author: upper d.

description:
Creamy Roll is a creamy delight.  Specials are wonderfully priced and not only for the special.  I could recommend the hot tea, but that will be sitting on the table mere seconds after your butt hits the seat whether you like it or not.

So just go here, sip your tea, and slurp down your abnormally large nigiri!
author: Jacob H.

description:
