I will never go here again, and encourage you not to either.

First time the sushi was ok, the service not so good.

But because it is so close to our house we decided to give it a second try on Valentines Day, because we were both getting off of work late. I called to get a reservation for 9pm and the man on the phone said don't worry about the reservation and to come on in. 

We arrive at 9:15 and are greeted by a young girl waving her hands at us saying "no more", although there website and the menu on the door  both say they are open til 10pm. We point out it is only 9:15 and receive blank stares back.

Refusing to serve a couple that walks in at 9:15 when you advertise being open til 10 is a bad way to get business, and on top of it all it was Valentines Day and my girl and I had to come up with a plan b for dinner.

They will never get another penny from me...
author: Ryan M.

description: This is the go-to sushi joint in the Outer Sunset. The sushi is good and the prices are cheap. Love, love the sizzling fish platters.  Now, you can't expect anything wild or a long list of crazy rolls... This place has simple, yummy Japanese food. And, it must be said, the lone Caucasian that works there is such a kind and attentive server. He makes dinner extra special.
author: Marie Y.

description:
this place REAKS! how in the world did it get a 4 story overall review? i dont know, maybe it was just me and my tastebuds but apparently, this place was NOT worth whatever i paid for. 

atmosphere is clean and nice, typical classy japanese place. +1 star

their service and attentiveness..= eh not completely failed but almost.  the caucasian waiter was weird considering he looked like he didnt even work there, he had a hat on and normal clothes. i found that awkward but he didnt bother me so whatever.  one of the snobby ladies that i think was the owner took our order down and was quite rude about my friend (might i mention we were on a massive budget) that wasnt hungry but just wanted ice cream..and when she said just ice cream the snob-fob gave us thee most unpleasant face as if she just smelled sh** cause all she wanted was icecream. im sorry we didnt order what you expected, a $20 dollar meal. 

the food took about 30 minutes long to come out, RIDICULOUS timing imo. they didnt even give us all our foods all at one time making my friend wait for me to get mines which took forever.  awkkkwarrd.. i got my beef teriyaki...DEF not good, not legit tasting..and neither was their salad dressing. it was overpowered by ginger.. NASTY. that was a waste. And they were SOOO stingy on the rice.  they BARELY gave me a whole bowl of rice. stinge-binges. However, my friend said they were pretty giving and not greedy on the sashimi, which i guess adds +1 star.  other than that, this place is probably def not worth a go to spot again.  
oh, and how could i forget, they tried to gyp me of my ice cream that was part of my "bento" box.. and then tried to play it off. shame. -1 star. 

After our meal, they had to have seen us completely finished with our meal sitting right in front of them with nothin left on our table but our dirty napkins,.. its a hint to give us our bill...ugh must we flag you down every 10 seconds when things are obvious. another por ejemplo: to refill or fill (like water) 

overall this place was a Meh. i've experienced WAY better.
author: Em C.

description: This is one of my go to sushi places. I was craving sushi today purposely jumped off the N Judah to come here to grab a filler to go before I went off drinking. Ordered the Tazaki Special maki roll, really good! Then started eating the 10 dollar rainbow roll, uhh something is wrong, something is tasting VERY fishy! gag! I was on the bus scarfing my sushi down and almost barfed the weird tasting pieces back up. OK maybe it was just an off day and they gave me bad fish?? I never had bad fish from them before. Well dumped the rest of it boohoo. Minus 1 star for this bad incident, but good news few hours later now and still no squirts, ok TMI. I will still go back but if it happens again y'all will hear about it.
author: Karen T.

description: Friendly service. They could pack the tables closer like other places, appreciate there was distance betwen us and other customers (they were busy).  Ramen was tasty, good choices as far as bento combos and that 'creamy roll' was good. I would definitely come back, thanks for helping find this place Yelp.
author: Aaron S.

description: This place is great. We went there during Super Bowl weekend. It is small but the food is fresh and very affordable. The portions are also very generous. Service is quick and no fuss.
author: Wendy S.

description: It is a great family own Sushi restaurant. People are very friendly, my tea are check and fill every 10 Mins. The Chef behind the counter offer me sushi to try and did not charge me for it. I told him parking is not easy here and he offer me to park at the red zone or drive way cross the street next time we come in. The best part is the Sushi taste fresh and they give you a big slice of it. It do recommend this restaurant if you are in the area.
author: Patrick K.

description:
I had the California roll, unagi roll, and chicken sukiyaki

Pros:  Prices are very reasonable!  The broth was very flavorful.  Generous amounts of chicken (unfortunately, dark meat).  Meals were served with soup, salad, and ice cream!

Cons: The rolls were small and didn't taste very fresh.  The salad dressing was far too creamy

Great value but not particularly impressed
author: Sarah L.

description:
if you're hella broke like i am, then this is the place for you! oh wait, i just remembered! cheap sushi usually means low quality fish. but then again, Rumble Fish has cheap sushi but they have very high quality fish. but i digress. so if i were you, i would just stick to ordering their cooked foods (at this place).

i ordered 2 rolls (my usual-hamachi negi and ume shiso) and my boyfriend ordered 3 other rolls. i didnt realize he ordered so many. i wanted to try more of their cooked food. i really wanted to try their "sizzling" fish. it looked and smelled really good.

we also ordered hamachi kama (they hooked us up with a fat ass piece), karaage (i admit, it was pretty tasty), and some nigiri. i just have to say their cooked food tasted 100 times better than their sushi. 

when my ume shiso  came out, i was surprised they used real ume instead of ume paste. thats the first time i've had real ume at a restaurant. other places i've been to usually use ume paste. their ume was good but i wasnt a big fan of the rice.

i'm giving them an extra star because the owner/manager guy was really really nice. and i love how their prices are dirt cheap. next time i come here, i'm just gonna order off their special menu.
author: B B.

description: They need more roll selection. What they have is very traditional and is very high quality but something more exquisite would be a wonderful addition to their menu.
author: B K.

description: Nice size restaurant with tables, a bar, and traditional Japanese low table section.  Family run, and everyone is always nice and catering to all your needs -- super nice, actually!  Dinner time is usually busier than lunch, so I prefer to come here with a book around 2PM and eat my Nigiri in peace.  The fish has always seemed super fresh to me, prepared quickly and carefully, you get large portions, and it's relatively cheap.  There's even a free portion of Edamame for dinner (and sometimes lunch).  I'm not pretentious enough to know what a sushi place needs to be like -- all I know, is that I go here about once a week, and I'm always satisfied.
author: Vicky B.

description:
Allow me to preempt this review with a disclaimer:

If you want a fancy-pants dress-up sushi restaurant to take your mistress then this place is not for you.

However - if you want fantastic fish with expert cuts and top service - and don't mind a family atmosphere - then this place should not be missed.

I either eat here or do take-out at least a few times a month.  Best sushi find in the city.  Courteous staff, great chefs, convenient location.
author: Don N.

description: This is where we come to get our Sushi fix.  We have been eating here for the last 3 years since we moved to the area. The staff is always friendly and everything on the menu is excellent.
author: Cassandra C.

description:
After a long day of hiking, my friends and I needed food STAT.  We stumbled on this restaurant because it was the only place open that we knew how to get to.  (We were in San Fran. on vacation and our friends live in Mountain View)  Happily the food was fantastic, and the service was great, especially since we rolled in about 5 minutes before they closed after lunch service and I would not have been surprised if they told us they were no longer serving.  The place looks like a hole in the wall, but it was really a nice way to finish an afternoon. 

As a strict vegetarian, eating out can be hard for me, and sushi is often a good compromise.   I had the miso soup, inari (sweet fried tofu), and a cucumber roll.  Even after a full day of hiking, I left full and totally satisfied.  They also brought out cold edamame and green tea right when we sat down.

While I cannot fully speak to the quality of the fish, as I did not eat it, everyone in my group seemed really happy, and nothing was left on the plate.  My husband who is still new to sushi and a bit timid had the Volcano Roll (salmon and crab) and really enjoyed it.  My friends got the Rock 'n Roll with eel and avocado.  Husband didn't like that too much, but neither of us are huge fans of avocado in general.  They also all ate the Dynamite Roll, Hamachi Nigiri, and Salmon Nigiri.

I will definitely keep this place on my list of places to hit up whenever I am in San Fran.
author: Elizabeth D.

description: good food, nice people,  a little pricey though... shrimp and vegi tempura are really good along with the miso soup, beef teriyaki and of course my favorite roll, the alaska. I have been coming here consistently since I moved to the Sunset, just not that often because of the cost. Its a great and healthy meal after a hard week(s) of work.
author: Ryan K.

description:
4.5 stars, to be exact.

great food, great price. i love tazaki, it's my go-to spot for sushi cravings, and such cravings hit the bf and i pretty often. the staff is wonderful, always pleasant and making sure that cups are topped up with green tea. i always appreciate the complimentary bowl of miso soup and also edamame, which comes in a pretty good portion for it being F.O.C. me and the bf have received ice-cream on the house too on several occasions, which is pretty darn awesome. i remember the first time we got free ice-cream; the owner (i presume, he's always there, most of the time with a giants hat on) asked us what flavor we wanted as we had ordered among other things, a bento box set which comes with one serve of ice-cream, and i guess we were stalling a little between the two flavors offered, and he said he would just get us one bowl of each! on another occasion, me and the bf brought two other people here, and we got a bunch of things including two sizzling fish sets (thus two ice-creams), and we were served with four bowls at the end of our meal. much appreciated!

rolls and nigiri: i've tried most of them, and have not been disappointed thus far. fresh ingredients, wonderful flavors. most delish. just pick out whatever mix of ingredients appeal best to you, and most likely you will not be disappointed. nom on, everyone. explore the list and nom on.

sashimi: so thickly cut. juicy and fresh deliciousness. ordered the mixed sashimi once, 4 slices each of 4 types of fish. each individual fish's flavor shone through very well. i still remember how the salmon pieces melted in my mouth in a superb way even though they were not at all thinly cut. mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm.

tempura: consistently good, except for one time when i got a piece of broccoli with soggy batter. the rest of the plate was piping hot and crunchy, though. i can cheerfully overlook the isolated incident.

bento boxes: 3 choices from the list, and tummy filling indeed. i always find more than the stated 5 pieces of vegetable tempura in my bento, especially when the veggie slices are on the smaller side. the bf and i always order one bento with the cooked items - usually vegetable tempura and chicken karaage (hot and juicy, always)  - and sashimi (4 thick slices) along with various rolls, instead of getting the cooked items a la carte, as the portions are great for sharing. i personally gotta have tempura and either karaage/teriyaki items along with fresh fish and rolls when i eat japanese food, so this is a great way to taste various items instead of having too much in quantity.

sizzling fish entrees: i've had varying portions of fish; once when i had a couple of dinner guests with me, the fish pieces were smallish, which let us down a little. i've had some hearty slabs of sizzling fish too, which were fantastic. it would be best if tazaki could be more consistent here. if the fish pieces are on the smaller side, it would be great if 2-3 pieces were served o make for a fair portion. apart from that, always fresh and delicious. they have a special on 'hawaiian' fish currently, order one at full price and have the second order at half price. choose between three fish; ahi, ono, and mahi-mahi. order the ono and mahi-mahi for a great contrast in flavor and texture; one is meatier and bolder, and the other is flakier and more delicate. love taking alternating bites between the two!

appetizers: since the mains come out in good time and patrons are given soup and edamame already, i've only tried out the fried oysters and scallops a couple of times when the bf and i were super hungry. they were fried well, crunchy on the outside and beautifully hot and seafoodily fresh on the inside.

have not tried the udon, soba, or donburi though, but they look and smell good, from what i've seen on other tables!

free dinner delivery within the sunset district with a minimum cash order of $25, Tuesday to Sunday from 5pm to 10pm. i live right across the beach a couple of blocks away from Judah, and decided to call for delivery a couple of nights ago at around 9.30pm. the older lady at tazaki picked up and took my order, and was super friendly and patient with me even when i told her i'd call back in a few minutes with a trimmed down list of items as i was just rattling on a bunch of delicious things and she told me the bill was over $50. not feeling too famished, i called again with lesser items, and she was still super cheerful and told me it would take only about 25 minutes for me to get my food as they weren't busy. i called sheepishly a third time to ask for extra wasabi and pickled ginger, and the guy behind the counter who makes the sushi picks up the phone and enthusiastically said 'no problem!'. 

BAM, food arrived (delivered by nice owner guy in giants hat) in less than 25 minutes. no miso soup, but a chinese takeaway box STUFFED to the brim with complimentary edamame!! glorious.

my bf and i always tip them extra because they're stellar :)
author: Eliza D.

description: This is my favorite sushi place in the city, more than the sushi boat place in J-town or any of the high-end places downtown. The staff are japanese and speak japanese. The ambiance isn't high end,but the rolls and dishes and nigiri are excellent with service to match. Worth the trek to the sunset. If you are feeling really authentic, reserve the traditional seating.
author: Zachary H.

description: This place has great food, friendly quick service and good prices. I'm very lucky this place is so close to my house! The sushi is fresh and very tasty, my Dad always gets the bento box which always looks really good! I recently had the ahi tuna, rice, salad, soup, ice cream, Yum!!!
author: Erin V.

description: I went there for my birthday with my little brother and my friend. We sat down, filled out our order sheet, they brought out a sushi roll for my brother and set one in front of my friend. When they did that, my friend asked, "so, this is the calbear roll, right?" The employee seemed to say in reply, "Yes, this is the calbear roll". The minutes passed by and after 20-30 minutes, I asked them if they had forgotten my catipillar roll because I was still waiting for it (this waiter spoke English perfectly and so do I, so they understood me perfectly). They left to go talk to the gentleman making the sushi, then, came back with a calbear roll and set it down in front of my friend. I was like, "No, I am waiting for my catipillar roll." Then, who I am guessing is the manager comes over and argues with us about it. After another 10-15 minutes, I finally got my roll and it wasn't good. Besides the fact it was a mediocre roll, by the time I got it, I just wanted to scarf it down and get out of there. I normally prefer to sit down and relax and enjoy my meal whilst being treated with respect and kindness by the people who work at a dine-in. When we went up to pay, the managers way of "making it up to us" was by not forcing us to pay a tip like he normally does. He didn't even apologize for the inconvenience. No, sir. That did not make up for anything. I am incredibly disappointed with the service there and received attitude from not one, but two employees. Also, as a side not, the atmosphere was unremarkable. For positives, I will say the edamame, miso, and avocado roll was all good.
author: Amanda H.

description: Wow. I've never been so disappointed in my life. I went in with my mom and my mom's friend's family for my friend's 21st birthday and man it sucked. We ordered after 10-15 minutes of deciding. 2 sashimi plates, 3 bento boxes, and couple rolls. We get our food about an hour later. And in that hour 3 more tables were filled and all those people got their food before us. The sashimi was disgusting, definitely frozen, had very littel taste, and texture was gross. The terriyaki beef was not tender, dry, and had little to no taste. All the rolls were gross, the soft shell crab in one of the rolls tasted ancient. Service was bad, food was bad. Never Again.
author: Preston L.

description: I used to love this place, but I swear they have just gone down hill. Everything on the menu is pretty average, but the sashimi is increasingly dissapointing. I don't know if they changed their seafood buyer or what, but I now how to leave the Sunset when I want my sushi fix...lame.
author: Nikka B.

description: I used to frequent this place when I lived in the sunset many moons ago. I was happy to see they were still in business. It's probably under new management, but they still serve good sushi in ample portions at a reasonable price.
author: Jeremy P.

description: I have to give this place 5 star because not only do they have good sushi, they are also affortable and a walking distance from my home.  I remember there was a month where I found myself eating at tazaki for lunch and dinner! not everyday but most days of the month.  Tazaki is an awesome sushi chef! He made a special sushi and i loved it!.  I have to say i'm a regular...service is good...people are friendly...
author: Vanessa E.

description: I've been a regular customer here for a few years now. I could write all kinds of fancy stuff, but you've read it all before. Fresh, clean, the price is right, attentive service: yes. But the real stamp of approval is that I've been bringing my daughter here since she was four days old and she is demanding it at least twice a week now. She's two and she's not into California rolls and grilled eel. She eats nothing but sashimi and she'll eat everything on the menu. Anyone who knows how finicky a toddler can be, knows this is the highest compliment possible. The next best thing is a few blocks away at Ocean Beach. Bring a fishing rod.
author: Russell B.

description: I like the charming family feel and the low prices.  The sushi is decent, the gyoza and tempura is good, and the agetashitofu is tasty.  Is it going to change the way you eat sushi - no.  It is walking distance from my house, the folks who run the joint are nice, and I like their fish tank.
author: Curtis H.

description:
Wow...what's up with all the good reviews.  Am I reviewing the wrong place?  Did we all go to the same Tazaki Sushi on Judah??  Anyhow, I've driven past this restaurants many times and I never once thought of trying it, mainly because it used to be called Okazu-ya and it made me think of the Okazu-ya on Taraval and I wasn't really a fan of that  place.  But after trying it out, I think the one on Taraval is a lot better than this place.  

There were three of us and we ordered two bento boxes, half a dozen raw oysters, catepillar roll and a couple of nigiri sushi.  The oysters were fresh, but I felt like they put too much stuff on top of it, which covered the flavor of the oyster and for the tobiko nigiri, it was the flattest nigiri I've ever seen.  After finishing the oysters and sushi, we waited a long time for our bento box.  It was really busy because there was a large table right next to us, so we could understand why it took so long.  They even gave us some seaweed salad for free because our order was taking so long.

The bento box was not good.  It all just seemed very limp and unflavorful.  I actually wanted to give one star, but the service was good and they actually felt sorry that it was taking the kitchen so long to prepare the food.
author: Katniss B.

description: I love this place! I was their first customer and they know me by name.  I've tried almost everything on their menu except for the raw fish sushi. Not a big raw fish fan. I love their lunch specials - bento box with chicken teriyaki, tempura, miso soup, salad and rice. My favorite sushi is their caterpillar roll. And their udon noodles are great.
author: Fanny S.

description: This is a local place that my family love to go to.  The $40 sashimi plate is by far my favorite and that's because it has uni, sea urchin.  mmm!
author: Susana C.

description:
this is the first sushi place i've walked into with a flat screen tv on the wall broadcasting the bball playoffs.  restaurant is super clean and super friendly.  i ordered a couple of rolls and a side of seaweed salad to go and a beer to drink while i waited and apparently watched the bball playoffs.  

there were only a few tables occupied so i was a little surprised when  35 mins had rolled around and it wasn't ready, since it was a really small order.  but when it was ready, the very nice guy who took my order thanked me for waiting and all my bitchy thoughts just melted away.  

sushi was good, not great.  as another yelper said, its in my 'hood so its great it is so close but i wouldn't travel all the way out for it.

its solid.
author: Elizabeth H.

description: Awesome place! No frills, but lovely staff, great chef and AMAZING sushi! Large pieces at unbelievable prices! A must go for sushi! Go to the beach, hang out for the sunset then head to Tazaki for sushi!
author: Alexandra S.

description: My wife and I used to live in the neighborhood and come here all the time.  We'd get the Sashimi platter and they'd load us up with some of the most delicious fish we'd ever had.  The owners are great (once we stayed after the place closed and they let us watch the end of the Warriors playoff game on their huge TV) And the price is definitely right.
author: Erik J.

description:
The team at work had to work on a Sunday afternoon. Since they have been working so hard all week, I thought I would provide them with something nicer than just sandwiches, so I promised them sushi. I don't like sushi so I wouldn't know one place from another and had to rely on the yelp reviews. It seemed most of the decent places weren't open on Sundays for lunch and I randomly came across Tazaki. The owner was very nice and accommodating when I spoke to him on the phone the day before. Since I know nothing about sushi, I left it up to him to come up with platters to feed 10 people. It was a huge hit and everyone loved the sushi. A quote from my boss, "That was really really really good sushi, phenomenal!" I will definitely come to Tazaki for any future catering needs. Since I can't personally speak for the sushi, I can speak for their friendly customer service. If I ever develop a taste for sushi myself, I will definitely eat there too!

Thanks for making me look good!
author: Nancy S.

description: The sushi is decently priced and I've never had to wait more than 5 minutes for a seat. I like it.
author: Mitzi Y.

description: I'm a value hunter and I think the portions and price outweigh the authenticity and flavor. The prices are great considering you're in the city. My Japanese friend didn't like it (but he's picky) but my other friends enjoyed the meal. I'd say its worth an occasional trip out here for some value food.
author: Jonathan Y.

description: My favorite sushi place in the city.  Despite the humble decor, their food is magic.  I won't be saying anything that hasn't been said before... free green tea, edemame and always a smile of recognition (we think) from the manager.  Pick some rolls or nigiri from a long list or go with a traditional dinner.  We ALWAYS get the 49er roll- with  salmon, tuna, scallops and slivers of fresh lemon on the top.  So good.  We sat at the "traditional" seating area for the first time and it was a nice change from the dinner table.  Take off your shoes and sit on the floor- it was pretty sweet. Definitely try to go here for if you're out west, craving sushi and are tight on cash.
author: Allison G.

description: Super cheap and vurry tasty. Very simple, with kinda sticky tables, but getting a $35 combo that filled 4 people negates that.
author: Julie B.

description: This is what I call "cheap Sushi", and the place I go to when I want decent sushi at a great price.  Everything here is pretty good, fish is fairly fresh, and they give you a decent amount with nigiri.  The Teriyaki dishes and Tonkatsu are done well also.  The best thing besides the friendly service and great prices is that they give you ice cream as part of all entrees.
author: Kapeli M.

description: I like this one a little more then the Noriega one, but its still not as good as the Taraval one. This one the sushi is a lil better and the place is a lot more low-key so it should get an extra .5 star for no waiting.
author: Dustin L.

description: We had the chef choose our sushi, and we were in for a treat. A huge array of nigiri (20 pieces), 3 special rolls of unusual flavors, and we even got some extra toro (such creamy goodness). Very fresh, and reasonable prices. It cost only $35 each for all that food + sake.
author: Joy C.

description:
came here with a friend who lives down the street.  ordered too much, didn't realize how big the rolls were and I was feeling like Udon...so spicy tuna and a spider rainbow roll...way too much food for me...but so tasty...and the prices were pretty reasonable.

The place is pretty quaint...family owned and run...it was pretty empty when we got there around 6, but was packed by the time we left...so I think that's a good sign...

definitely will come again when I visit my friends...:)
author: Christina L.

description: 4.5 Stars! Yum and double yum. It's plain here...no fancy rolls or crazy sauces. Just good sushi, HUGE portions (even their nigiri slices are large!) and nice people.  Oh, and did I mention the prices? It's totally the best deal in town. 2 people can get STUFFED here for around $30, $40 if you want to drink some sake and beers. Trust me, if you come here, you will be glad. And I don't know why it is, but they have the best, most meaty soft-shell crab I've ever tasted, and I've tasted a lot. Closed on Mondays though :(
author: Eryn S.

description: I love this sushi restaurant.  The hamachi and salmon sushi comes in huge slice that is fresh and yummy.  Not only is the food very good, the service is friendly and the price is more that reasonable.  I eat here at least a few times a month, sometimes more.
author: Stanley T.

description:
I haven't visited this place for at least a year but have visited this place at least once a week a for two years until I moved out of SF.

Everything here is decently priced and service is usually fast.  My favorite is the dinner sashimi or I would just order nigiri and rolls.  Dinner combo C (the one with soft shell crab) is also a good deal.  I like this place over Taraval Okazuya because it's cleaner, less crowded, has better service, and better fish.  This is another reason wny I missed not living in SF!
author: jenny t.

description: Every time I eat here it makes me proud to live in the Sunset. They take their sushi seriously, but they aren't pretentious about it. Whether you're planning a reasonably priced celebratory night out, or just need a quick dinner and can't think of anything else, you can choose your own adventure. The portions are generous, service is friendly and low-key, and the prices are affordable. Be sure to check the "specials" board. It ain't much to look at, but who cares. The fish is great!
author: Skott B.

description: Their fish is hellla good Hamachi and Salmon just melts in your mouth Especially the Hamachi The rolls are basic most are good some are ok but this is a great place to go in the sunset area!
author: Nancy P.

description: If you want generous, fresh, SLABS of yellowtail, new specials every day, and a shockingly low tab, visit Tazaki's, run by a cheerful local family.  The food does not strive to stand out and wow you; but it's a good place to eat 'at home' without cooking.  Ask what fish is best today and they'll tell you.  I'm not partial to the beef - too fatty. No frills, but not a hole in the wall feel either.
author: Laura C.

description: Awesome and super fresh fish and great staff too! Ordered the sushi and sashimi combo number 1 along with the volcano roll with a friend and we both walked away stuffed and happy! If you want fresh sushi without any attitude this is a great place to go.
author: Julian R.

description: this is a great place.  food is delicious and the staff is very friendly.  they even brought me tea while i was waiting for my to-go order.  not overly priced either.
author: sarah w.

description: Well I eat in the sunset as much as I can,since I use to live in this community for about 10 years,Me and the little lady tried this place and liked it!  only thing I noticed is the tempura had a chaulkey taste to it. Oh and beware of the broken front door!!!!!!!!!!!  gourmet ghetto dude!
author: oscar t.

description: I was here for a family dinner the other night. We order 6 rolls of sushi, some soft shell crab, tonkatu, sahimi, udon, teriyaki  and they were all good. service was good and the restrant was clean.
author: william w.

description:
I started going here when it first opened and loved it. I think my taste has improved because I will probably not go back. Granted I did not have sushi the last time I came and I was told that it was good, but my gripe is that I believe that the teriyaki sauce on my beef teriyaki was a store bought sauce and not made by the restaurant. To me that's a big deal!
Service and staff is pleasant though.
author: k d.

description:
While this is not a fancy sushi place, it totally satisfies the craving.  I really like the Combo Box A.  
This is a great family place.
author: M F.

description: Pretty good sushi in the outer sunset.  The fish was fresh and that is all you can ask for at the price.  The best part of our meal was the oysters they had on special.  We live in the outer sunset and would return there, but we certainly would not go out of our way to go back.
author: Leo S.

description:
i give this place 4 stars because of their pricepoint and food quality. there are very few places, if any, that offer a DINNER combo box for $9.95. i tend to eat alot as i love japanese food and that box fills me up. $9.95 makes me even happier where most pther places charge at least $15. its just too bad that they are located in a place where there might not be much publicity. 

loved sitting in their tatami room too.

their sushi is ok. ok as in presentation. taste is great. definitely can be presented better but who cares because it all goes down the same. caterpillar rolls dont look as fancy as more expensive places. tuna tekka maki isnt uniformly made and served (each piece looks different...a homemade feel if you like that compared to other restaurants where it looks machine made without flaws) but its cheap for 6 pieces!

come here hungry for japanese food because you will get your moneys worth!
author: Kyle Z.

description: Wow. That's all I can say...I have, up to now, been very dedicated to Shimo #1 on Clement, with Shimo #2 on Taraval as a standby for convenience. However, I just moved WAY out in the Sunset, and last Friday evening, after shlepping the last of our things to the new place, my boyfriend, David, our dear friend, Symon, and I decided to try the nearby Sushi spot. I was SO impressed! Granted, I prefer ordering directly from the sushi chef rather than filling out the little form, but, aside from that detail, I was thrilled with our meal. I love white tuna and hamachi sashimi, and I have rarely found it so pristinely, mouth-wateringly fresh as ours was. The nigiri sushi was equally fresh and generously proportioned. Another great favorite of mine is tobiko with quail egg. Normally, this is created with a seaweed wrap, but at Tazaki, it came with a combination of tobiko and black caviar, wrapped in a thin piece of tuna. Exquisite! There is a generous and varied selection of rolls, and many varieties of sake. The service was cheerful and efficient. I feel so fortunate to have discovered this gem, and to have it so near - within walking distance. Parking would not be too bad, but might take a couple of turns around the block...WAY worth it, though. I'll be back again and again
author: Angela M.

description: I had to go to this place twice before reviewing it because there were so many 5 starers and great things said.  I'm sorry, but I have to say that I'm quite convinced that this place is not worth my going and I would not recommend it.  The family atmosphere someone mentioned is indeed true however.  But that's about as far as this place impressed me.  The soybeans (only served at dinner) were too salty, and my udon was not even made of real Japanese noodles.  My egg in the udon was also half raw and the soup was not hot enough to make it done.  I've had the sashimi and a roll as well and I can say that both times the fish was not fresh.  If you do not have a real mouth for sushi (which can be a very finicky thing) and are on a tight budget, this may be a place where you can chow down.  For someone like me who craves really good and fresh sushi along with other crisp japanese dishes, I cannot say I would lead you to here.
author: Sokokyu K.

description: Sushi is good and reasonably priced. The complimentary green tea and edamame during the meal definitely puts this place above "budget sushi." Only been there a couple times but each time has been enjoyable. Family, community atmosphere here as opposed to some of the upscale, hip sushi places you will see downtown. Teriyaki dinners available for under $10.
author: Will C.

description: The best part about this place is that it is cheap.  The rolls are like 4-6 and even the shushi and sashimi runs cheap.  The service is a little awkward and I kind of feel like I'm eating at someone's house when there.  They don't have anything out of the ordinary and their food doesn't taste out of the ordinary.  But it is close to my house, they make their food pretty quick, and they like me because I tip well.  I will continue to go here for cheap convenient sushi everytime I don't feel like driving to a better place.  By the way, is it Okazu Ya or Tazaki or both???
author: Chris H.

description: I love this place!  It's my favorite go to sushi restaurant in SF.  It's a neighborhood gem.  The staff is very nice & service is always quick in a relaxed friendly atmosphere.  The sushi is really good & always fresh.
author: Heather C.

description: I have gone here a few times and won't be back. It is not really because of the food, but the service. We went here and were ignored by the wait staff. when we wanted to pay it took over 30 minutes and my wife had to leave it took so long. The fish is good, not great, but good. The first time we went we were given the back room and the owners came by and were really nice. Service was slow, but it was fine, the next time, and final, we spent over 1 1/2 hours waiting around for a small order of food, that was not that spectacular. So i would say if you don't care about waiting and are in the area go by, but don't expect to leave there any time soon.
author: Aaron S.

description: Superb! Sushi and Sashimi are top quality at a reasonable price (don't tell Tazaki!). Tazaki takes his sushi, oysters seriously and the quality shows. Also a great selection of cold saki's. A very family place with not much atmosphere (but your here to eat, right?!) but the staff makes up for that in spades. Very reasonable in terms of other foods (cooked Japanese). Where else do you get a free bowl edamane when sitting down? They don't even have it on the menu so more is on the house too. I have eaten at Sushi Ran and other 'quality' places of 2-3x the price range and Tazaki rates higher in terms of fish and food; you just are not paying for the decor at Tazaki. Very accommodating to those aged 2 to 82.
author: Ms. E.

description: I abosolutely love this p;ace! I used to come here at least once a week when i lived closer, but still try to make it out every few weeks or so. It's so good, and you can't beat the prices. Plus, i love that because of my predictability, i never have to order. They alread know what i want when i walk in the door. The staff has always been friendly and nice, and i've been coming here for over 3 years now. not bad if you ask me!
author: Grace H.

description: The food is good, but the enviroment pretty bad. They allowed the kids run all over the place. To day I went with my wife for dinner. There were three kids chasing  each other around the restaurant. One of the kid even bump on our table and spilt all the tea and food over us. That customer and the owner not even apologized .Even other customer complained and told them to stop the kids chasing each  other around the plaace. Their service is good but slow.This place usually is good, but I guess not any more.
author: Johnny C.

description: Five star sushi at a reasonable price.  Fresh nigiri. The fish platters are great too.   It can get crowded on weekends but the service is always good.
author: John C.

description: This cute sushi joint has very fresh fish!  The hamachi is melt in your mouth delightful. The sashimi is exceptional - they have high standards for just about everything they serve. Even their edamame tastes world-class to me. The place is located close to my house, and I'm happy that it's there!
author: Hester M.

description: the food is average, the price is reasonable, but the service is very poor. The udon arrived first, then came the shrimp tempura. we requested for the tempura sauce, and the lady (who might be the wife of the owner) told us to use the udon soup. she specifically said, "It's just the same". well, of course we didn't relent and still requested for the tempura sauce. Then, when the bento boxes and the sushi came, we asked for small plates. The same lady came back with the plates, but surprisingly added, "you asked for these (the plates) when you had these (the miso soup bowls)". we were so flabbergasted. it was such a disappointing experience. i don't know what's wrong with this lady, but we have never been to a japanese rest. with such poor service.
author: Jeff N.

description: I come here at least once a week, sometimes twice.  It is my favorite sushi restaurant in the city. The dragon rolls are awesome! The nigiri is fresh and the pieces are huge and priced right. The service is quick and friendly.
author: Kelly A.

description: I got the tenzaru (tenpura and cold soba noodles) dish for takeout last night and was so disappointed. The five pieces of tenpura were good, though I felt like the portion was small for the price, however, the soba was awful. It tasted like it had been sitting in a refrigerator for one or two days and was rubbery and kind of stale. For a dollar more I could get the same dish from Mifune in Japan town with larger portions, fresh soba, and a little salad too.
author: Lena B.

description: the 49er roll is my favorite! these guys have a family run business and it's like you're part of it. it's awesome that they're open until 11 on the weekends
author: duane l.
